story:
Our Story

On Tuesday night, February 28th,  Satchel's Pizza caught fire.   As soon as we saw smoke, we got everyone out of the building and called 911.  The fire department arrived and spent hours hacking at the roof and looking for the fire.  The ceiling in the kitchen has been vaulted so the fire was just creeping around in small cavities looking for air.  The firefighters found the fire. They pumped water in the walls. They saved the place from burning to the ground.  A big thanks to the folks who fought our fire.  Gainesville Fire Department rules! 

This event leaves approximately 50 people unemployed until repairs can be done.  Unemployment compensation pays a fraction of folks wages.  Employees have house payments and kids to support.  We've created this forum for folks to contribute to help the employees pay their bills while we put the kitchen and roof back in order. 

The Impact

You have bills.  You know the deal.  If you lost your job tomorrow, how would you pay the rent?  The community is going nuts wanting to help us. "What can we do?"  "How can we help?"  This is a very real way you can show your support for our pizzeria and for the folks who make it happen every day. 

What We Need & What You Get

We plan to take the last few months of employee income data and distribute any funds we receive in the same manner to the employees. The more you made at Satchel's, the more you will make from this campaign.  if we reach our goal we pay 4% to this site via their guidelines. if we do not reach our goal we pay 9%.  100% of all funds not going to Indie Go Go will go to employees. If you give MORE than our goal, then more money gets to those who work at Satchel's.  Our payroll is about $27,000 every 2 weeks.  We don't know how long we will be closed but we know we will work hard to open as soon as we can. 

Check out the perks for donating.  We will have to get creative on how we give away the rewards so we don't get swamped on day 1.   If you donate we will contact you with a time frame for when you can cash in your reward. We are thinking that we will give out rewards to a certain number of people per week so we aren't overwhelmed.  If you can't make it in that week we will work with you.  We are just a local family business after all. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you are out of work or tight on funds yourself.  You can still help by sharing this with friends and helping us get the word out.  You can also help by checking our facebook page and coming to see us when we re-open.  Thanks.  The community has been awesome.  Everyone is asking to help and wishing us well.  It warms my heart.

story:
Please help us keep this free service funded for families across the world!

As an alternative to long hours away from home and expensive daycares, we support those who wish to bring their careers home. Work-at-home moms and dads have made a selfless choice to earn a smaller salary for double the workload, in exchange for the freedom to be able to put their families first, while still being able to provide for them. The volunteer staff members of Our Milk Money work tirelessly and passionately for this incredible movement!

What is OurMilkMoney.com?

Our Milk Money is a not-for-profit organization that lists the products and services of thousands of family owned businesses across the country.

A community resource dedicated to helping parents who want to stay at home, our mission is to empower and educate communities of moms and dads. By using our consumer power to make purchases from one another, we support our choice to put our family before our career.
Our institutional ethos is built around a common goal to provide for our children. In this society, the average family is faced with a challenge to provide for their families with no less than two incomes. The Parents of the Our Milk Money Organization (Pommos) are making sacrifices, leaving their large corporate salaries and making a commitment to raising their own children.
Through the unity that Our Milk Money provides, we are able to reinvent ourselves as parents and entrepreneurs, adequately embrace our family values, and support one another by working towards a lasting solution. Our rationale is based on a concept that brings the community of self-employed parents together: By purchasing each other's products and services and by promoting our unity as an organization, we are working together towards a vibrant change in the choices we make as consumers. It is up to us to fully appreciate the VALUE of who we choose to purchase from. Please join us in supporting the parents who have chosen  to earn alternative revenue for their family by bringing their careers home.
Visit us here on our website and learn more.

What have we achieved so far?


The OurMilkMoney.com search directory began with an idea based on one mom's own experiences.

As not to deprive my children of my daily presence, I searched for a solution that would allow me to replace my corporate salary by earning a revenue working from home. Fortunately, living in the superior age of technology has created more and more opportunity for this ambition. I realized that by uniting with other parents who felt the same way, and utilizing our powers as consumers TOGETHER,  we would be able to create more opportunities for ourselves as parents and as entrepreneurs.
As I began to explore these visions and shape them into a solution, I decided to do a bit of research. I was curious as to how others felt about the situation and whether or not there was a real need for what I wanted to put into motion. The response to my idea was astounding. Hundreds of letters from self-employed parents came flooding in from across the country asking how to get involved, where to sign up, and what could be done to ensure OurMilkMoney.com’s success. I was overwrought not only with the enormity of the responses, but the blatant urgency that came with each inquiry. I discovered how much people needed to believe in this prototype, and how it gave them a new perspective of hope. Complete strangers were informing me of their own personal struggles and of what the success of OurMilkMoney.com might mean for their families.


"I knew that OurMilkMoney.com needed to succeed, and I have known it every day since."


OurMilkMoney.com began to grow with it's first goal: To help parents see that they DO have a choice, and that they are not alone in wanting more for their children. Our Milk Money would become a tool to help parents find financial opportunities and support.
The second goal for OurMilkMoney.com: To educate the average consumer on the value of purchasing from a self-employed parent, as well as to provide the consumer with an effortless way of accessing the businesses just as efficiently as conducting any online search.
The third and final goal in reaching that destination: We aim to empower one another, set a good example by purchasing each other’s products and services, and pass our funds back and forth in our own mini-economy. By making a commitment to one another, we knew that others would see the benefit and want to be a part of our community.

 

Why do we need your contribution?


It was important to us that we encompass certain aspects in our site that provide an overall sense of trust and support. We originally charged an annual membership fee but decided it was working against our true integrity and desire to support parents. We have discussed obtaining financing through advertising dollars from larger companies -- but that still seems contradictory to our mission. Clearly, the companies that can afford those kinds of ads don’t need our help to advertise their products or services. The self-employed parents, with low advertising budgets do, which is the function of the Our Milk Money business search engine. Because our site needs basic funds in order to simply stay operational, we are accepting donations from anyone who wishes to contribute. We are in the process of researching private funding and grants as well as affiliate programming and partnerships.  Because we are successful in attracting a good amount of traffic by consumers, members see the value in joining our community.

Currently, the site is earning just enough to maintain itself, but not enough to grow. Since it does not earn a profit, we rely on the volunteers that contribute their time, energy and expertise into keeping the site fully functional. The staff members are stay-at-home moms who work tirelessly to keep the business directory afloat. Its time for us to give back to these altruistic volunteers by paying them $50 a month for their heart, their passion and their time. In addition, these extra funds will allow us to pay for much needed upgrades to the site, stay fully functional and exposed through social media outlets, as well as use cutting-edge technology to promote the self-employed parents listed in the business directory.

The staff members are:

Ally Loprete, Founder and CEO, Host of This Little Parent Stayed Home Radio Show
Julianne Alvarez-Wish, Communications Director Stephanie Anderson, Booking Producer of This Little Parent Stayed Home Radio Show
Wendy Conte, Finance Director
Roz Walker, Social Media and Networking Director
Anna Marie Martin, Webmaster
Amy Beth Pitcher, Membership Director
Mandy Kalish, Sales and Marketing Director


How can you help?


We welcome any type of contribution that you want to make.


➔  If you are a self-employed parent, the first thing you should do is list your products and services on OurMilkMoney.com. Its easy and free!


➔  Visit the OurMilkMoney.com business directory to shop. We don’t collect a commission so you can be sure that 100% of your hard-earned dollars will go directly to the family that you purchase from.


➔  Help spread the word about our campaign! Share it with other parents you know in your community, as well as non-parents. Every bit of exposure helps!


➔ Post, blog, tweet and speak about us and our mission. If you do this, you are fantastic and the world deserves to know! Please use the Indiegogo share tools for all of this – that way, our campaign gets even more exposure via the Indiegogo platform.


You want to make a contribution but you have neither a paypal account nor a credit card?

No problem! Simply contact info@ourmilkmoney.com  


What will you get in return?


We will be your best friends forever. Seriously.


Whether you donate money,  or just join the organization by listing your product or service on the directory, you will be contributing to something dynamic and innovative. Every ounce of support contributed to the moms and dads in our communities who are looking to spend more time with their children.

Skim Milk: $1 (yes, really! Every dollar helps!)

  • Annual membership
  • Mention on Contributors page


1% Low Fat Milk: $25

  • Annual membership
  • Mention on Contributors page
  • Shout out on Facebook and Twitter
  • Spotlight Interview



2% Low Fat Milk: $50

  • Annual membership
  • Mention on Contributors page
  • Shout out on Facebook and Twitter
  • Spotlight Interview
  • Mention in Newsletter
  • Banner on Website Directory in 1 chosen market

  • Annual membership
  • Mention on Contributors page
  • Shout out on Facebook and Twitter
  • Spotlight Interview
  • Banner on monthly newsletter to 10,000
  • Banner on Website Directory in 1 chosen market
  • 1 minute Host Endorsement on National Radio Show to 20,000 monthly listeners
  • 3 Radio Show Ads at 30 seconds

  • Annual membership

  • 1 minute Host Endorsement on National Radio Show to 20,000 monthly listeners
  • 10 minute interviewed appearance on This Little Parent Radio Show
  • 5 Radio Show Ads at 60 seconds



Buttermilk: $1000

  • Annual membership
  • Mention on Contributors page
  • Shout out on Facebook and Twitter
  • Banner on on monthly newsletter to 10,000 for 6 months
  • Spotlight Interview
  • Banner on Website Directory in 5 chosen markets
  • 3 minute Host Endorsement on National Radio Show to 20,000 monthly listeners
  • 10 minute Interviewed appearance on This Little Parent Radio Show
  • 10 Radio Show Ads at 60 seconds
  • Vendor Table at Annual Parent Business Conference June 2013



Chocolate Milk: $5000

  • Annual membership
  • Mention on Contributors page
  • Banner on on monthly newsletter to 10,000 for 6 months
  • Spotlight Interview
  • Banner on Website Directory in 25 chosen markets
  • 3 minute Host Endorsement on National Radio Show to 20,000 monthly listeners
  • 20 minute Interviewed appearance on This Little Parent Radio Show
  • 25 Radio Show Ads at 60 seconds
  • Vendor Table at Annual Parent Business Conference June 2013 and honorable mention by host
  • Ad placement on inside binder conference

story:
Our Story

We (Nicole Brennan and Megan Moss) are first year university students at The University of Western Ontario. We have always enjoyed volunteering with children and decided we would like to contribute to a community less fortunate than our own. That is why we are going to South Africa on May 6th, 2012 for 2 weeks, to volunteer in an orphanage through an organization called International Volunteer HQ. As previously mentioned, we are university students with limited funds. This is why we need your help so that we can help others. Any donations are greatly appreciated.


The Impact

Some of the children we will be working with have lost their parents to crime, alcohol, drug abuse and HIV/Aids, which means the children have to live with relatives or neighbours who sometimes do not take proper care of the children. By volunteering at the orphanage, we will be taking proper care of these children that have difficult pasts and minimal personal relationships. Without our help, the orphanage would not be capable of taking on as many children because they would not be able to afford the workers. Consequently, many children would be left alone or in the care of under qualified guardians which often leads children down the wrong path later in life due to insufficient guidance and care.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to volunteer at the orphanage in South Africa, we will need approximately $2500. The breakdown or this price is as follows:

- $230 for registration fees - this includes 24/7 support from IVHQ staff, program marketing costs, information pack, administration costs, travel costs to inspect programs and communication costs with volunteers. 


 - $600 for the 2 week volunteer program - this includes Airport pick up, orientation, program supervision, accommodation and meals during volunteer placement period, In-country 24/7 support and In-country administration costs.

 

- $1500 (approx.) for a round trip flight

 

- $170 (estimated) for additional costs - this includes travel insurance, vaccinations, police checks, transportation while there

 

* Any additional funds will go towards supplies for the children such as books, arts and crafts, toys, etc.


Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to donations, please share our cause with others! This can be done through word of mouth and through the share tool! Thank you so much for all your help!

story:
Note that contributions to the Kiva Fellow(s) on Indiegogo are not donations to Kiva and consequently, Kiva is not able to issue a tax receipt for these donations.

My Story

In about one month, I will embark on a journey to Nairobi, Kenya, where I will spend the coming three months as a Kiva Fellow. Kiva is a non-profit organization with a mission to alleviate poverty. They are helping low-income entrepreneurs, who lack access to traditional banking systems, to get access to capital and work their way out of poverty through micro lending.

The first time I heard about Kiva was during my Economic Development studies, when writing my Master Thesis about how microfinance targeted towards women can lead to higher gender equality. I was instantly amazed by the brilliant idea that Kiva was built on and in January this year I made my first loan on the Kiva website (www.kiva.org). Now, nine months later I have been accepted to the Kiva Fellows Program to help increase Kivas impact around the world and I could not be more excited.

During my stay in Kenya I will be working with the two newest and most innovative aspects of Kiva’s model – non traditional partners and Kiva Zip. Kiva Zip is testing new ways and techniques with the goal of expanding their reach to unserved populations and drive down the cost for the borrower. My main task at the two non-traditional field partners (Brazafric and Honey care) will be to help them implement sustainable and efficient Kiva processes.

Where you come in

The Kiva Fellow is an unpaid, volunteer position designed to increase Kiva's impact and to offer participants a unique insider experience in the world of microfinance. With a little bit of your support, together we can help to make an impact.

I will be extremely happy and thankful for all the help I can get. I have calculated that my Fellowship will cost approximately $6000 dollars with airfare, accommodation, Visa, immunization and travels within the country to meet with borrowers. Any amount you can contribute will be influential.

If you can’t contribute, don’t worry, there are other ways to help.

First of all you can go to Kivas website www.kiva.org, and spread the word about the organisation You can scroll through the entrepreneurs and their profiles, and help these people to create a better life for themselves and their families, through a loan as small as $25. You can also help by spreading the word about my campaign to friends and family!

 

To learn more go to www.kiva.org/fellows


Thanks a lot for your support!

My main task at the two non-traditional field partners (Brazafric and Honey care) will be to help them implement sustainable and efficient Kiva processes.
Where you come in
The Kiva Fellow is an unpaid, volunteer position designed to increase Kiva's impact and to offer participants a unique insider experience in the world of microfinance. With a little bit of your support, together we can help to make an impact.
I will be extremely happy and thankful for all the help I can get. I have calculated that my Fellowship will cost approximately $6000 dollars with airfare, accommodation, Visa, immunization and travels within the country to meet with borrowers. Any amount you can contribute will be influential.
If you can’t contribute, don’t worry, there are other ways to help.
First of all you can go to Kivas website www.kiva.org, and spread the word about the organisation You can scroll through the entrepreneurs and their profiles, and help these people to create a better life for themselves and their families, through a loan as small as $25. You can also help by spreading the word about my campaign to friends and family!
 
To learn more go to www.kiva.org/fellows
 Thanks a lot for your support!

story:
Let's Be Well RED was started for one reason: to combat anemia in India. As a thalassemia minor, Rajvi has a low level of iron in her blood and thus, hearing about the millions of people in India (75% of the Indian population) that were suffering from anemia just as she did, made her think of what she could do. So as a college junior, she started Let's Be Well RED, an initiative that makes iron-rich nutritional bars and works with high school students to spread awareness about this important condition that deprives the body of energy, hindering any kind of mental or physical activity. Because GudNeSs, our nutritional bar, provides children with the daily necessary amount of iron to be healthy in a natural way, we can help children with a nutritional supplement that will help them have enough energy to concentrate in class or play with their friends. Without a natural source of iron, parts of our body is deprived of oxygen!!
 
In the past year, we have come up with a nutritious, yummy and affordable nutritional bar, sold over 30,000 bars and have recruited 96 high school students in Mumbai that talk to other students in other schools about iron deficiency anemia. 
 
We have received great support from different schools in Mumbai and the demand for the bars just keeps going up! However, we now have one issue: our production cannot keep up with the demand. We have received demands from single customers of up to 20,000 bars per month and currently, we can only make 5,000 bars per day. Additionally, as we continue to work in Mumbai, we now have other college volunteers working in the state of Gujarat too, making our demand even larger.
 
However, Rajvi's dream is to combat anemia and be able to make the solution available to everyone in India. The more bars we produce, the more we can subsidize and the more lives we can save from anemia.
 
The solution? Expand our production. We need a new packaging machine and a new production machine that will help us produce more bars in India. The production machine will help us produce 25,000 bars per day and the packaging machine will help us package 15,200 bars per day. So with these two machines we'll be able to help up to 7 times more people than before!
 
If we are able to produce more bars, we'll be able to help more anemic children and as result improving their lifestyle. We'll be able to help them be healthy enough to play with friends, finish high school and we'll be able to help other anemic family members all over India have enough energy to provide for them. 
 
This machinery is however very expensive, the packaging machine costing $10,000 and the production machine $8,000, but any contribution to our cause is huge. Any amount can help us get much closer to our dream. 
 
Other ways you can help? Spread the word! Share our passion for our cause and like us on Facebook! Any questions? Email us! letsbewellred@gmail.com

story:
AS FEATURED IN:

 

 

DEMO-DAY PITCH @ CRYSTAL BRIDGES

SCREENSHOT GALLERY

THANKS FOR THE SUPPORT!

Why YOU are here?

Things kicked off for our team in March when we launched our first project, Seeds That Feed, and introduced our CareCropping program to Fayetteville, Arkansas. With a handful of amazing people and $50 in seed funding, we were able to witness firsthand the power of an idea mixed with a sense of purpose and executed with passion through action. To date, we have collected and distributed over 16,000 pounds of fresh produce to local food pantries and meal programs in a community in which 37% of our food insecure are children.


Today we present to you our second project, SpareTime. Much like Seeds That Feed, SpareTime started as an idea mixed with a sense of purpose and executed with passion through action. This past August, SpareTime was selected out of 83 applications globally to participate in the ARK Challenge*. This 14 week intensive, mentorship-driven bootcamp for technology startups was meant to put our idea to the test. In the past 3 months, we have sat across from authors, CEOs, CTOs, Directors of all sorts, highly successful entrepreneurs and seasoned investors—all with one topic of discussion, SpareTime.


It has been an amazing ride—one filled with 12 hour workdays and many sleepless nights. A ride that has surrounded us with some of the most successful people we will ever have the opportunity to meet and first class mentorship from some of the brightest minds we will ever have the privilege of knowing. A ride that has taken us into the offices of university officials and corporate leaders, put us face to face with Dr. Jane Goodall, and connected us with amazing individuals like Amanda Rose, Phoebe Espiritu, and Binh Tran. Lastly, it is a ride that has taken us to Crystal Bridges Museum of Art where we presented to over 200 potential investors and Arkansas Governor Mike Beebe. More importantly, it is a ride that places us here in front YOU.


So, here we are 14 weeks later with an idea that has come to fruition in the form of a validated platform for advancing social good.


SpareTime is meant for the community and this means it must pass one more test—that of the community at large. We know that we have the support of our family members, close friends, and even our mentors. However, beyond our inner circle is a community. We built SpareTime to serve the community and that includes every individual that has reached this page. Today, we seek your support in any shape or form you feel you can provide, whether that be a simple Facebook Like or Share, a follow or tweet, or your generous support through funding.   

 

What YOU Get?

$10 = Nominate an organization, church, or group for SpareTime beta + Sticker

 

$25 = SpareTime Bracelet + Sticker

 

 

 

 

 $50 = SpareTime Tee + Bracelet + Sticker

 

 

SpareTime for an Organization, Church, Group/Club + Tee, Bracelet, and Sticker

$100, $250, or $500 for 1 month, 3 months, or 1 Year

*per individual organization, church, group/club


*For these backers, we will provide an organization, church, group, or club of thier choice with the SpareTime platform. Each organization will receive unlimited access and use of the platform for the time period associated with the donation. Each backer will receive Impact Reports for the respective organization they have chosen to support. If the organization, church, group, or club is an accredited 501(c)3 or 501(c)6, SpareTime will work to arrange tax reciepts for the charitable contribution. 

 

SpareTime Advisory Board + Tee, Bracelet, and Sticker

$1,000 - (25 seats available)


SpareTime will create an Advisory Board consisting of backers who contribute $1000 or more. This group will be able to consult with our team and help us form important decisions affecting SpareTime's future. For those interested or for more information, please contact us directly at founders@gosparetime.com. (Attendence is required at 1 of 4 quarterly meetings)

 

 

About us

ARK Challenge Team video

In 2005, while working together at a local restaurant and attending the Walton College of Business, we began our partnership working side by side in a competitive environment. During this time, not only did we find a way to work collaboratively for both of our best interests, but we also laid the foundation of trust that has sustained us since. Our friendship continued to be cultivated because of our common interests, passions, and drive to make a difference.

Beginning again in 2009, our working relationship was rekindled upon the idea of SpareTime and our partnership was formed. While working full time jobs and further developing our concept for SpareTime, we launched Seeds that Feed and continue to watch it grow beyond our wildest expectations!

 

Aron Shelton is the Architect and Visionary of SpareTime–generator of new ideas, surveyor of the competitive landscape, and researcher who shapes and defines our position in the marketplace.

Alyssa Snyder is the Director and Marketer behind SpareTime–business and customer developer, scaler and analyzer of new ideas, organizer and strategic planner, and protector of our concept and user experience.

 

Advisors and Mentors

Jeannette Balleza
http://arkchallenge.org/portfolio/jeannette-balleza/
Wesley Wilson
www.linkedin.com/pub/wesley-wilson/3/429/34
Angela Oxford
www.linkedin.com/pub/angela-oxford/41/810/336
David Moody
http://arkchallenge.org/portfolio/david-moody/ 
Ted Dickey 
http://arkchallenge.org/portfolio/ted-dickey/
Kathleen Trotter 
www.linkedin.com/pub/kathleen-m-trotter/8/873/843
Jamie Fugitt
http://arkchallenge.org/portfolio/jamie-fugitt/ 
Don Bennett
http://tricyclefarms.com/about/ 

 

 

A SPECIAL THANKS


We have been supported and guided by truly amazing people. Below is a list of those who have helped mold SpareTime in some way, shape, or form. 


Adam Vanderbush, Adrienne Johnston Shaunfield, Airie Kazery, Alicia McCallen, Alena DeGrado, Alex Chalupka, Amanda Rose, Amy Robinson, Amy Stockton, Anay Shah, Andi-K Heart, Andrea Roberts, Angela Joanna and Chad Pollock, Joanna Newman, Joe Payne, John Colbert, Jon & Marcia Snyder, Jonathan (Yoni) Trope, Josh Clemence, Josh Souza, Judith Tavano, Julianne Dunn, Kathleen Trotter, Ted Dickey, Kathy Deck, Katie Wallner, Katy Ochoa, Keaton Smith, Ken and Carol Thomas, Kim Souza, Kris Katrosh, Kristen Snyder, Kristian Andersen, Laura Johnson, Lavada Walla, Lawson Hembree, Leo Smith, Leslie Peacock, Lincoln Vu, Lindsey Millar, Lioneld Jordan, Lisa Fury, Liz and Jerry Reece, Liz Slape, Lori Boatright, Lucy Kagan, Macon Speed, Margaret Thomas, Margot Jackson, Mark Brandon, Mark Tocco, Also, thanks to our furry companions Oskar, Oreo, and Toby :)

 

* (www.arkchallenge.org) Selected by the Department of Commerce Jobs and Innovation Accelerator Challenge as one of 20 projects nationwide to receive federal funding for the advancement of regional competitiveness, The ARK is a new mentorship-driven business accelerator program for technology startups. The ARK is a Winrock International, U.S. Programs, initiative in partnership with the University of Arkansas at Fayetteville and the NorthWest Arkansas Community College. It is made possible due to funding from three federal agencies, Economic Development Administration (EDA), the Small Business Administration (SBA) and Employment and Training Administration (ETA), as well as Winrock International, Gravity Ventures, Fund for Arkansas’ Future and Arkansas Development Finance Authority.

story:
Short Summary

This is a fundraiser to help our friend Crasis help deal with the immense amount of damages he suffered during the recent Hurricane Sandy. His home is now under toxic conditions the flood has caused, but he also has to deal with all the expenses of damages, storage fees, moving fees, and finding a new place to live.

 

What We Need

Just money, to assist Dan and his family with whatever they need it for to help them survive for the next few months. As always with Hurricanes, and sudden natural disasters, no one can ever be prepared to wake up one day and find your home in utterly unlivable conditions. This fundraisers entire goal is to make sure he can support his family, while handling the immense and sudden financial strain this has put on them.

The Impact

Any little bit will help. This is a enormous expense for him and his family to undertake, and while we don't expect this to buy him a house, any extra funds right now will help him get on the right track.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please just help us spread the word, as every little bit can and will help.

 

Disclaimer: this is a donation drive set up by Crasis's friends for the sole purpose of helping him through this terrible time. He has no direct involvement with the set up, or inception of this fundraiser.

story:
READ ABOUT BOOKS FOR SOLDIERS IN PEOPLE MAGAZINE

http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20617006,00.html

 

HOW IT STARTED

During the first Gulf War, several of my friends from school were in the reserves and were activated to fight the Iraqis. CNN reported that once the soldiers were deployed, they were faced with massive downtime and were restricted to their base due to the travel limitations set by the Saudi government.

I am a voracious reader and at the beginning of the Gulf War, I had a closet full of paperback books. Books that were not being used. So instead of selling them at the used book store, I packed them up in small care packages and sent them out to all the soldiers, sailors, marines and airmen I had addresses for.

Within a few weeks, I ran out of books before I ran out of addresses. Friends and family members began donating their paperback books and in the end I sent over 1000 books to the Gulf.

After the war, I received many thank-you notes from soldiers who got one of my books. Unless it was time for them to fly back home, mail-call days were one of the most anticipated events of deployment.

After September 11, I knew I wanted to do the same thing but I needed to develop a self-serve website. I couldn't do it all myself and BooksForSoldiers.com was born.

Regardless of why the military is deployed, the men and women of our armed services are there for us. They deserve our support and if we can make their deployment easier, then all the better.

OUR IMPACT

Last year we shipped over $2.7 million dollars in care packages (books, DVDs, music CDs, video games, tube socks, etc) to deployed US troops and to soldiers in military hospitals across the world and here in the US. Not too bad with an annual budget of $120,000.

A book can help with the long hours of down time and help take the soldier's mind off the horrors of war. We have had a few letters from troops crediting the books we shipped them as saving their lives and preventing some suicides.

BFS has all the problems of a dot com startup and a national charity. It is a 100% volunteer organization - no one gets a salary. Funds are used to pay for our datacenter fees, insurance, used books, DVDs, video games, postage, computers, software and a number of other things that tend to add up over the year.

BFS has been in continious operation since March 1, 2003 and we have been shipping ever since.

Your donation also goes to support our sister sites:

Bibles For Soldiers, College For Soldiers and our PTSD site, Support The Soldiers.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Our long standing policy has been if you cannot afford to donate, send a book instead. We all have books that could use another home. BFS posts new requests for books every day. You can join our community (http://booksforsoldiers.com/forum) and find a soldier to send a book to... and maybe make a friend for life.
 
Not a bad deal at all!
 
If you have a blog, Twitter or Facebook page, please consider posting this for your readers or even consider adding us to your links section.
 
Any and all help will be deeply appreciated.
 
Storm Williams
Founder/Executive Director
BFS
 
http://booksforsoldiers.com
http://biblesforsoldiers.org
http://collegeforsoldiers.com
http://supportthesoldiers.org/
http://booksforsoldiers.tumblr.com/
https://twitter.com/books4soldiers
story_txt:
READ ABOUT BOOKS FOR SOLDIERS IN PEOPLE MAGAZINE
http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20617006,00.html
 
HOW IT STARTED
During the first Gulf War, several of my friends from school were in the reserves and were activated to fight the Iraqis. CNN reported that once the soldiers were deployed, they were faced with massive downtime and were restricted to their base due to the travel limitations set by the Saudi government.
I am a voracious reader and at the beginning of the Gulf War, I had a closet full of paperback books. Books that were not being used. So instead of selling them at the used book store, I packed them up in small care packages and sent them out to all the soldiers, sailors, marines and airmen I had addresses for.
Within a few weeks, I ran out of books before I ran out of addresses. Friends and family members began donating their paperback books and in the end I sent over 1000 books to the Gulf.
After the war, I received many thank-you notes from soldiers who got one of my books. Unless it was time for them to fly back home, mail-call days were one of the most anticipated events of deployment.
After September 11, I knew I wanted to do the same thing but I needed to develop a self-serve website. I couldn't do it all myself and BooksForSoldiers.com was born.
Regardless of why the military is deployed, the men and women of our armed services are there for us. They deserve our support and if we can make their deployment easier, then all the better.
OUR IMPACT
Last year we shipped over $2.7 million dollars in care packages (books, DVDs, music CDs, video games, tube socks, etc) to deployed US troops and to soldiers in military hospitals across the world and here in the US. Not too bad with an annual budget of $120,000.
A book can help with the long hours of down time and help take the soldier's mind off the horrors of war. We have had a few letters from troops crediting the books we shipped them as saving their lives and preventing some suicides.
BFS has all the problems of a dot com startup and a national charity. It is a 100% volunteer organization - no one gets a salary. Funds are used to pay for our datacenter fees, insurance, used books, DVDs, video games, postage, computers, software and a number of other things that tend to add up over the year.
BFS has been in continious operation since March 1, 2003 and we have been shipping ever since.
Your donation also goes to support our sister sites:
Bibles For Soldiers, College For Soldiers and our PTSD site, Support The Soldiers.

 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Our long standing policy has been if you cannot afford to donate, send a book instead. We all have books that could use another home. BFS posts new requests for books every day. You can join our community (http://booksforsoldiers.com/forum) and find a soldier to send a book to... and maybe make a friend for life.
 
Not a bad deal at all!
 
If you have a blog, Twitter or Facebook page, please consider posting this for your readers or even consider adding us to your links section.
 
Any and all help will be deeply appreciated.
 
Storm Williams
Founder/Executive Director
BFS
 
http://booksforsoldiers.com
http://biblesforsoldiers.org
http://collegeforsoldiers.com
http://supportthesoldiers.org/
http://booksforsoldiers.tumblr.com/
https://twitter.com/books4soldiers

story: Our Dream
story_txt: Our Dream

story:
Our History:

 

 We are a small town Cafe in Pennsylvania. We offer the best espresso based drinks available and a great menu of baked goods, N.Y. Bagels, and extensive sandwiches. We are very much like a small, friendly Panera Bread with a personal touch. We have grown significantly in our second year. My wife and I have invested our life savings in this business. We have quickly become a pilar in the community, and have grown in double digits since our inception. We currently operate with 1-3 employees and family. We are open seven days and have WOWED every person we have encountered!.

Our Commitment:

 We have invested over 100,000 dollars in remodeling, build out, and improvements since opening. We are open seven days and oversee every aspect of operations. One of us are here at 5:30 every morning and at 9:00 p.m. every night. We are anchored here in the community, My wife is an elementary teacher at our local school, and all three of our children attend the school district. We are involved in Academics, Athletics, and mant extra-curricular activities. We have lived in this town for almost 18 years. All three of our children work within the business at least one-two days a week, and in the summer a bit more. We are commited to providing our customers a top notch experience whether it is just a cup of our fresh roasted coffee, or one of our inviting sandwiches. We have brought the Starbucks selection and variety to the small town.

 

Our Establishment: Not Just A Bean Cafe & Roastery

 We offer our customers the following:

1. Fresh roasted coffee, Espresso, Lattes, and cappuccinos.

2. Made to order Paninis, soups, salads, and baked goods

3. Fresh Baked N.Y. Bagels with an assortment of homemade spreads, and cream cheeses.

4. Roast to order Coffee, bagged and sealed on premise.

5. A complete line of Smoothies, and frozen coffee drinks (coffee free versions for the non coffee lovers).

 

Our Pitch:

 We need to raise 30,000 in capital to purchase our existing space and make a few equipment upgrades to better handle our steady increase in volume. Our lease is up and we are going to be faced with higher rent. There are two other income producing properties on premise and that income would go to us after our purchase. Our rent would then be zero due to the fact that the existing rent is already in excess of the mortgage. The current owner has agreed to finance the building for us at 4%. We have been here almost two years and have achieved steady growth. we have already invested over 100,000 to date and cannot easily obtain the down payment without resorting to high interest debt, which I will not resort to. This little shop is a winner and could easily be replicated in small towns accross the country.

story:
Short Summary

Who I Am

Name is Caleb Snell and I have been building and upgrading computers since I was 10. Recently I just amassed enough money to build a nice gaming computer and it runs anything I could want it to. Until recently when I wanted to start doing Youtube Commentaries. 

This campeign is designed so that I can raise money to upgrade my computer so I can create commentaries. For a while now i have wanted to do it, but I could never get my computer to run it. Not only can my computer not run Fraps and games without showing significant amounts of lag, my hard drive also fills very fast. This is the reason I need the upgrade for my comptuer. 

If I end up raising anywhere near or even half of my goal this would be of tremendous help to me. As I am 14, and the field that I would like to work in, it is hard to find a job for me. Any money that I could get would bring me closer to my goal making Youtube commentaries. 

How much money I need, and what you get in return. 

To meet my goal of getting all of the upgrades for my computer I need exactly one thousand dollars. All of the money that I receive will be going towards my computer so that I can make the commentairies. 

The first level for donations is something that everyone will get if they donated at all. You will get your name in all of my Youtube videos, or any other name you wish to put in there. 

The second level for donations is something that everyone will get if they donated twenty-five or more dollars. You will get a dedicated video to you. You will also receive your name in my youtube videos. 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

If I end up making all the money and are able to give my computer an upgrade, it would allow to me give commentaries and tutorials on youtube for people who are new. I am doing this because I knew how I started off on battlefield 3, which was pretty rough. Having tutorials is really helpful with battlefield 3.

story:
Short Summary

The Fruit of the Righteous Ministries has been empowering communities for the last three years through our breaking bread food ministry and spiritual teachings in the Camden, NJ and the Greater Philadelphia areas.Our ministry started by delivering a loaf of bread to famalies every monday and on every third Monday we deliver staples such as meat can goods,etc.  We are feeding the body and soul as followers of Christ.  Every Monday we deliver groceries to families in need; and on Sundays and Thursdays we offer "food for the soul" through the preaching and teaching of the Word of God.   We are partnering with Parkside United Methodist Church in conjuction with the NJ Food Bank and Camden County Board of Social Services.  We have grown to serve over 300 families to date. Due to the overwhelming need and growth of people in need of food assistance.Our goal is to increase the capacity to of giving to families in need of assitance.  Your contribution will enable us to strive to reach over 1000 or more low income families.   As Christ has stated in St. John 21:15 "Feed my lambs".

The Impact

In the city of Camden, NJ there is a great need to assist low income families through ministries such as ours--to provide relief and sustenance.  Your contributions will enable us to reach an ever growing population of low income families who are battling drug addictions, incarceration, unemployment and homelessness.  Given today's economy, it is crucial that everyone has access to healthy food regardless of their economic status.  Our goal is to be a model to other ministries that could make a great impact in impoverished areas globally.
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for taking the time to read  our message. Now you have a opportunity to help us make a impact on people's lives.Your monetary contributions are greatly appreciated, we thank you and love you. We would ask of you that if you know of any organizations or contributors that would be willingly to assist us in our efforts, please pass the word and give them our information. We invite all volunteers to support our endeavor. All gifts are greatly appreciated and we thank you in advance.

story:
Short Summary

 

  • Thank you for looking at my quest to help others.

 

  • My name is Chef Bruce. In September of 2011 my question was what can I do to help the homeless in my city. This quest became my personal vision and mission has been to help the voiceless and homeless men of Atlanta. I began with utilizing my education in culinary to prepare professionally catered meals for the homeless. At the time, I was using the Marta bus system to carry what I could, but was able to secure a vehicle. This allowed me to prepare larger meals and set up a table out of the trunk of my car. Many shelters provide basic meals; Men Stand’n Up provides a full menu cooked with excellence that includes salad, meats, starches plus fresh fruits, vegetables, deserts and drinks.

 

Our vision is to help men choose to make positive contributions to society by improving their lives and relationships through showing them a different way of life such as life skills, counseling and job readiness. We believe the way out of homelessness is working. We strive to reach those that shelters can not by being in the streets and helping directly. I stand for the ones that have been forgotten and remain voiceless.

 

  • Currently our goal is $20,000 to help the homeless

What We Need & What You Get

  • We provide help throughout the year, but the winter is the hardest on the homeless because many can no longer sleep in the streets. The shelters are overflowed and can not accept them. We help provide warmer clothing with hats, gloves, socks, shoes as well as bedding with sleeping bags etc.

 

  • Provide motel rooms and other forms of shelter to homeless

 

  • Our Facebook page is https://www.facebook.com/MenStandnUP

 

  • Perks for $5 include a personalized thank you e-mail from founder, Chef  Bruce (please provide your e-mail)

 

  • For $25 we will post your name on our contributors and special thanks page on our website or on our facebook page

 

  • We will be adding more and more perks as we are able. Kindly let us know if you or anyone has services/donations for a perk we would love to hear from you. Please e-mail us at: menstandnup@gmail.com

 

  • All donations will be used for the homeless and not for personal reasons.

The Impact

·         Your generous help will allow us to continue to feed and clothes those who are in need of our services.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell others about Men Stand’n Up – direct them to Indiegogo, http://www.menstandnup.org/  or https://www.facebook.com/MenStandnUP 
  • If you are in the Atlanta, Georgia area – and would like to help, we could use volunteers, secretarial and office helpers, board members for 501 c3 compliances, and non-perishable foods, necessities for the homeless, etc. – Please contact Chef Bruce at 510-579-1424 or e-mail at Menstandnup@gmail.com

story:
The MeSoap Story

Howdy! We're Mike and Garth, and we've co-founded MeSoap.

Every day 5000 children die needless deaths due to the lack of proper sanitation and clean water. This must stop. In response to these staggering numbers, we developed MeSoap — to bring life to communities that lack basic necessities by creating a company focused on giving back. For every bar or bottle of our organic soap purchased we donate a bar or its equivalent to children in need. Learn how, where, and more details about how we give at http://bit.ly/nsno7c.


We started with bar soap and now we're ready to launch liquid soap and need additional funding (this is where you come in) to get started. Same model — for every bottle of MeSoap organic liquid soap you buy, we will donate a bar of soap to a child in need. We hope you join us in our mission and help us raise the funds to move forward.

The MeSoap Impact

For every bar and/or bottle of MeSoap purchased we will donate a bar (or the equivalent) to a child in need. This is important — when soap is introduced into proper handwashing, water-related deaths can be reduced by upwards of 45%. You can play an important part this mission by participating. We need your support!



 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $6500 to help us in producing our new liquid hand soap, as well as, some annual operational expenses. We need to buy a bunch of bottles, pumps, labels, make some soap, get more insurance, re-subscribe to our UPCs, and pay the government their portion. It's pretty simple and a whole lot of good can be done for your generous contributions.

You can help on several levels — we've got rewards: bar soap, liquid soap, special thank yous, hand-written notes, and framed pictures of us handing out the soap that was a result of your contribution. The best part is, for every bar and/or bottle we send you we will also hand one out to a child in need!

Other Ways You Can Help

A little short on cash? Maybe you enjoy not being clean. Either way if you cannot or do not want to make a contribution in exchange for some soap then we'd sure appreciate it if you could at least get the word out. Just post the following messages on Twitter or Facebook:

Kill Germs and poverty! Help @MeSoap raise funds to grow their business and donate soap! Learn more: http://bit.ly/yFanNp.

Also, it'd be great if you could share our video:

See how buying @MeSoap can help others in need: http://bit.ly/rO3MZW

story:
Our Story


"Muslims definitely have a responsibility to our society, wherever we find ourselves."

- Imam Zaid Shakir


Lighthouse Mosque is located in Oakland, CA and is dedicated to the basic teachings of Islam and programs that benefit the local community. One of these programs, the Community Feeding Program, brings Muslims together every Saturday morning to distribute groceries and provide hot, Halal meals to over 200 low-income and homeless people each week.


$8,000 of funds raised will sustain the Community Feeding Program for an entire year.

$10,000 will help Lighthouse Mosque with the new renovation & general expenses.


It's been a busy year for Lighthouse! Check out this year's programs & projects:

  • Lighthouse Mosque is currently under renovation to accommodate more people for prayer & events: removing the kitchen, installing new carpet and painting the walls.

  • The Rahmah Foundation’s all-female Qur’an Memorization Program began this year. It is the first program of its kind in the Bay Area.

  • The 2011 Ramadan Program includes: Qiyaam & Itikaaf Program with Imam Zaid Shakir, Tarawih with Ebadur Rahman, weekly Iftars and talks every night & weekend Classes with Imam Abdul Latif.

  • Lighthouse Mosque also has many ongoing classes & programs:
    • NEW Tajweed Classes for men and women
    • NEW Tafsir Classes with Imam Abdul Latif Finch
    • NEW Seerah Intensive with Sheikh Ayub S. Haroun
    • The Rosebuds Halaqa, an enrichment program for girls age 10-16
    • Fiqh & Aqeedah classes with Shaykh Abdul Karim Yahya
    • Burdah Recitation every Thursday evening



 

The Impact


Your donation will:

  • Feed 200 low-income and homeless families in Oakland each week
  • Expand and beautify the prayer space
  • Invest in the educational & social experience of muslims within our community

Your generosity can reap infinite amounts of reward for you and provide sorely needed help to the greater community.


Testimony from Community Feeding Recipient:

"I’ve been coming here for the past 3 1/2 years. Ever since he [my son] was born, this is the way that I’m able to feed my family... because money does run out... All the staff here are just heaven sent, they really are. We have prayer with them even though we have two different faiths. God is God, it doesn’t matter. It is so beautiful; they pray, they bring in community speakers, they’re activists and they’re here to help us."  


A message from Imam Abdul Latif:

"Muslims cannot adequately bear the test of time in the United States without being organized. The Lighthouse Mosque has taken on the specific task of education and community activism.  Supporting such a cause is a practical undertaking of doing one's part in the grand scheme of this massive event termed 'American Islam.'"

 



What We Need & What You Get


Lighthouse Mosque - $10,000

The Lighthouse Mosque needs your help recovering the expenses from the recent renovation.  In order to create more room for prayer and make Jummah more comfortable, we’ve had to:

  • Remove and reconstruct walls
  • Re-level a portion of the floor
  • Install new carpeting
  • Install a new shoe storage system
  • Paint the walls

Your donation will help create a more comfortable prayer space for the people in this community and build a more solid financial foundation for the mosque inshAllah. 


Community Feeding & Hot Food Program - $8,000

The Hot Food Program needs between $150 - $200 each week to provide a variety of Halal meals to 200 low-income and homeless people: chicken & vegetables, veggie chili dogs, spaghetti and salad, or nachos with vegetables and ground beef. 


100% of your donation pays for food and food containers. There is no additional overhead cost.

$8,000 will keep the Community Feeding Program alive for an entire year inshAllah.


"A man asked the Holy Prophet, peace be upon him: What in Islam is best?  He answered: "To feed people and to greet everyone whether you know them or not."  

- Bukhari and Muslim



 

Other Ways You Can Help


Even $10 can make a difference! But we understand that not everyone can donate. In that case, Lighthouse Mosque and the Community Feeding Program always need volunteers. Please visit www.lighthousemosque.org for more information. 


Please spread the word! Forward this link to others and help us meet our goal.

Foundation’s all-female Qur’an Memorization Program began this year. It is the first program of its kind in the Bay
Area.The 2011 Ramadan Program
includes: Qiyaam & Itikaaf Program with Imam Zaid Shakir, Tarawih with Ebadur Rahman, weekly Iftars and talks every
night & weekend Classes with Imam Abdul Latif.
Lighthouse Mosque also has many ongoing classes & programs:

NEW Tajweed Classes
for men and women
NEW Tafsir Classes with
Imam Abdul Latif FinchNEW Seerah Intensive
with Sheikh Ayub S. HarounThe Rosebuds Halaqa,
an enrichment program for girls age 10-16
Fiqh & Aqeedah classes with
Shaykh Abdul Karim Yahya
Burdah Recitation every Thursday evening

 
The
Impact
Your donation will:
Feed 200 low-income and homeless families in Oakland each weekExpand and beautify the
prayer spaceInvest in the
educational & social experience of muslims within our community

Your
generosity can reap infinite amounts of reward for you and provide sorely
needed help to the greater community.
Testimony from Community Feeding Recipient:
"I’ve been coming here for the past 3 1/2 years.
Ever since he [my son] was born, this is the way that I’m able to feed my
family... because money does run out... All the staff here are just heaven
sent, they really are. We have prayer with them even though we have two
different faiths. God is God, it doesn’t matter. It is so beautiful; they pray,
they bring in community speakers, they’re activists and they’re here to help us."
 
A message from Imam Abdul Latif:
"Muslims cannot adequately bear the test of time in the
United States without being organized. The Lighthouse Mosque has taken on the specific task
of education and community activism.  Supporting such a cause is a practical
undertaking of doing one's part in the grand scheme of this massive event
termed 'American Islam.'" 
 
What
We Need & What You Get
Lighthouse Mosque - $10,000
The Lighthouse Mosque needs your help recovering the
expenses from the recent renovation.  In
order to create more room for prayer and make Jummah more comfortable, we’ve
had to: 
Remove and
reconstruct wallsRe-level a portion of
the floorInstall new carpetingInstall a new shoe
storage systemPaint the wallsYour donation will help create a more comfortable prayer
space for the people in this community and build a more solid financial
foundation for the mosque inshAllah.  
Community Feeding & Hot Food Program - $8,000
The Hot Food Program needs between $150 - $200 each week to
provide a variety of Halal meals to 200 low-income and homeless people: chicken & vegetables, veggie
chili dogs, spaghetti and salad, or nachos with vegetables and ground
beef.  
100% of your donation pays for food and food containers.
There is no additional overhead cost. $8,000 will keep the Community Feeding Program alive
for an entire year inshAllah.
"A man asked the Holy Prophet, peace be upon him: What
in Islam is best?  He answered: "To feed people and to greet everyone
whether you know them or not."  
- Bukhari and Muslim
 
Other
Ways You Can Help
Even $10 can make a difference! But we understand that not
everyone can donate. In that case, Lighthouse Mosque and the Community Feeding
Program always need volunteers. Please visit www.lighthousemosque.org
for more information. 

Please spread the word! Forward this link to others and help us meet our goal.

story:
Our Story

          The Torrie Foundation is a non-profit organization that focuses on the awareness and education of Lupus. The goal of the organization is to spread awareness and educate citizens of the disease, and to raise funds for research and to help families who are coping with the financial strain lupus has brought upon them. We plan on using the help of local doctors, lupus research scientists, Lupus sufferers, volunteers and financial donors to accomplish these goals.

The Torrie Foundation was started by Genesis Fitzgerald of Nashville, TN in 2011.  She started this foundation in honor of Shontoria “Torrie” Robinson. Torrie is a17 year old Nashville native who is suffering from Systemic Lupus Eurythmatosis (SLE). She is the daughter of Yolanda Myers who suffers from the chronic illness Diabetes and is also an amputee. Although Torrie has suffered a great deal from the disease, she has made a tremendous improvement in her health and now attends school full time at McGavock Comprehensive High School.

 

Why we need your help

          Lupus patients spend an average of $13,735 - $27,531 on medical care compared to $7,794 - $9,788 spent by those without Lupus. The cost rose to $29,034 - $62,651 if the Lupus patient has nephritis. Two of three Lupus patients reported a complete or partial loss of their income because they no longer are able to work fulltime due to complications of Lupus.

 

Symptoms of Lupus      

The most common symptoms of lupus, which are the same for females and males, are:

  • extreme fatigue (tiredness)

  • headaches

  • painful or swollen joints

  • fever

  • anemia (low numbers of red blood cells or hemoglobin, or low total blood volume)

  • swelling (edema) in feet, legs, hands, and/or around eyes

  • pain in chest on deep breathing (pleurisy)

  • butterfly-shaped rash across cheeks and nose

  • sun- or light-sensitivity (photosensitivity)

  • hair loss

  • abnormal blood clotting

  • fingers turning white and/or blue when cold (Raynaud’s phenomenon)

  • mouth or nose ulcers

Many of these symptoms occur in other illnesses besides lupus. In fact, lupus is sometimes called "the great imitator" because its symptoms are often like the symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis, blood disorders, fibromyalgia, diabetes, thyroid problems, Lyme disease, and a number of heart, lung, muscle, and bone diseases.


Other Ways You Can Help

As a donar of the Torrie Foundation, you and your company will benefit a great deal. Not only will your company receive great exposure from the publicity of the foundation, but will also be recognized as part of the Torrie Foundation’s support chain. Our goal as a foundation is to spread awareness and find a cure for Lupus. Therefore, teaming up with other companies and doctors will provide a platform that will make our vision a reality.

story:
There is no place like Oregon

"This book arises out of my own deep love for swimming the outdoors and my quests for places to swim wherever I have traveled. I can recall several times having been on the road and hot, pulling into a gas station or market and asking where the nearest good swimming hole was. Usually, I was met with a blank look by people who wanted to help but who did not have the foggiest notion where or how to direct me. This is my attempt to help folks find and enjoy one of the best pleasures of life with a minimum waste of time, energy and resources."

-Relan Colley

Oregon's Swimming Holes has been out of print since 1997. I know this because last summer I was looking for locations to swim with my family and just about every blog or comment referenced this book with the punchline, "it's out of print". When I couldn't find it at Powells I knew I was in trouble. A quick search through the Amazon found 5 copies of the book ranging in price from $70 - $175 dollars. I thought to myself this book must be the real deal.

Determined to get out and swim I figured I would look up Relan and see if he might be interested in bringing his book back for another generation of Oregon swimmers to enjoy.  Relan’s content is a perfect fit for an iPhone application and will enable folks to easily find Oregon’s best natural swimming holes.

Together we are working to convert the books original content to digital and integrate it with maps and location based search functionality to create a stunning user experience for outdoor enthusiasts living in or visiting the great state of Oregon.

What We Need

The purpose of this campaign is twofold. We would like to provide the opportunity for Indiegogo backers to receive the Oregon’s Swimming Holes iPhone app for up to half off of the release price. We will be using the proceeds to jump start development in April for a general release anticipated for July 4th 2013.

The first 100 backers of the project will be invited to participate in our beta tester program and will receive advanced versions of the application in early June.

What You Get

The application will include over 200 of the swimming holes listed in the original book. Relan has personally swum in every hole listed. Each entry includes the following detailed information:

  • Rating 5-10 (nothing under 5 was included in the book)
  • Location
  • Water quality
  • Vital Statistics
  • Setting
  • Swim Skill (great for those swimming with children)
  • Amenities
  • Entry fee
  • Driving instructions
  • Hiking instructions
  • Comments

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would rather wait until the general release of the application visit us at oregonswimmingholes.com and leave us your email address. We will contact you when we make it to the app store.

If you are as fired up about the project as we are tell your friends! See you in the water this summer.

 

Photo credits: All photos used by permission. Thanks Mulling it Over for the amazing shot of Trilliam Lake, DBerry2006 for the dreamy image of Scott Lake, marginscribbler's image of Three Polls, TheNewJane for images of Little Falls and Stanton Park. The app will be amazing becuase of their willingness to participate.

story:
From February 2014 to August 2014, I'll be traveling nearly halfway around the world to work with La Cocina a not-for-profit organisation which helps women from low income and immigrant communities who run informal food businesses from their homes, where I will be building the existing curriculum and conducting market research to make it easier for these women to set up brick-and-mortar food businesses. I'm asking for the support of my family, friends and anyone else inspired by my story to make this work possible. La Cocina provides these women with cheap kitchen rental, and what is essentially an intense food MBA to help them transition from an informal home business to a fully-fledged, legal food business. Our aim is to empower the women to move from an income patching casual job to an asset generating business where they are in control, where they feel empowered and can genuinely make a difference in their lives and their families as well.

About me

I’m a social enterprise and food enthusiast; and believe that a mix of the two is even better! I’m currently doing my undergraduate at the University of Bath, and studying here has allowed me to go on a journey exploring the social sector. It has shown me that it is possible to make money and do good in the world, and that the two don’t need to be mutually exclusive. The people I’ve met and worked with along this journey have spurred my interest and belief in the fact that education, empowerment, collaboration, and the power of communities can go a long way to changing the world for the better. And my work for La Cocina in San Francisco will carry on this inspiring journey.

About the internship

At La Cocina, I will help build out their bespoke incubation curriculum. This'll include developing materials for new innovative teaching modules, with a focus on cooperative building. I will also be conducting market research on the Urban Real Estate sector in San Francisco, with a focus on innovative “maker-spaces” (community-operated workspaces where people with common interest can work from, socialise & build their business). This'll be a critical element of La Cocina’s strategic growth initiative around creating low capital brick & mortar retail opportunities in San Francisco for the women, as this is something that is currently very capital intensive.

By working at La Cocina, I hope to gain insights, from a grass routes level, into how we can use the power of food and community to create lasting social change. I would love to, one day, be able to leverage these learnings to have a start-up of my own working at the intersection of food and social enterprise.  

My Journey to San Francisco

I was born and brought up in Delhi, and moved to the UK at the age of 8. Having spent the majority of my life in the UK, I still felt a sense of affinity to India and have always wanted to move back there for a while, just to try it out, just to see if I could actually do it. I got an opportunity to do just that last year when I was offered an internship at UnLtd India, a launch-pad for social entrepreneurs which finds, funds, and supports exceptional individuals whose ideas, passion and entrepreneurial skills can bring about long-term solutions to India's social problems. There I worked primarily for their co-working space, Bombay Connect, helping build the skills of these entrepreneurs and creating a collaborative community around them. Those 6 months were life-changing; it was where I found my passion, and was inspired day-in-day-out by the drive, generosity, and determination of the people I was surrounded by.

Whilst working at UnLtd India, I was introduced to MakeSense, a global community of young, social enterprise enthusiasts, collaborating to solve the business challenges of social entrepreneurs all over the world. What MakeSense has given me is a sense of the true power of community and has opened my eyes to the sheer number of start-ups working on solving the issues we have in society; be that Chayn who is helping women in Pakistan who are victims of domestic violence, or StudentFunder who is helping students who face financial hardships access to higher education in the UK.

I spent this summer working at The Social Investment Consultancy and was primarily involved in a social impact assessment project as well as launching a UK-wide campaign for a social mobility-focused social enterprise that they have been incubating for the past few years.

How can you help me on my way to La Cocina

Unfortunately, this internship with La Cocina is unpaid, and San Francisco is an expensive city to live in (it will cost me approximately £6000 over 5 months). I’ve been working hard over the past few weeks to raise funds for it; working part time, applying for grants, pitching to individuals that may want some research conducted on the social enterprise sector in San Francisco. Through those efforts I have been able to cover half the cost of the trip; and that is where YOU come in. I’m asking for the support of my friends, family and anyone else who is inspired by my story to help me raise funds to cover the other half. I’ve dreamt of working for La Cocina for over a year; I’m in awe of the difference they’re making to the lives of the women they support and am so grateful to have the opportunity to contribute to the incredible work they do.  With your support I’m aiming to raise enough money to cover my flight costs, visa fees, and my first 2 months of rent in order to make this dream into a reality!

  • 20 donations of £5 will help me cover my visa costs
  • 20 donations of £25 will help me cover my flight costs
  • 30 donations of £30 will help me cover 2 months of rent

Want to help, but can’t donate?

Connect me with your people; share my story with your friends, family, co-workers, anyone and everyone...after all, I am a big believer in the power of communities! Or do you know someone in San Francisco, maybe someone who can help me with accommodation, give me advice on San Francisco life, or tell me where to get the best taco in town? Well, introduce us!

Or, just simply wish me luck!

Thank you to each and every one of you for your support, no matter what the form!

Much love, as always

Aditi
