story:
YOU HAVE IT ALL

Coming to the world

2-2-22

 

Cover by world renowned space artist, David A. Hardy.

 

Who is Lobate Scarp?

We are a progressive opera-rock band based in Los Angeles. Our influences range from classic prog-rock of the 70's such as Genesis and Yes, to 80's pop such as Duran Duran and Tears for Fears, as well as strong ties to musical theater. 

Our goal is to make albums that take the listener on a unique musical journey covering a wide spectrum of sounds and genres. 

 

 

We are not backed by a label, so we depend highly on our fans contributions and support. And in return we will create high quality/ well produced fresh new prog-rock music for you to enjoy!

 

Here's a track from our 2019 EP, and there will also be a new and improved version on the new album!

 

 

Let's get epic! 

You Have It All  will serve as an expansion to our 2019 EP Spirals and Portals, interweaving "Nothing Wrong" and "Beautiful Light" within the album to tell a more cohesive musical story.  It consists of nine tracks, totaling more than an hour in length, including  “Conduit", our first fully instrumental piece.  Rich Mouser, whose mixing repertoire includes Spock’s Beard, Transatlantic, Neal Morse,  will once again mix our album, as well as join as co-producer and engineer on many of the tracks.  Steve Leavitt, producer of our debut album Time and Space, will also return to co-produce and engineer.  Progressive rock fans will especially appreciate the 14 1/2-minute title track as well as our 17 minute finale "Flowing Through The Change" which deals with both acceptance of the past and looking into the future for exciting possibilities!

 

Track listing for You Have It All :

(May not represent final artwork)

 

 

Bring on the guests! 

While the live version of Scarp is slimmed down to just the 5 of us, the magic of the studio album allows us to invite some of our favorite musicians to be a part of it! 

We are excited to announce our special guests Eric Moore (Suicidal Tendencies, Infectious Grooves), Jimmy Keegan (Spock's Beard, Pattern Seeking Animals), and Ryo Okumoto (Spock's Beard).  Jon Davison and Billy Sherwood (Yes) will be guest vocalists on our title track "You Have It All". 

 

You can make a difference! 

  • Since we made our goal of $6000 (bare minimum we needed to get the album done), Indiegogo allows us to continue to raise funds through this page. Every extra contribution will continue to help us finish the album, and means less funds comes out of our OWN pockets.

  • If we hit $10,000, we will be able to produce the album in vinyl format! We will then offer a new vinyl perk. And provide a special upgrade perk for those of you who want to change their CD perk to vinyl.

  • By pre-ordering our album on Indiegogo today, you will not only get it before the rest of the world, you will be a part of our journey as we finish this project to completion. We will be sharing cool things as we go!

  • Make sure you check out our cool perks, such as a Lobate shirt, Listening Party, Special Thank You in the liner notes, and hand-knit "got prog?" cozys, a hang in the studio, private house concerts, and more!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please pass this page along to some one you know likes new or progressive rock music.
  • Share our campaign link (gotprog.com) via email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or any other social media, along with a message telling your followers/ friends why you like our project!

 

Check out our Instagram page for some behind-the-scenes pics and vids! instagram.com/lobatescarp

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for supporting our project. 

 We can’t wait to share You Have It All  with you!

Who is Lobate Scarp?
We are a progressive opera-rock band based in Los Angeles. Our influences range from classic prog-rock of the 70's such as Genesis and Yes, to 80's pop such as Duran Duran and Tears for Fears, as well as strong ties to musical theater.

story:
Overview

Hello and thank you for checking out my Indiegogo campaign! I'm excited to get back into the studio to record "We Got This - Side 2" a new 6 song EP that will be a companion to "We Got This" a 6 song EP I released in November 2020.

I've been a professional musician for over 10 years, and am so excited to have the opportunity to record a new 6 song EP in Toronto! I need a little help and support from my friends and fans though, and your contribution is immensely appreciated!

My Story

For those of you I've yet to have the pleasure to meet, my name is Melanie Peterson! I'm a professional musician (and actress) born in Saskatoon and based in Toronto. I'm pursuing my dream career of writing songs and performing them for large audiences. I write daily because I believe continuity of practice is the secret of success. Not to mention, I love sharing my new songs with people, It brings me soul satisfaction to know I've reached someone with my art. This is the one of the best jobs in the world and I don't plan on stopping anytime soon!

 

About my EP Project:

My EP will consist of six original songs that are near and dear to my heart. Songs about love, escape, diamonds, tequila and more. Songs I wrote before and during the pandemic. I will be recording at Revolution Recording in Toronto with Mitch Girio of Slow Cooker Studios as my producer, Joao Carvahlo of Carvalho Mastering will master the EP and Bri-Anne Myers will do the album art. I will have the help of some top notch musicians on my album as well!

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $10,000. This money will cover the cost of studio time, studio musicians, mixing, mastering and manufacturing of the EP, album art, a video for the lead single and a publicist to promote the EP once it's ready for release! This is not my first time at the rodeo, so I know every little thing that needs to be paid for. If you would like a complete break down of the budget, please email me at melanieacts@hotmail.com.

Now I wouldn't just ask for your money with nothing in return! Besides the fantastic perk of being able to listen to my newest songs whenever the mood strikes you, I'm offering some really awesome additional perks.

I sincerely appreciate your contribution, it helps bring me closer to the goal I am trying to reach! I couldn't do this without the continuous support of my family, friends and fans, and it truly humbles me to be surrounded by such an awesome support system!

For any questions about the project or rewards, please feel free to email me directly at:  melanieacts@hotmail.com

Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, you can still help! It helps if you share this campaign with friends on facebook, instagram, twitter and other social media. The more people this campaign reaches, the higher the chance of me achieving my goal! Thank you in advance for your kind consideration. xo

story:
My name is Layla Zoe...

Also known as "Canada's darling of the Blues" and "The Firegirl."
I am an award winning blues/bluesrock vocalist and songwriter born in British Columbia, Canada. I have currently been living in Europe for the last 6 years pursuing my career here and worldwide.

I have worked with some of the biggest names in blues and blues rock. (Jeff Healey, Sonny Landreth, Coco Montoya, Susan Tedeschi, John Mayall, to name a few). Performed at some of the most renowned festivals around the world, from Montreal Jazz festival all the way to Mahindra Blues festival in Mumbai, India. I have worked with the best musicians in my scene and love to write, sing and most of all perform for my fan base around the world. I have released 13 albums to date and worked with established record labels as well as released many albums independently.

 

Currently I am working as my own record label, and am excited and proud to continue a project I feel very strongly about, even in these uncertain times, my next studio album: "Nowhere Left To Go."

No matter what is happening around the world, we need our health. But we also need music, art, theatre, poetry, freedom of expression and creativity.

 

About this project

I started writing songs for this project in early 2019, and my concept has carried into 2020 with a dream to release this new album in the fall of this year. I considered changing my plans due to the current global situation, but felt that would be the wrong choice in these times, as I truly believe music can help us more than ever, through uncertainty, fear and confusion.

This album has songs co-written with some amazing friends and colleagues of mine, all of whom are talented and creative artists who work hard on their craft and are well known in their respective genres and music scenes. I am so grateful to all of these artists/writers for their contributions to this album. Not only did they co-write the songs, but most of them are also scheduled to be featured playing their instruments on this album, on the songs we co-wrote together. Left to right: Bob Fridzema (Netherlands/Denmark), Suzie Vinnick (Canada), Jackie Venson (USA), Layla Zoe (Canada), Alastair Greene (USA), Dimitri LeBel (Canada), Brandi Disterheft (USA/Canada) and Guy Smeets (Netherlands). 

Due to the current circumstances and inability to cross the border from Netherlands to Germany, I was forced to cancel the studio time I had booked this year for this project, and change the recording plans to include only home studio recordings from each musician.

This album is about bringing musicians together during this difficult time, giving them some work, allowing creativity, and keeping us together in communicating and making art, in the face of a grim situation in our business right now.

This is why I feel so passionately about this project. 

Whether I am able to tour the new album later this year or not, is still to be decided by local governments and regulations. But whether or not the tour can go on or not, I feel strongly that these songs should be recorded and made available to the fans.

 

How you can help

By helping me to raise the money I need, you will be making a dream come true, during what would otherwise be a nightmare year for most musicians and music industry professionals. Most of all, you will be giving me the support I need to carry forward creatively, and also support this small village of musicians in the process. All of my concerts were cancelled up until August so far, so as you can imagine I am unable to finance this album alone.

Your help is vital in making this project a reality.

With all my love and gratitude to all of you around the world, 
Layla Zoe 
 

 

What is needed to finish this album

To finish this album I need a minimum of 7000 euros.

This money will go towards:
Paying the co-writers each a small fee for their recordings.
Paying the session musicians for their work on the entire album (bass, drums, guitar and keys.)
Paying the engineer for his time mixing and mastering the album.
Paying the studio time to record my vocals.
Paying the photographer and graphic artist for their artwork and creativity on the CD graphics.
And any money left over will be used to promote the album and send it out to radio, journalists and promoters for possible reviews, airplay, and opportunities. 

Every penny raised will go towards this project, and the many people involved.

 

We have some very exciting perks

Signed copies of the new album before the release date!
Merch packages including the new album and copies of past releases!
Handwritten song lyrics from the album!
Your name mentioned in the CD graphics later, and a signed CD!
Skype calls!
A picnic! (Local fan only, and respecting social distancing rules and regulations.)
And even two beautiful autographed guitars!

Please, with your help, I know we can do this together, and make this a group project in every way.

I am so grateful to all of you who already supported my last crowdfunding campaign, for my critically acclaimed double album "Gemini" which was released in 2018. I was able to raise over 10,000 euros to finish that album with your help, and the result was a wonderful double disk of songs and some lovely perks that were appreciated deeply by all the fans who donated.
 

Risks & Challenges

This is a hard time for many artists. I have had many conversations with friends and colleagues in the music business all over the world. And especially for those with families, this has been a crushing blow to their financial survival, but also to their self esteem as artists. Right now, we need to be reminded that art and music are important to our listeners and supporters.
I have been overwhelmed by how creative and intuitive many artists have been in finding new ways to make music, share music, teach Skype lessons and many other beautiful ideas, to find new forms of income. It will be difficult to raise funds at a time like this, with so many people in need, so many artists asking for support and so many people feeling the financial uncertainty of the future.

But I have absolute FAITH that TOGETHER we can create, fund, and finish this album. 
We have done it before and I know we can do this again!
 

Other Ways You Can Help


Of course not everyone has the money to support this project at this time, and that is absolutely understood. But there are other ways you can help, by sharing this campaign with friends, colleagues, music lovers and family! Telling everyone about the talented artists involved in this project and letting people know how and where they can go to support these artists. 
(See websites for co-writers.)

And of course just holding us in your hearts and sending us your support verbally, energetically and lovingly, can also be a way to contribute to this project. Every bit helps right now..


If you have any questions about this campaign, how the money will be used, when and where the recordings will take place, additional questions about the artists/co-writers involved, or any other enquiries that may help you to decide if you want to fund this campaign or not, please feel free to write me at: laylazoe13@gmail.com

story:
The Story Behind the Record

In 1987, after hearing a demo tape of Robert Vaughn & The Shadows, The 77s’ Michael Roe and Jan Eric Volz traveled from Sacramento – home of Exit Records – to San Diego to see the band perform live.  Returning to Sacramento impressed with their sound and talent, Roe and Volz encouraged their label – also home to Charlie Peacock, Vector, and others – to sign the band, making Robert Vaughn & The Shadows the first band outside the Sacramento area to be signed to Exit, which had recently inked a distribution deal with Island Records, U2’s parent label.  (As fate would have it, Robert Vaughn & The Shadows was also the last band Exit signed.)

Given a large recording budget and significant nationwide radio play on AOR radio, Robert Vaughn & The Shadows even garnered an appearance on Dick Clark’s American Bandstand.  Their first album for Exit, Love and War, was even slated for a CD release.  However, given the Exit/Island distribution deal’s limitations, there wasn’t enough money and promotion to propel them further, leading to the deal’s untimely demise.  As such, Exit dropped all of its signed acts and abandoned plans to release Love and War on CD.

Now free agents, Robert Vaughn & The Shadows landed on my label, Alternative Records, and recorded Songs from the Riverhouse, which helped them sign a short-lived deal with CBS Records (unreleased), then with Miramar and distributed by RCA – Robert Vaughn & The Dead River Angels’ eponymous album – before effectively retiring from the music business altogether.

In the intervening decades, nearly every Exit act had received their master tapes back and worked diligently to remaster and reissue their back catalogs.  Love and War was a major exception.  However, in early 2021, we worked out a deal with Exit to obtain the multi-track master tapes – and everything else Robert Vaughn-related from that era that languished in Exit’s vaults – so that we could remaster Love and War and produce a limited-edition run of CDs containing a ton of extras!

This Indiegogo campaign marks Alternative Records’ official return after a long period of dormancy.  The only reason for coming out of dormancy is two-fold:  (1) Love and War deserves the CD treatment, and (2) I really want to get this album out there!  I have already spent months using the best sources to achieve the best possible sound, and the new CD artwork will match that effort.  In terms of extras, songs and mixes not found on the original LP are simply jaw-dropping.  My hope is that Robert Vaughn fans will be as excited as I was to listen to the original album once again, in a fresh way.  You will hear so much more of the mix, and I guarantee you that this remaster will blow you away sonically and musically.

Funding & Project Goals

1.  Normally, most campaigns raise funds first and, if successful, transfer and bake the original tapes, (re)create the original artwork, remaster the album, etc.  Because it was important for me to hear exactly what we had, I’ve already spent considerable effort and funds getting the tapes in order.  The good news is that the masters were in very good condition.  Given the effort so far, I have a pretty good idea now of how much the campaign will require to produce this limited CD run and get everything into your hands relatively quickly after the campaign’s end.

2.  $5,700 should be sufficient to pay the aforementioned costs – just enough to produce the project and get it to you and the band.  Aside from the pride that comes from releasing this phenomenal album, I will not profit monetarily from this campaign.  There are two avenues we can go with the available material.  The focus will be on producing a double CD, with the core album on one CD and the second CD containing demos, new mixes, works-in-progress, and unheard, unreleased songs from the Love and War sessions.  If we don’t reach the goal of $5,700, a single CD containing the original album, plus a few new mixes, would still be possible, with a funding goal of $5,200.  Of course, I pray the campaign will be successful enough to fund a 2-CD version.  Once funded, I plan to have Love and War in your hands within 4-6 weeks.

3.  Make no mistake:  This is a limited, one-time run of Love and War on CD only.  I have no plans to release the album on vinyl, simply because the original LP is readily available on the third-party market.  Nevertheless, purchasing this limited-edition 2-CD version of Love and War will both ensure that the album survives and provide future income for the band members, who never saw much money from the original album sales.

4.  As a final, personal note, my own health is not terrific, and it’s likely this special Love and War re-release will be about the last thing Alternative Records will release.  (There are a few others projects I want to do, but it’s iffy whether that can happen).  So, it means a LOT to me personally, and I hope this project will mean a lot to you, too, as we reveal more during the course of the campaign.

Risks & Rewards

I’ve put a lot of work into this already – seriously, I could write several pages of drama and intrigue about this – so short of not reaching our funding goal, the risks of not being able to deliver the product or suffering unexpected delays are virtually negligible.  If we reach our funding goal, an order of 300 double CDs is attainable.  We’ll also be doing a lot on social media and sharing music tidbits as we go along so you can enjoy the ride to the final destination.  If for some reason this campaign fails and the CD re-release doesn’t happen, you will, of course, receive a full refund.

Other Ways You Can Help

If this Love and War re-release appeals to you, please get the word out!  We’ll be sharing more later on how to do that, how you can see your name in the album credits, and other ways you can be a part of this great album!

Thank you-

Randy Layton

Alternative Records

altrecords@aol.com
story_txt:
The Story Behind the Record
In 1987, after hearing a demo tape of Robert Vaughn & The Shadows, The 77s’ Michael Roe and Jan Eric Volz traveled from Sacramento – home of Exit Records – to San Diego to see the band perform live.  Returning to Sacramento impressed with their sound and talent, Roe and Volz encouraged their label – also home to Charlie Peacock, Vector, and others – to sign the band, making Robert Vaughn & The Shadows the first band outside the Sacramento area to be signed to Exit, which had recently inked a distribution deal with Island Records, U2’s parent label.  (As fate would have it, Robert Vaughn & The Shadows was also the last band Exit signed.)Given a large recording budget and significant nationwide radio play on AOR radio, Robert Vaughn & The Shadows even garnered an appearance on Dick Clark’s American Bandstand.  Their first album for Exit, Love and War, was even slated for a CD release.  However, given the Exit/Island distribution deal’s limitations, there wasn’t enough money and promotion to propel them further, leading to the deal’s untimely demise.  As such, Exit dropped all of its signed acts and abandoned plans to release Love and War on CD.
Now free agents, Robert Vaughn & The Shadows landed on my label, Alternative Records, and recorded Songs from the Riverhouse, which helped them sign a short-lived deal with CBS Records (unreleased), then with Miramar and distributed by RCA – Robert Vaughn & The Dead River Angels’ eponymous album – before effectively retiring from the music business altogether.In the intervening decades, nearly every Exit act had received their master tapes back and worked diligently to remaster and reissue their back catalogs.  Love and War was a major exception.  However, in early 2021, we worked out a deal with Exit to obtain the multi-track master tapes – and everything else Robert Vaughn-related from that era that languished in Exit’s vaults – so that we could remaster Love and War and produce a limited-edition run of CDs containing a ton of extras!This Indiegogo campaign marks Alternative Records’ official return after a long period of dormancy.  The only reason for coming out of dormancy is two-fold:  (1) Love and War deserves the CD treatment, and (2) I really want to get this album out there!  I have already spent months using the best sources to achieve the best possible sound, and the new CD artwork will match that effort.  In terms of extras, songs and mixes not found on the original LP are simply jaw-dropping.  My hope is that Robert Vaughn fans will be as excited as I was to listen to the original album once again, in a fresh way.  You will hear so much more of the mix, and I guarantee you that this remaster will blow you away sonically and musically.

Funding & Project Goals
1.  Normally, most campaigns raise funds first and, if successful, transfer and bake the original tapes, (re)create the original artwork, remaster the album, etc.  Because it was important for me to hear exactly what we had, I’ve already spent considerable effort and funds getting the tapes in order.  The good news is that the masters were in very good condition.  Given the effort so far, I have a pretty good idea now of how much the campaign will require to produce this limited CD run and get everything into your hands relatively quickly after the campaign’s end.2.  $5,700 should be sufficient to pay the aforementioned costs – just enough to produce the project and get it to you and the band.  Aside from the pride that comes from releasing this phenomenal album, I will not profit monetarily from this campaign.  There are two avenues we can go with the available material.  The focus will be on producing a double CD, with the core album on one CD and the second CD containing demos, new mixes, works-in-progress, and unheard, unreleased songs from the Love and War sessions.  If we don’t reach the goal of $5,700, a single CD containing the original album, plus a few new mixes, would still be possible, with a funding goal of $5,200.  Of course, I pray the campaign will be successful enough to fund a 2-CD version.  Once funded, I plan to have Love and War in your hands within 4-6 weeks.
3.  Make no mistake:  This is a limited, one-time run of Love and War on CD only.  I have no plans to release the album on vinyl, simply because the original LP is readily available on the third-party market.  Nevertheless, purchasing this limited-edition 2-CD version of Love and War will both ensure that the album survives and provide future income for the band members, who never saw much money from the original album sales.
4.  As a final, personal note, my own health is not terrific, and it’s likely this special Love and War re-release will be about the last thing Alternative Records will release.  (There are a few others projects I want to do, but it’s iffy whether that can happen).  So, it means a LOT to me personally, and I hope this project will mean a lot to you, too, as we reveal more during the course of the campaign.
Risks & RewardsI’ve put a lot of work into this already – seriously, I could write several pages of drama and intrigue about this – so short of not reaching our funding goal, the risks of not being able to deliver the product or suffering unexpected delays are virtually negligible.  If we reach our funding goal, an order of 300 double CDs is attainable.  We’ll also be doing a lot on social media and sharing music tidbits as we go along so you can enjoy the ride to the final destination.  If for some reason this campaign fails and the CD re-release doesn’t happen, you will, of course, receive a full refund.
Other Ways You Can Help
If this Love and War re-release appeals to you, please get the word out!  We’ll be sharing more later on how to do that, how you can see your name in the album credits, and other ways you can be a part of this great album!
Thank you-
Randy Layton
Alternative Records
altrecords@aol.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I’m Bo!

I’m an artist from Portland, Oregon. For the last few years, I’ve been releasing singles, which gave me the opportunity to really create an identity for each song as it’s own entity. For me, the intention with writing music has always been to create imagery that would allow me to be vulnerable with the listener and hopefully give them something relatable and something they could connect with.

 

What I Need & What You Get

For over a year, I’ve been writing, arranging and putting together the right songs to present a brief but specific representation of my life that has reflected my perspective of relationships, friendships and the challenges of life in general.

Up to this point, I’ve been completely self funded, and I’ve been really proud of the content that I’ve been able to put together on my own. However, the pandemic changed things for me in the beginning of 2020, when I suddenly was out of work. Between that and terminating the contract with my label, my plans for this EP continued to get pushed further back, but I’ve continued to produce and create the songs, as well as the the extra content, with some of my favorite creatives to make sure that no detail is spared for this release.

In order to finish this production, I’m going to need a little help from all of you! For studio time, mixing, distribution, PR, and other promotional material, I’ve totaled a cost of about $15,000. However, with this campaign, I’m asking for your help in funding studio time, mixing, and distribution so I can wrap it up and get this EP finished the right way and into your hands ASAP!

 

The Impact

I believe that crowdfunding is a powerful tool that gives myself and other artists agency over what we create, and a platform to use our own voices, uninhibited by the inner workings of the music industry, to create and distribute our art the way we intend. By backing this campaign, you're putting the power back in the hands of creators! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand how difficult things have been for everybody, from the pandemic to the hardships of general life. If you’re a fan of my music but aren’t able to financially back the campaign, don’t even worry about it! If you still want to support me and my project, feel free to share this campaign and spread the word!

story:
Hi there, my name's John. Some of you might know me as Culprate...

This journey started many moons ago, in fact I've been releasing music on various record labels since 2010, which is pretty mad when I think about it. I'm based in the beautiful South West of England with my wife and two crazy kids. Over the years I've produced all sorts of genres, styles and flavours of music but I was initially synonymous with the underground dubstep movement. I then went on to write an album called Colours which sort of changed the rhetoric. Later, in 2014, I was convinced to crowdfund an ambitious 'experimental album' project on this very platform. The campaign was a huge success and I was free to produce an album I've always wanted to produce, free of financial constraints and creative limitations. That album was later titled 'Deliverance.' Well folks, it's been 5 years and I feel it's time to take another big leap of faith. I've been toying with the idea of creating another 'experimental album' for a year or two now. You see, it's not so easy piecing together an album like Colours or Deliverance and this decision wasn't easy to make. The truth is that crowdfunding is... Interesting. It's a vulnerable, nervous process and it's very humbling asking for support on this scale. What I will say though, is it's also incredible to witness how many crazy people out there relate to my music. And with your help you can help me write the next chapter.

 

This is an even bigger ask than the last campaign...

It's a big goal I know. What you need to know is that the campaign has been put together in meticulous detail to ensure no money is wasted and every expense is accounted for. With that in mind I think it's really important to be completely transparent as to where your financial support will actually go. I won't bore you with the details and it's probably not all too surprising but the bulk of the costs are spent on Production Equipment, Software, Recording Costs, Post Production and of course manufacturing all of the Physical Products themselves. There's also several tons of Yorkshire Tea that need to be ordered and we haven't even talked about hobnobs yet. If you would like a detailed breakdown of the costs specifically, hit me up and I'll be happy to share them with you. 

We've got some great perks on offer. In hindsight I wish we'd made more Deliverance vinyl as I still get messages now asking where people can cop it. Well... We're going to repress Deliverance. We're also going to go the extra mile with the new album, a double LP of the highest quality. For people still rocking CD players in their cars, we've got you covered. For my fellow producers out there, we've got you covered. For the Gregory Otterman's of the world, we've got you covered. There really is something for everyone and any contribution will be met with gratitude. Perhaps you're an up and coming producer and could use some tips? Perhaps you're keen on building your vinyl collection? Perhaps your a discogs warrior and you'll be the lot... 

Turns out you guys really enjoyed Deliverance...

It's amazing really. In fact it's bloody emotional. Some of the things I've read, some of the things I've been told me and some of the things I've seen, it's hard to articulate. I really want to deliver something on the same level but also something different. Is this album Deliverance 2? Not quite, it's in a similar vein. Think of it like this, this will be a sequel to Deliverance the same way Deliverance was a sequel to Colours. The thing is if the campaign is successfully funded then I can fully focus on creating something decent. I'm really proud of Deliverance but I'd put so much of the success down to the fact I wasn't limited. I didn't have to make compromises. It's been 5 years and a lot has changed. I need these funds to invest in the latest gizmos and give myself every chance of crafting an excellent product. No producer wants to have to use sub standard vocal mics or the wrong pre-amp. This campaign is all about excellence, otherwise, what's the point? 

So why help out? Well, if you've come this far, you may be interested in the project or a fan of my previous works. My music is a bit out there and may not be everyone's cup of tea, but I like to think I'm doing something different and unique. You will be helping to create an album that will be nothing like you've heard before. I mean it won't be a million miles away from my previous productions, but I'll have the opportunity to create my best music to date. The last few years have been amazing and the fan base you guys have created has got me through the good times and the bad. I'm sitting here because of you and it still blows my mind that people pay for my music. I'm so blessed to be doing what I love doing everyday, and for all those reasons and more, i'm going to be pouring my heart and soul into the making of this album.

 

This isn't going to be easy... 

The goal is massive. I know I'm asking a lot here. Especially when times are tough. The biggest risk here is if we don't manage to hit this goal. I wanted to keep the goal as low as possible, so we costed everything down to the final penny. This basically means if we don't hit the goal, they'll have to be some compromises, compromises I really don't want to make. There's also the elephant in the room that I'm going to have to take a lot of time off touring and bringing in revenue in other ways and with 2 kids to feed it's going to be a challenge. I'm actually hoping we can slightly go over the goal like we did before. That would be bloody terrific. 

There's lots of other things you can do to help...

I get it, money is tight and you're just not in the position to contribute right now. Well, you can still help out, in fact there's a lot you can do. The success of this campaign is all about making noise. The more people that hear about it the more likely we are to succeed. Tell your mates, spread the word and get the campaign out there. Especially if you happen to be friends with a millionaire. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! 

I'm still not sure what should go in this bit... So I'll put my social media deets here again. 

Soundcloud

Spotify

Facebook

Twitter

Bandcamp

No Instagram (yeah I know)

Oh and I forgot to say, there will be treats as we hit 25%, 50%, 75% and 100%. 

Thanks y'all

>

>>

>>>

Hi there

>>>>

>>>>>

Keep scrolling

>>>>>

>>>>

Ok stop

>>>

>>

>

Ok bye

story:
Campaign 

Hey y’all. I’m Carlos and I’m a singer songwriter from Montréal Québec Canada. I’ve been making music consistently since 2010, having released an EP in 2015. 

I started this campaign to facilitate the production of the vinyl records for my first full length album. Yes.. I’m making vinyl records. Why, you ask? Why not, I say. Vinyl records have seen a resurgence in the last few years, and merchandise, be it physical copies of music or tee-shirts, caps and stickers are the backbone for creators to make a living doing what they love.

Your support in preordering my album will allow me to continue to make music in the future.

 

Funding Goals & Perks

We’re looking to raise 5000$ with this preorder campaign. These funds will go directly to pay printers, graphic artists, mixing, mastering, the vinyl records themselves and a bunch of other merchandise.

Every contribution starting at the lowest level will get you the digital copy of the album. Every level above that will include specifically designed Merch items for the upcoming singles. Stickers, trucker hats, baseball tees and much much more.

Regardless of reaching our goal or not, the album will be out in early 2022. Reaching the goal will allow me to pay my rent and feed my children fresh vegetables and meat.

 

The Impact

My previous release, the Angels EP was funded through Kickstarter in 2015. My backers were completely satisfied throughout the whole process. Since it was released, it’s been available to stream through CarlosCandido.com, getting tens of thousands of downloads and the EP still on college radio rotation today. 

This new album is more autobiographical and a labour of love and its sounding bigger and more epic than I ever could have imagined. I demo’ed this album on Patreon between 2018 and 2019 with the intention for a release in late 2020. We all know what happened next. 

As the world got crazy and we were locked indoors, and in some cases under curfew, I had a lot of time to think, and think, and overthink, and ruminate, and contemplate life and the words I’ve said, and pretty much everything I’ve ever done wrong. 

Eventually, I went back to those demos and I started to hear the completed tracks and I got excited. I called on great musicians and an amazing producer/engineer to play on the album. We’re 90% of the way there, getting to the final touches in the next couple of weeks. 

I believe this album has a chance to be something special. I can’t wait for you all to hear it.

 

Risks & Challenges

The only risk in preordering this album and Merch, is you may not like my songs, and you won’t like cool things to wear when you go sugaring off or apple picking with the rug rats. Hey I’m not judging, you like what you like.

 

Sharing Is Caring

Sharing this campaign with all your friends on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter whether you contributed or not, will help get the word out to as many people as possible. Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools included below.

At the same time, you can follow and share my streaming links for Apple Music, iTunes and Spotify.

 

Thanks for checking this out and your consideration.

story:
Kent Nielsen’s new solo album „Shotgun Seat DJ“

(Scrolle runter für die deutsche Version)


About me & my idea

Hello there,

Thanks for stopping by on the crowdfunding page for my first solo album.
My name is Kent Nielsen, I’m Danish but living in Lübeck (North Germany). My resume includes: author, percussionist, shoe shop clerk, record label guy, mail order honcho, night porter and ukulele player a. o. But there’s one thing I’ve been doing for 35 years – and that’s singing.

Currently I’m about to complete an old project – my first solo album. I've long been fortunate to work with some extremely gifted songwriting partners. Hopefully we‘ve managed an album as diverse and varied as the albums I prefer.

The goal of this crowdfunding campaign is to find enough supporters for me to finance the final mix, artwork and CD pressing.


Album, perks & budget

Roughly half of the roots-rock colored songs were written together with Stefan Kletetzka (DEEP RIVER), some are brand new while a couple date back to the time that Stefan and I played together in ONE BAR TOWN. Hence nothing seemed more appropriate than getting our old rhythm section, Skinny Kaspereit and Thorsten Luck, on board for that part of the recording sessions which took place in Göttingen’s Out-O-Space Studios. Three covers were added, one by GLEN CAMPBELL and another two originally written by EDDIE & THE HOT RODS and C.V. JØRGENSEN featuring my solo work on the ukulele. Three more songs, drenched in Mod and 60s sounds were written together with Helge Reich (JAM TODAY) and two musicians from his current band RUTSCHBAHN DREI, Jens C. Möller and Dirk Holtkötter. This part of the recordings took place in Hamburg’s Tonhotel Studio.

The album also includes guest appearances from George Whitfield (FIDDLEBOX, ex-PRESSGANG) and Martin Wenk (CALEXICO, NADA SURF, JUDITH HOLOFERNES).

And here comes the exciting part: I came up with a bunch of fun perks in return for your support. From a simple download version, signed CDs, handwritten lyric sheets, to exclusive fan packages and intimate house concerts within your own four walls.

Project budget:

Recording & Mixing so far
1.500,-
Final& additional mixing
500,-
Mastering
500,-
Mechanical royalties (P.R.S.) for CDs pressed
600,-
Travelling expenses
300,-
Production & Duplication
600,-
Design, Album Art
500,-
Payment Processing (credit cards, paypal) 
200,-
Contingency (i.e. additional expenses) 
400,-
Fulfillment 
400,-
Total:
EUR 5.500,-


The benefit aspect

Once I reach my campaign goal, anything coming in on top will be donated to the project "Nicht allein!" (“Not Alone!”).

“Not Alone!” is a new grass roots organization based in Lübeck, looking for guardians for refugees who arrive here as minors without parents or other adult relatives. The guardians are local citizens willing to help the children and teenagers with legal and personal issues. For instance: support with submitting applications for asylum, other obstacles they encounter in their new surroundings or simply so that they do not feel completely alone or isolated. At the moment such guardians are appointed by the authorities, some of them have up to fifty youths to look after. It’s not hard to imagine what that means for their daily work. The parent organization of “Not Alone!” is the Humanistic Union of Lübeck. (Infos: katja.mentz (a) gmx.de , www.humanistische-union.de/regionen/luebeck).

While the subject of crowdfunding is relatively new to me, making music while collecting money for a worthy cause isn’t. During my time as a label manager I was involved in several successful benefit projects, for example: A therapy center for traumatized women and children in Croatia, anticensorship campaign for the Alpha Comic Books Publishing, the homeless in Germany and the Mohawk Revolt at Kahnawake, Canada a. o.


Current state of affairs

All 14 songs have been recorded, 11 of those have been mixed, hence I’ve gotten pretty far already. If we reach the campaign goal of EUR 5.500,- , the final mix and mastering with my favorite producer is secured.
The only thing needed now is your support, in order to complete the album. What follows after the studio is routines, that myself and the small but efficient team behind me has exercised a number of times in the past.

In the event that the campaign target isn’t reached, I will use any money raised to make the best album I possibly can and all supporters will still receive their perks.

Other ways you can help
Times are hard and maybe you aren’t able to support my album project financially? In that case there are other ways to help. Tell your friends about the project via your social media sites. For this purpose please use the tool provided by Indiegogo.

Let’s do this!

Kent

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Über mich & und meine Idee

Moin,

danke fürs vorbei schauen auf der Crowdfunding Seite für mein erstes Soloalbum.

Mein Name ist Kent Nielsen, bin Däne, wohne in Lübeck und habe schon so einiges ausprobiert: Autor, Waschbrettspieler, Schuhverkäufer, Label Manager, Mailorderinhaber und Ukulele Spieler. Doch eines tu‘ ich seit mehr als 35 Jahre, und das ist Singen.

Momentan bin ich dabei eine alte Idee zu realisieren - mein erstes Solo Album.
Ich hatte immer das große Glück mit einigen sehr talentierten und kreativen Songwritern zusammen arbeiten zu dürfen. Ich hoffe, dass uns ein Album gelungen ist, das so vielseitig und abwechslungsreich ist wie ich sie selber am liebsten mag.
Das Ziel dieser Crowdfunding Kampagne ist es genügend Unterstützer zu finden um den finalen Mix, Artwork und die CD Pressung zu finanzieren.


Album, Perks & Budget

Etwa die Hälfte der Roots Rock gefärbten Songs wurden zusammen mit Stefan Kletetzka (DEEP RIVER) geschrieben, davon sind einige sind ganz neu, und ein paar stammen aus unserer gemeinsamer Zeit bei ONE BAR TOWN. Es war also naheliegend, unsere alten Bandkollegen Skinny Kaspereit und Thorsten Luck für diesen Teil der Aufnahmen in Tom Spötters Göttinger Out-O-Space Studio zu reaktivieren. Hinzu kommen drei Cover, eines von GLEN CAMPBELL und zwei weitere von EDDIE & THE HOT RODS und C.V. JØRGENSEN, die ich alleine auf der Ukulele neu interpretiert habe. Die letzten drei, in Mod & 60s Sound getränkten Titel, entstanden in Zusammenarbeit mit Helge Reich (JAM TODAY) und zwei Musikern aus dessen aktueller Band RUTSCHBAHN DREI, Jens C. Möller und Dirk Holtkötter. Dieser Teil der Aufnahmen liefen im Hamburger Tonhotel Studio unter der Regie von Gerd Mauff. Abgerundet wird das Album durch Gastauftritte von George Whitfield (FIDDLEBOX, ex-PRESSGANG) und Martin Wenk (CALEXICO, BOSSE, JUDITH HOLOFERNES).

Und jetzt zum spaßigen Teil. Ich habe mir jede Menge witzige Perks einfallen lassen als Gegenleistung für Eure Unterstützung. Vom einfachen Download, signierte CDs, handgeschriebene Lyric Sheets, über exklusive Fanpakete, bis hin zum intimen Akustik Konzert in Deinen eigenen vier Wänden. 

Klicke auf ein bestimmten „Perk“ und werde Teil des Ganzen.


Projektbudget:

Bisheriger Aufnahme & Mix
1.500,-
Finaler Mix
500,-
Mastering
500,-
GEMA Gebühr
600,-
Reisekosten
300,-
CD-Pressung
600,-
Grafik
500,-
Zahlungsgebühren (Paypal, etc.) 
200,-
Unvorhergesehene Ausgaben  
400,-
Indiegogo Gebühren 
400,-
Gesamt:
EUR 5.500,-


Der Benefiz Aspekt

Ab dem Punkt, an dem das Mindestziel erreicht wird, geht der Überschuss an das in Planung befindliche Projekt „Nicht allein!“. „Nicht allein“ sucht Vormundschaften für minderjährige Flüchtlinge die alleine nach Lübeck kommen. Menschen, die bereit sind den Jugendlichen bei rechtlichen und persönlichen Dingen zu helfen. Das bedeutet Hilfe im Asylverfahren, Beistand im Alltag oder eben einfach sie nicht alleine zu lassen. Momentan wird diese Unterstützung durch Amtsvormundschaften geleistet, die jeweils bis zu 50 Jugendliche gleichzeitig betreuen. Was das bedeutet kann man sich unschwer vorstellen. „Nicht allein“ wird von der Humanistischen Union Lübeck initiiert. (Infos: katja.mentz (a) gmx.de www.humanistische-union.de/regionen/luebeck)

Das Thema Crowdfunding ist zwar relatives Neuland für mich, Musik machen und gleichzeitig Geld sammeln für einen guten Zweck dagegen nicht. Während meine Zeit als Label Chef war ich in einigen sehr erfolgreiche Benefizprojekte involviert, u.a.: für ein Therapiezentrum für traumatisierten Frauen und Kinder in Kroatien, Prozesskosten für den vom Staatsanwaltschaft lahm gelegten Alpha Comic Verlag, Obdachlose in Deutschland oder vom Staat drangsalierten Ureinwohner in Kanada. 


Stand der Dinge 

Alle 14 Songs sind bereits fertig aufgenommen, 11 davon auch schon gemischt, wir sind also schon ziemlich weit. Wenn das Ziel von EUR 5.000,- erreicht wird, wären der endgültige Mix und das Mastern bei meinem Wunschproduzenten gesichert.
Was jetzt noch fehlt ist also das Wichtigste, nämlich Deine Unterstützung, damit das Album fertig stellen werden kann. Was danach kommt sind Abläufe die ich, und das kleine aber feine Team hinter mir, schon oft durchexerziert haben.

Sollte das Mindestziel jedoch nicht erreicht werden, werde ich trotzdem mit dem eingenommenen Geld das bestmögliche Album machen, und alle Unterstützer werden ihre Perks erhalten.


Wie Du sonst noch helfen kannst 

Die Zeiten sind hart, und vielleicht hast Du keine Möglichkeit mein Projekt finanziell zu unterstützen? Helfen kannst Du dennoch, und zwar indem Du deinen Freunden & Bekannten auf Deinen Social Media Sites über dieses Projekt erzählst. Bitte nutze dafür das Tool von Indiegogo.

Liebe Grüße

Kent
story_txt:
Kent Nielsen’s new solo album „Shotgun Seat DJ“
(Scrolle runter für die deutsche Version)
About me & my ideaHello there,
Thanks for stopping by on the crowdfunding page for my first solo album.
My name is Kent Nielsen, I’m Danish but living in Lübeck (North Germany). My
resume includes: author, percussionist, shoe shop clerk, record label guy, mail
order honcho, night porter and ukulele player a. o. But there’s one thing I’ve
been doing for 35 years – and that’s singing.Currently I’m about to complete an old project – my first solo album. I've long
been fortunate to work with some extremely gifted songwriting partners.
Hopefully we‘ve managed an album as diverse and varied as the albums I prefer.The goal of this crowdfunding campaign is to find enough supporters for me to
finance the final mix, artwork and CD pressing.

Album, perks & budget

Roughly half of the roots-rock colored songs were written together with
Stefan Kletetzka (DEEP RIVER), some are brand new while a couple date back to the
time that Stefan and I played together in ONE BAR TOWN. Hence nothing seemed
more appropriate than getting our old rhythm section, Skinny Kaspereit and
Thorsten Luck, on board for that part of the recording sessions which took
place in Göttingen’s Out-O-Space Studios. Three covers were added, one by GLEN
CAMPBELL and another two originally written by EDDIE & THE HOT RODS and
C.V. JØRGENSEN featuring my solo work on the ukulele. Three more songs,
drenched in Mod and 60s sounds were written together with Helge Reich (JAM
TODAY) and two musicians from his current band RUTSCHBAHN DREI, Jens C. Möller
and Dirk Holtkötter. This part of the recordings took place in Hamburg’s
Tonhotel Studio.
The album also includes guest
appearances from George Whitfield (FIDDLEBOX, ex-PRESSGANG) and Martin Wenk
(CALEXICO, NADA SURF, JUDITH HOLOFERNES). 
And here comes the exciting part: I came up with a
bunch of fun perks in return for your support. From a simple download version,
signed CDs, handwritten lyric sheets, to exclusive fan packages and intimate
house concerts within your own four walls.
Project
budget:



Recording & Mixing so far
 1.500,-


Final& additional mixing
  500,-



Mastering
 500,-


Mechanical royalties (P.R.S.) for CDs pressed
 600,-


 Travelling expenses
 300,-


Production & Duplication
  600,-


Design, Album Art
  500,-



 Payment Processing (credit cards, paypal) 
 200,-


Contingency (i.e. additional expenses)  
  400,-


Fulfillment 
 400,-






Total:
 EUR 5.500,-



The benefit aspectOnce I
reach my campaign goal, anything coming in on top will be donated to the
project "Nicht allein!" (“Not Alone!”).
“Not Alone!” is a new grass roots organization based in Lübeck, looking for
guardians for refugees who arrive here as minors without parents or other adult
relatives. The guardians are local citizens willing to help the children and
teenagers with legal and personal issues. For instance: support with submitting
applications for asylum, other obstacles they encounter in their new
surroundings or simply so that they do not feel completely alone or isolated.
At the moment such guardians are appointed by the authorities, some of them
have up to fifty youths to look after. It’s not hard to imagine what that means
for their daily work. The parent organization of “Not Alone!” is the Humanistic
Union of Lübeck. (Infos:
katja.mentz (a) gmx.de , www.humanistische-union.de/regionen/luebeck).

While the subject of crowdfunding is relatively new to me, making music while
collecting money for a worthy cause isn’t. During my time as a label manager I
was involved in several successful benefit projects, for example: A therapy center
for traumatized women and children in Croatia, anticensorship campaign for the
Alpha Comic Books Publishing, the homeless in Germany and the Mohawk Revolt at
Kahnawake, Canada a. o.Current state of affairs
All 14 songs have been recorded, 11 of those have been mixed, hence I’ve
gotten pretty far already. If we reach the campaign goal of EUR 5.500,- , the
final mix and mastering with my favorite producer is secured.
The only thing needed now is your support, in order to complete the album. What
follows after the studio is routines, that myself and the small but efficient
team behind me has exercised a number of times in the past.

In the event that the campaign target isn’t reached, I will use any money
raised to make the best album I possibly can and all supporters will still
receive their perks.

Other ways you can help
Times are hard and maybe you aren’t able to support my album project
financially? In that case there are other ways to help. Tell your friends about
the project via your social media sites. For this purpose please use the tool provided by Indiegogo.

Let’s do this!

Kent
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

story:
My name is Tallulah Rendall I am a Songstress who has written, produced, crowdfunded 5 albums & an EP: Without Time EP (2005), Libellus (2009), Alive (2011), The Banshee And The Moon (2014) and The Liminal (2019), Mantra Album (2020).



WHY CROWDFUND?
Crowdfunding has been one of the most incredible experiences of my life.

It gives me the opportunity to connect with those who really love my music and as an Independent Artist those connections and words of encouragement have been vital.
 
It has gifted me the opportunity to be part of a community of people who believe in me and want to hear my music and over the last 15yrs many have become dear friends.
 
Without them I may never have had the chance to: release my previous 5 albums as books, with artwork, cds & download codes or collaborate with incredible visual artist, like my friend Oliver Barnett who I am currently working with.  The below video is an example of one of my previous releases, The Liminal Limited Edition Book/CD/Download.

 
I am deeply grateful to all of you who have supported me thus far and really hope you choose to join me on this next adventure!
 

ALBUM #6

Over lockdown I wrote a collection of songs that have been medicine for me during a time of isolation; for it is through my journey of songwriting that I grow, heal and feel connected to others.

I am so grateful that this summer, I was invited to perform them at festivals and gatherings, accompanied by Emmy on Harp & Fede on Double bass.

To be honest, after a year and half of not being able to share my music in person, to sing to audiences and hear them sing along with me was incredible.

I felt this collection of songs had the potential to inspire and unite but after witnessing the response of audiences, I know they really will bring joy and healing to many and that it is really important I make this album.


ABOUT THE ALBUM 
Inspired by the Loving Kindness Meditations that became my daily practice in Lockdown, the theme of this album is based around love & connection.

Hay Amor - a song that invites us to explore how beneath all the fears we hold there is love.

The Expanse Of You -  I was deeply honoured this year to be invited to join the Amplify in Nature Course held by Sam Lee - an exploration of how as Artists, we can deepen our connection to nature.  One evening on a night walk I sat in the darkness, leaning against a tree and journeyed deep into the stillness and loving embrace of the wildness around me and made a commitment 'I will be your protector like you were mine from the start'.  It was incredible experience of softening into the holding and feeling deeply connected. The below video was filmed the next day when I was finishing the lyrics.

 

I Am Enough  - At the end of a Ceremony I asked my heart for guidance and in that moment the words, 'you are loved and you are enough just as you are', echoed through.  The full song came moments later and is an invitation for all that hear and sing it to explore the possibility that we are enough just as we are.  The below video was filmed at Medicine Festival. My whole body was covered in goosebumps as I heard the audience singing the chorus with me.

 


Be Free - narrates how in those early days of the first lockdown when the sun shone, the pace slowed and many began to reflect on the possibility of changing how we live and the connection that developed through this united global experience.

Be A Little Kinder - I wrote this around the same time as Be Free when I was exploring the question 'Can we treat this world a little better, can we be a little kinder, can we take a little less and give a little more?'

Peace Inside -  A nod to the track GOLD from The Liminal, a song like Peace Inside, that invites us to remind us all that 'when the darkness takes a hold just remember the gold within you'. 

Carries Me Home  - a love song that shares the journey of finding the balance between loving another and connecting to the love within.
 
Heart Sutra & Gayatri Mantra -  I have recorded solo versions of these mantras but adding the harp & double bass just takes these tracks to a whole other level, so I have decided to include them in this album.  The Heart Sutra is a mantra that translates as 'Go go far beyond to where the wisdom lies', whilst the Gayatri can be translated as ' You, who  are the source of all power, whose rays illuminate the whole world, illuminate also my heart so that it too can do your work'. 

The below video of the Heart Sutra was filmed at Medicine Festival during the Closing Cacao Ceremony.

 

 

PRACTICAL BITS.... I need to raise £7K

Funds Will Be Used To:

  • Pay Emy Broughton (harp) & Fede (double bass)
  • A sound engineer
  • Mixing Engineer
  • Mastering Engineer
  • Studio Hire
  • Producer
  • Create A Limited Edition Version of The New Album

 

HOW TO BE INVOLVED.. PLEASE CHOOSE A PERK OR MAKE A DONATION

All those who pledge will be given a 6 month free membership to my Patreon Community.

For more info please visit www.tallulahrendall.com

I hope you feel inspired to join this project and if so I look forward to sharing this journey with you.

Please share this campaign with friends & family 

x Tallulah

BIOGRAPHY

'Tallulah uses her music as a medium to inspire change, as demonstrated by past songs such as We Don’t Want War: written in response to the Syrian Refugee Crisis, all sales from this track were donated to Save The Children.

Holding On To Love – created in support of Standing Rock - proceeds were donated to support the medical team on the ground. She went on to team up with Bristol based CIC ‘City To Sea’ creating a music video to support the prevention of plastic littering the worlds oceans - Holding Onto Love - Be The Change Video.

in 2021 she facilitated a Global Creative Collaboration In Lockdown. Bringing together people from all around the world and creating a video imbued with positivity and joy for GOLD, the opening track from her 4th album The Liminal.

Nominated for the Woman of the Future Arts & Culture Award in 2014 and hailed as ‘London’s most creative woman’ by AOL, Tallulah was one of the first artists to introduce crowdfunding in 2006 with her first EP Without Time.

Celebrated by Latitude Festival for her “Voice of an angel”, she was the first musician to introduce Living Room Tours across the UK. She performed on the fourth plinth in Trafalgar Square as part of Antony Gormley’s One & Other project, and has played to crowds of 10,000 plus at festivals worldwide, including Glastonbury and The Secret Garden Party. She has also successfully placed music in films, including Time Fades in the number one iTunes hit Truth or Dare.

Distinct from any other artist, Tallulah releases her albums within beautiful illustrated hardcover books which come complete with lyrics, the story behind the album, and in this instance, exquisite photos by Japanese photographer Akio Fukushima which reflect the songs in their energy and essence.

Having learnt to maintain her health through a mix of Chinese medicine, acupuncture and nutrition plus training in qi gong and sound therapy, Tallulah became inspired to support the wellbeing of others, leading to the creation of her Wild Singing and creative facilitation workshops, sound journeys and one-to-one sound therapy sessions. She travels worldwide weaving her beautiful voice with guitar, drum, gongs and Himalayan singing bowls – the harmonic, crystal clear sounds reflecting the qualities and her experience of ‘The Liminal’. Her many facilitated sound journeys in 2018 included a Sound Bath Healing Meditation at The Tate Modern in London.

She is also a Creative Facilitator, Qi Gong Teacher & Sound Therapist, empowering people through Qi Gong & Sound Meditation to connect to their creative expression and lead happier, healthier and more embodied lives.'

WANT TO FIND OUT MORE watch this video

My whole body was covered in goosebumps as I heard the audience singing the chorus with me. 
Be Free - narrates how in those early days of the first lockdown when the sun shone, the pace slowed and many began to reflect on the possibility of changing how we live and the connection that developed through this united global experience.Be A Little Kinder - I wrote this around the same time as Be Free when I was exploring the question 'Can we treat this world a little better, can we be a little kinder, can we take a little less and give a little more?'Peace Inside -  A nod to the track GOLD from The Liminal, a song like Peace Inside, that invites us to remind us all that 'when the darkness takes a hold just remember the gold within you'. Carries Me Home  - a love song that shares the journey of finding the balance between loving another and connecting to the love within. 
Heart Sutra & Gayatri Mantra -  I have recorded solo versions of these mantras but adding the harp & double bass just takes these tracks to a whole other level, so I have decided to include them in this album.  The Heart Sutra is a mantra that translates as 'Go go far beyond to where the wisdom lies', whilst the Gayatri can be translated as ' You, who  are the source of all power, whose rays illuminate the whole world, illuminate also my heart so that it too can do your work'. The below video of the Heart Sutra was filmed at Medicine Festival during the Closing Cacao Ceremony.  PRACTICAL BITS.... I need to raise £7KFunds Will Be Used To:
Pay Emy Broughton (harp) & Fede (double bass)
A sound engineer
Mixing Engineer
Mastering Engineer
Studio Hire
Producer
Create A Limited Edition Version of The New Album
 HOW TO BE INVOLVED.. PLEASE CHOOSE A PERK OR MAKE A DONATIONAll those who pledge will be given a 6 month free membership to my Patreon Community.For more info please visit www.tallulahrendall.comI hope you feel inspired to join this project and if so I look forward to sharing this journey with you.Please share this campaign with friends & family x TallulahBIOGRAPHY'Tallulah uses her music as a medium to inspire change, as demonstrated by past songs such as We Don’t Want War: written in response to the Syrian Refugee Crisis, all sales from this track were donated to Save The Children.Holding On To Love – created in support of Standing Rock - proceeds were donated to support the medical team on the ground. She went on to team up with Bristol based CIC ‘City To Sea’ creating a music video to support the prevention of plastic littering the worlds oceans - Holding Onto Love - Be The Change Video.in 2021 she facilitated a Global Creative Collaboration In Lockdown. Bringing together people from all around the world and creating a video imbued with positivity and joy for GOLD, the opening track from her 4th album The Liminal.Nominated for the Woman of the Future Arts & Culture Award in 2014 and hailed as ‘London’s most creative woman’ by AOL, Tallulah was one of the first artists to introduce crowdfunding in 2006 with her first EP Without Time.Celebrated by Latitude Festival for her “Voice of an angel”, she was the first musician to introduce Living Room Tours across the UK. She performed on the fourth plinth in Trafalgar Square as part of Antony Gormley’s One & Other project, and has played to crowds of 10,000 plus at festivals worldwide, including Glastonbury and The Secret Garden Party. She has also successfully placed music in films, including Time Fades in the number one iTunes hit Truth or Dare.Distinct from any other artist, Tallulah releases her albums within beautiful illustrated hardcover books which come complete with lyrics, the story behind the album, and in this instance, exquisite photos by Japanese photographer Akio Fukushima which reflect the songs in their energy and essence.Having learnt to maintain her health through a mix of Chinese medicine, acupuncture and nutrition plus training in qi gong and sound therapy, Tallulah became inspired to support the wellbeing of others, leading to the creation of her Wild Singing and creative facilitation workshops, sound journeys and one-to-one sound therapy sessions. She travels worldwide weaving her beautiful voice with guitar, drum, gongs and Himalayan singing bowls – the harmonic, crystal clear sounds reflecting the qualities and her experience of ‘The Liminal’. Her many facilitated sound journeys in 2018 included a Sound Bath Healing Meditation at The Tate Modern in London.She is also a Creative Facilitator, Qi Gong Teacher & Sound Therapist, empowering people through Qi Gong & Sound Meditation to connect to their creative expression and lead happier, healthier and more embodied lives.'WANT TO FIND OUT MORE watch this video

story:
Welcome!

I'm stoked you made it here! My name is Maggie Mae, and I am a musician in the process of accomplishing my life-long dream of recording my first album!

I have been writing songs ever since I received that karaoke machine for Christmas in 1998, and started gigging with my parents in the 2nd grade. I was born into a very musical family, and probably attended a few of my parents’ gigs in the womb. In 2019, my band opened for legendary Soulive at the Ardmore Music Hall, and accomplished the release of our debut single “Hometown,” during the year that was 2020.

“It’s been a long time coming” is an understatement, but I'm finally working on my debut full-length album which will be jam packed with songs I've written and performed over the past 12 years. We've already recorded the better part of the album, but after lots of careful consideration, I've decided to add 3 more songs which are very near and dear to my heart, rounding this album out at a solid 10 tracks.

Here's where you come in!

With $12,000, I'll be able to:

  • pay for studio time to record these last three songs ($650)
  • pay my producer, Robby Webb, for producing, recording, and mixing all 10 songs ($6,000)
  • pay all of the wonderfully talented musicians featured on this album (~$1,500+)
  • pay myself back for what we've already done in the studio ($2,200)
  • get the album mixed & mastered ($850)
  • get professional photos taken to help with the promotion of the album (~$300+)
  • pay for promotion of the album (varies)
  • make a music video if the remaining budget allows!

 Crucial stuff!

Be a part of my dream!

Obviously, this is a childhood dream come true and I can't believe it’s taken me this long, but I've had these songs living inside my soul for over 12 years and they represent my entire life up to this point. This album is so important because this body of work is just what I need in order to express myself in my most authentic form, take the next step in my career by having something to promote myself with, and most importantly, finally allow people to hear my music! 

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

I am fully committed to finishing this album, but I need your help to make it as big as it can be. I definitely don’t want to cut any of these songs, but if we don’t meet our funding goal, we will need to cut the last 3 songs and potentially push back the release date.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute at this time but you love me & my music, please consider sharing with anyone who supports women in music and enjoys helping people achieve life-long dreams! 

  • Share this campaign on your socials, or take it a step further by telling your philanthropic friends directly!
  • FOLLOW us on | Instagram | Facebook | Spotify | Youtube | 
  • LIKES, SHARES, COMMENTS go a long way and cost nothing! 
  • Artist or graphic designer? Maybe we can collab!

 

Endless gratitude to you, I can't wait for you to be part of this exciting project with me! xoxo

story:
AT LAST! BECAUSE YOU DEMANDED IT! JBPWAVE... ON VINYL!

The first new Akira The Don and Jordan Peterson album since 2019's acclaimed FATHER is out now! And this time, for the first time, we're going make JBPWAVE available on vinyl!

Akira The Don & Jordan Peterson - JBPWAVE: Aesthetic

  • 17 epic new tracks that will enrich your life!
  • Available for the first time ever on double vinyl!
  • Gorgeous full color art work by Phazed
  • PLUS! Because you've been demanding it for YEARS we're also gonna make the classic album JBPWAVE: GENESIS available on vinyl as well!

What is Meaningwave?

Meaningwave is a musical psychotechnology developed by Akira The Don with the aim of helping listeners to achieve their potential in this lifetime. Meaningwave albums have integrated the words of Alan Watts, Jordan Peterson, Joe Rogan, Joseph Campbell, Jocko Willink, Marcus Aurelius, Terence McKenna and many more!

 

YOU ASKED FOR IT, NOW WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE IT HAPPEN!

You've been asking us to make Meaningwave music available on vinyl since we started making it. In 2020 we made our first campaign, and got the Alan Watts WATTSWAVE Web of Life albums made! Now we're going to make it happen for JBPWAVE! Pressing vinyl is difficult and expensive, so to do it, and do it properly, we're crowdfunding the process.

You'll be able to get the BRAND NEW album, JBPWAVE: Aesthetic, on gorgeous double vinyl!

You'll also be able to get the classic album JBPWAVE: GENESIS as well!

And for the completists, we have a very limited amount of WATTSWAVE vinyl as well, so you can own the complete Meaningwave vinyl collection!

PLUS! Exclusively available as part fo this campaign, the very limited edition epic art piece the JBPWAVE MONOLITH!

THE FUTURE IS PHYSICAL!

We've released over 25 Meaningwave albums digitally, and the music receives over 3 million streams EVERY MONTH... but we all know that a particularly violent bit of sunspot activity could wipe out every hard drive on the planet! Thus, to safeguard the future of this vital psychotechnology, it is our sacred mission to MAKE IT REAL! The preservation of Meaningwave music for the ages depends upon the success of this project!

PLUS!

If this project is successful, that will mean we can make more Meaningwave music available on vinyl.

That means more classic albums, like 12 Rules For Life and JBPWAVE: Paradise and Father with Jordan Peterson, THE PATH with Jocko Willink, EXPERIENCE with Joe Rogan, MEDITATIONS with Marcus Aurelius, and the rest!

JBPWAVE MONOLITH

in 2020 we made available a limited run of MEANINGWAVE MONOLITHS - hand crafted art pieces crated by Meaningwave fan and artist Dan Elliot... these sold out, and people have beeb asking us ever since if they'll ever return. Well, we have GOOD NEWS! Dan Elliot is creating a limited run of JBPWAVE MONOLITHS with a beautiful purple candy finish, available exclusively as part of this campaign!


Product description: 

 

  • Handmade
  • 16 gauge steel
  • Matte clear over raw steel with purple candy finish
  • Color changing LED lights, USB connection 
  • 11 inches wide
  • 9 inches tall
  • 4 inches deep
  • 4.5 lbs

 

 

STRETCH GOALS

 

STRETCH GOAL #1: $10,000 - COLORED VINYL!

First stretch goal of 10k SMASHED BEFORE WE EVEN ANNOUNCED IT!

VINYL WILL BE COLORED! HURRAH!

STRETCH GOAL #2: $16,000 - GATEGOLD VINYL

We're gonna make the vinyl beautiful double gatefold!

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!

STRETCH GOAL #3: $18,000 - LYRIC BOOK INSERT

At 18k we'll add a beautiful full size LYRIC BOOK so you can READ THE LYRICS while you ENJOY YOUR VINYL!

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!

STRETCH GOAL #4: $20,000 - BE A PLUMBER 7" SINGLE

At $20k everyone who backed the vinyl at any level will get a FREE 7" single of the VERY FIRST MEANINGWAVE SONG... BE A PLUMBER!!!!

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!

STRETCH GOAL #5:  $21,000 - 7" COLORED VINYL!

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!

STRETCH GOAL #6: $29,000 - JBPWAVE 3 TURNED INTO AN ALBUM!!!!

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!

STRETCH GOAL #7: $30,000 - YOUTUBE HERO ALEX FACE REVEAL!

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!

STRETCH GOAL #8: $34,000 - HIRE AN ORCHESTRA!

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!

STRETCH GOAL #9: $39,000 - JBPWAVE 4 TURNED INTO AN ALBUM!!!!

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!

STRETCH GOAL #10: $45,000 - MORECHESTRA!!

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!

STRETCH GOAL #11: $48,000 - SECRET GOAL DETAILS TO BE ANNOUNCED!

?

STRETCH GOAL #12: $50,000 - JBPWAVE 5 TURNED INTO AN ALBUM!!!!

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED!

 

 

Risks & Challenges

 ̶I̶f̶ ̶t̶h̶i̶s̶ ̶p̶r̶o̶j̶e̶c̶t̶ ̶i̶s̶ ̶n̶o̶t̶ ̶f̶u̶n̶d̶e̶d̶,̶ ̶e̶v̶e̶r̶y̶o̶n̶e̶ ̶w̶i̶l̶l̶ ̶b̶e̶ ̶r̶e̶f̶u̶n̶d̶e̶d̶!̶ ̶

Zero risks! The manufacturing goal was crossed and the campaign was funded in under 12 hours! JBPWAVE VINYL IS CONFIRMED!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe physical isn't for you, but you'd still like to support the wave?

If for some odd reason you don't like vinyl, you could share this campaign with someone that does!

Or you can join the Patreon, download the music, buy some merch, or make a one-time donation!

THANK YOU FOR BEING HERE AND SHARING YOUR LIGHT WITH THE WORLD! LOVE TO YOU AND YOUR FAMILY!
