story:
The Good Vibes Band Debut Album

Thank you for checking out our campaign!

We, The Good Vibes Band, have been playing live shows in San Diego as a band for the last 8 years. These days, we play 3-4 shows a week all throughout San Diego County. We love playing live music - it's been our main source of inspiration for this project.

We finally decided to make the push as a band to get into the studio and put the needle to the wax. We researched the places to record and the people to record with, and decided to go with the best of the best. We will be recording the album at Big Fish Studios in Encinitas with Blake LaGrange, the owner of mastering.com and an expert producer, not to mention an old friend from high school. The date for recording is just around the corner, March 13 & 14.

We decided to launch this fundraising campaign because this project is URGENT! Since setting a recording date in January, we have written 5 brand new songs! In addition to our more seasoned material, we want to capture the excitement of our new originals - we want you to feel the newness of it all. In order to do that, we need the funding to make that happen in an efficient manner.

Recording the live band in the studio is only the first step in this process. After that, the music needs to be mixed, mastered, and distributed. Additionally, we will need professional album art and videos in order to help promote the music. As a local band, this all adds up to a budget that is unwieldy. However, with a little help from our fans and supporters, this will be no problem at all and we will be able to get a finished product to you in a very reasonable amount of time. We are looking forward to album tours in both California and Brazil, Summer 2020!

What We Need & What You Get

Let's get right down to business. Here's what everything is going to cost.

  1. Studio time - 2 days x $650/day = $1300
  2. Mixing - $100-$500/song x 13 songs = $2000+
  3. Mastering - $500
  4. Distribution (digital & CD release) - $1500
  5. Video and Artwork - $500-$1000
  6. Copyright - $100

As full-time musicians, we live paycheck-to-paycheck. We want to contribute to this product what we can, so we've set our fundraising goal at $5000. We want to make it clear that we will be recording this project no matter what on March 13 and 14. Where we really need support is going beyond the studio and making this into something special. We want this music to be of the highest quality and available to everyone as soon as possible.

Now let's talk about what you get.

  1. $10 - Signed Thank You Note from the Band
  2. $20 - Pre-release Download of Album
  3. $35 - Signed Copy of CD
  4. $60 - Original Album Artwork Poster & Pre-release Download
  5. $400 - Private House Concert & Pre-release Download & Poster
  6. $1000 - Executive Producer Credits

Those are some sweet perks! Now, if we don't reach our goal, you will still get your perks. That's right, we are doing this no matter what. We are intent on making this album a reality.

Do you feel the good vibes?

This has been our mantra at shows for years now. Every time we ask our fans this, we get a flood of whoops and hollers from the crowd. That's how we know this music works. This music is all about feeling good. It's about being social. It's about having fun.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our page to help spread the word!

story:
WE ARE FINALLY MAKING A RECORD. 
This is our first full album since 2009.
We are recording in Cleveland at the end of July. 
Jim Wirt (JCS, Incubus, Live, many others) is producing it.
Tom Lord-Alge (JCS and too many to name) is mixing it. 
We are stoked to be releasing new music and we want you to be a vital part in creating this work. We have created perks for all contribution levels that will be exclusive to this campaign and you will receive before anyone else. We are using the funds to pay for production costs, staying in Cleveland, manufacturing and promotions. Check out the different perk levels and please email or share this campaign on social media to anyone you think might be interested. 
YOU RAWK!

story:
Join me in the Release of my New CD- "I Can Face the Truth." 

Background about this New Release:

I have been writing songs, recording and touring for a long time now. From my work with major labels like Elektra Records and Southcoast MCA, to Indie labels like Compass Records, King Easy, and Travianna, it has been an exciting musical journey that has won me a wealth of experience and friends. Thanks to those good friends and supporters I have launched and conducted many successful funding campaigns over the years. Now I'm about to release my newest recording project entitled "I Can Face the Truth" and I can't wait for you to hear it. 

In the past year while unable to play "LIVE" Shows I was fortunate to continue working with my co-producer, engineer, and multi instrumentalist Dave Coleman. Masked and distanced together in his Howard's Apartment Studio we enlisted some of Nashville's best singers and musicians to breathe life into our creation. We even called on two wonderful singers in Belfast and County Meath to sing harmony. The result of all this "Creative energy" is a collection of 12 original songs plus one of my favorites by Hank Williams. This has been the most fun I've ever had in the studio and I consider this to be my best recording to date. 

Some of the folks who contributed musically to this project are:

Dave Coleman - Guitar, Bass, Drums, Keyboard, Vocals, Engineer, Co-Producer

Chris Benelli - Drums

Paul Slivka - Bass Guitar

Tim Lorsch - Violin, Viola, and Cello

Brother Paul Brown - Hammond B3. 

Guest Vocalists Include:

Tom Kimmel - Bluebird

David Starr - Always Old Friends

Jonell Mosser - Always Old Friends & I'm Just Passing Through Here

Maura O'Connell - Summer in America & Humankind 

Gillian Tuite & Joseph Murray - Flower and the Vine

Rebecca Folsom - Walls

Song Co-writers: 

Kim Richey - Flower and the Vine

Tom Kimmel - Bluebird

Rebecca Folsom - Walls

Elva Hahn - Ours for a Little While

Robert Weingartz - Always Old Friends

Dave Coleman - I Know a Girl

All 13 songs are recorded and mixed and ready for Mastering. There are many expenses yet to come and as an independent artist this is where I need your help. I have a modest estimate for what it will cost to garner the attention and airplay this CD deserves which totals at least $15,000. These expenses include: Studio Costs, Mastering, Manufacturing, Publicist, Radio Promotion, Mail Outs to Press and Radio, Video Production, Merchandise Line for Promotion. 

I am calling on my "Devoted Fans & Friends" to be a vital part of bringing this project to fruition. I see music as a healing power, a common language that can unite us, and a source of great joy during times of trouble, and I trust that you do too. 

So I invite you to check out my Donation Tiers. You will find many choices of participation from a Pre-Release Download and Physical Copies of the CD, to "One-of-a-Kind" Vintage Western Shirts, and T-shirts, Songwriting Mentorships, and even In-Person House Concerts. Choose the level you are comfortable with and play an active role in releasing "I Can Face the Truth."

Even if you can't donate a dollar amount you can be a great help by spreading the word of my campaign to other music lovers. If you can welcome one friend to be a part of this effort through Twitter or Facebook or by smoke signal, please do. 

** With ANY Contribution- you will be Entered into a Raffle to win an In-Person House Concert & "Vintage Rare Items" spanning my career. Winner will be Announced on Release Date of the CD via Video. We anticipate official release the first quarter of 2022.

Together we can accomplish so much and I am excited to offer you such great perks for participating in this campaign. 

Thanks from the heart!

Dana Cooper

story:
Dear friends,

We are asking for your kind generosity to help fund our new film opera, The Styx (instagram account: @thestyx_filmopera).

The Styx will be created by writer/director Katie Byford, composer Athanasia Kontou, and soloist/performer Helene Mathiesen, and it is co-partnered with the Medusa Collective, The Writing Squad, and PTSD UK. We are proud and honoured that our project will be supported by an Arts Council England Project Grant.

The Project

Written for voice, violoncello, clarinet and electronics, the short film follows a woman’s treatment for PTSD following sexual assault. During EMDR therapy she probes her subconscious and confronts traumatic memories. This surreal, dreamlike journey becomes a parallel quest to the Underworld, guided by its Queen, goddess Persephone, herself a survivor of sexual violence.

We wish to centre the narrative of recovery after sexual violence, which will intertwine with the myth of Persephone, symbolic of rebirth and renewal in ancient Greek culture, to underscore the message that trauma survivors have the power to heal themselves. In light of the increasing cases of sexual misconduct within the arts sector, we believe this project will have a valuable contribution to the important discussions around recovery.

Your Support

This funding will go towards the workshops and recording costs for the musicians and composer. If we are lucky enough to exceed our goal, we will put the funds to towards the filming phase of the project. 

We are excited to be able to offer our supporters of £30 or more first access to booking for our online roundtable discussing PTSD with poet Mariah Whelan, composer/vocalist Laura Bowler, and an EMDR therapist.  £20 donations will get early access to the text and muscial score. There are a limited number of Associate Producer and Executive Producer credits available for our most generous supporters.

We are running this campaign until Sunday 31st October, which is when the team will be making the final recording of the score. Follow our progress on here or our Instagram page: @thestyx_filmopera 

Thank you so much for supporting us, for sharing this campaign, and for being a part of the development of The Styx.  We are all thrilled to be working on this project, and cannot wait to share the results with you!

The Creative Team

Athanasia Kontou, composer:

Athanasia is a Manchester-based composer from Greece. She studied at the Royal Northern College of Music, where she completed the Masters course and the PGDip in Composition (90% Distinction), both supported by entrance scholarships from the RNCM.

She is the 2019 Christopher Brooks Composition Prize winner, awarded by the Royal Liverpool Philharmonic Orchestra. Her works have been performed in a concert or workshop setting by the Antwerp Symphony Orchestra, the Elias Quartet, the Ligeti Quartet, the BBC Singers, pianist Adam Swayne, and pianist Ian Pace. Other works have premiered at the New Music Manchester Festival, and the Zeitströme festival (Darmstadt).

This season, as well as working on ‘The Styx’, she will be writing a new work for ensemble recherche which will premiere in Freiburg in December, and a work for Psappha Ensemble, commissioned for their 30th season. In April, her monodrama based on Antigone by Sophocles will be premiered in Liverpool by Ensemble 10/10 under Clark Rundell, with Laura Bowler as the soloist. This is Athanasia’s second time working with poet and filmmaker Katie Byford.

www.athanasiakontou.com

Katie Byford, writer/director:

Katie Byford is a former Barbican Young Poet and was the winner of the 2020 Oxford Brookes International Poetry Prize with her poem ‘Appetit, for Persephone’. Her debut pamphlet he said I was a peach was recently published with ignitionpress, Oxford Brookes Poetry Centre.  Poetry commissions and performances include Durham Castle, Spread the Word, The Wellcome Collection and the Houses of Parliament. She has led workshops and talks for Durham University and UCL, and has had work published in Magma, Popshot, Modern Poetry in Translation, and anthologies from Bloodaxe Books and Macmillan.

Katie has produced numerous BFI-backed shorts as well as one of the 2020 Jerwood/FVU Award-winning artist films, Guy Oliver's You Know Nothing of My Work, which was recently nominated for The Jarman Award.  Katie this year completed her debut short: based on her own experiences, You Look Fine offers a glimpse of life with PTSD, and will begin its festival run in November 2021.

www.kmrbyford.com

Helene Mathiesen, voice/performer/producer:

Helene is a graduate of the Royal Northern College of Music. Helene has a passion for contemporary opera has premiered Folk Tales, a one woman operetta for soprano and violin at Tête à Tête’s 2020 Opera festival, Empress Eugine in The Language of Flowers (Tête à Tête 2021), The Woman in Five Stones by Eldad Diamont, Dr A in the Hive by Harvey Brough at the Liverpool Philharmonic and ‘The Growth of Silk’ by William Hearne, premiered at Brighton and Camden Fringe.

With a passion for challenging the preconceived perceptions of opera, Helene set up Medusa Collective, a feminist arts collective  producing new works focused on forging new interdisciplinary alliances between different art forms. Medusa Collective will be co-partners for this project. 

www.medusacollective.com

Isobel Mortimer, clarinet/bass clarinet:

Isobel Mortimer is a clarinettist with a keen interest in contemporary music. She is the founding
member of SHOAL, a new music ensemble focused on improvisation and
interdisciplinary collaboration. 

https://www.isobelmortimermusic.com/about

Gunda Baranauskaité, violoncello: 

Gunda Baranauskaité is an international prize-winning cellist. Between 2013-2017, she was a member of the Lithuanian National Symphony orchestra as well as the “Artro” piano quartet. Since 2016 Gunda has been performing with the contemporary music ensemble ‘Synaesthesis’. She is currently on trial with The Hallé and the Royal Scottish National Orchestra. Gunda is also the co-founder of the Manchester-based SONO ensemble.

https://gundab.wixsite.com/gundacellist/bio

Sound enginner: Cally Statham
story_txt: Dear friends,We are asking for your kind generosity to help fund our new film opera, The Styx (instagram account: @thestyx_filmopera).The Styx will be created by writer/director Katie Byford, composer Athanasia Kontou, and soloist/performer Helene Mathiesen, and it is co-partnered with the Medusa Collective, The Writing Squad, and PTSD UK. We are proud and honoured that our project will be supported by an Arts Council England Project Grant.The ProjectWritten for voice, violoncello, clarinet and electronics, the short film follows a woman’s treatment for PTSD following sexual assault. During EMDR therapy she probes her subconscious and confronts traumatic memories. This surreal, dreamlike journey becomes a parallel quest to the Underworld, guided by its Queen, goddess Persephone, herself a survivor of sexual violence.We wish to centre the narrative of recovery after sexual violence, which will intertwine with the myth of Persephone, symbolic of rebirth and renewal in ancient Greek culture, to underscore the message that trauma survivors have the power to heal themselves. In light of the increasing cases of sexual misconduct within the arts sector, we believe this project will have a valuable contribution to the important discussions around recovery.Your SupportThis funding will go towards the workshops and recording costs for the musicians and composer. If we are lucky enough to exceed our goal, we will put the funds to towards the filming phase of the project. We are excited to be able to offer our supporters of £30 or more first access to booking for our online roundtable discussing PTSD with poet Mariah Whelan, composer/vocalist Laura Bowler, and an EMDR therapist.  £20 donations will get early access to the text and muscial score. story:
A Garden Tomb Live Album with Joshua Aaron! 

We are so excited to announce the forthcoming Garden Tomb Live album! We will be recording a whole new album and music video, which will be available digitally (YouTube, iTunes etc) and on CD and DVD.

The recording/filming is scheduled for this upcoming September and there will be a live band featuring special guest, Aaron Shust and my friends right here in Israel!

I am so thrilled to be able to perform and record this album in a very special location in Jerusalem. The Garden Tomb! The place where we remember that HE HAS RISEN! 

Do you want to be part of this project?

As we've learned filming the Tower of David album, there is a lot of work and a big budget that goes into a Live Album. The Tower record was one of my favorite projects to date! So I am looking forward to this one, which has been on my heart for over two years now. What better time to film a LIVE album in Israel, than now. We're celebrating victory over an intense year here in Israel.  Covid is behind us and thanks-be-to-GOD the barrage of 4,300+ rockets has come to an end, We're coming back to life again in Yeshua's Name!

I would be thrilled if you would help join me in this special project

We are looking to raise $80,000 USD. This will cover:

  • Live recording/team (12 songs or more)
  • Filming and staging for the Live Performance 
  • Hiring of a band and crew
  • Cost of having some special guests, including their accommodations
  • Professional mixing and mastering of the Album
  • Full video production filming and editing
  • Printing and production of the CDs and DVDs

If you are able, your help in this project would mean so much to me! 

Why the Garden Tomb?

The Garden Tomb is a beautiful oasis in the heart of Jerusalem. Once you enter the location, all the sounds of the busy streets disappear and it is a beautiful place where people can gather to worship, share communion and most of all reflect on how our Savior conquered death! And even though it is unknown if this is the actual tomb that Yeshua rose from, it is such a great place to take a moment to remember His sacrifice and the gift of salvation that He has given us! Thus I cannot wait to worship with you from this location, whether you are able to come physically or whether you can watch it from your screen or listen to this moment of worship together!

story:
Short Summary

  • Formed in Winnipeg, Canada in 2016, Amadians are three Canadian musicians and one American singer. The band––Courtney Devon (vocals), James Roth (guitars), Ian Powell (bass), and Kyle Fox (drums)––have spent the past four years trying to distill the best components of pop and funk into the sort of songs that not only get inside your bones but that awaken that primal urge inside us all to just cut loose.

  • “Courtney and I have been writing together for years,” says guitarist James Roth. “When we first started out, we didn’t really have an intended sound or something we were aiming for, I guess we just kept writing until we found our niche. When Ian and Kyle entered the picture, we really tried to allow ourselves to flow in the direction that our group creativity led us and that always seemed to include a touch of old and a touch of new.”

  • Captured fully on their self-produced debut release, which is packed full of melody-heavy tracks that couple sultry pop vocals and rich, layered harmonies with chanky funk guitars, shiny synths, syncopated drumming, and bright, nostalgia inducing horns, the album, with pre-production assistance by Matt Schellenberg (Royal Canoe, Begonia) and engineered by Evan St. Cyr, sees Amadians serving up a sound that revels in the groove of decades past and yet feels appetizingly dissimilar.

  • Exit Route will be our first full length record. The songs have been written over the course of the last 4 years. We’ve already self financed the recording, mixing, and mastering the first two songs from the album. The first single being the title track, “Exit Route”. You can view a live version of the song above. The official version will be available for download and streaming everywhere on 04/24/2020. The second single is called “Feel That Way”, and you will be hearing that later in the spring/summer. We now need help financing the additional 8 songs.

  • We spent most of 2019 releasing singles off our debut, self titled EP, “Amadians”. Most of our shows to date have been in or around our hometown of Winnipeg, MB, Canada. 2020 was the year we had planned to take our music and live show on the road. Our first shows outside of Canada were to be in the UK this May. The UK tour was to be followed by both an American tour and an extensive Canadian tour. We, like all musicians, have had to cancel or postpone all of our concerts for the time being and we’ve decided to shift all of our focus for the foreseeable future to recording our first full length album. We had originally planned to start production on the album in the fall of 2020 but circumstances dictate that the right time to produce our album is now. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • You can support us simply by pre-ordering the album (digital download, CD, or vinyl) through this INDIEGOGO crowdfunding platform. Fans wishing to support us even more have a few more packages to choose from. See Below!
  • We’ve really tried to include loads of fun and unique perks in this campaign. Every perk automatically comes with an advance instant download of the album’s first two singles, “Exit Route” and “Feel That Way”, as well as our debut, self-titled 5 song EP.  But wait, theres more! Want a one-on-one music lesson from a bandmember? A private concert for you and your friends? Can we write you a song? From limited edition t-shirts to lyric prints, we have a perk that’s right for you!
  • Your money will be going towards album recording, mixing, mastering and art design. Any additional funds left after that will be put towards album marketing. 

 

I Can't Contribute. Are There Other Ways I Can Help?

  • No Problem! You can still help us by simply sharing this campaign with as many people as you can. Let them know about us and what we're up to! Every little bit counts!
  • We know this is an extremely weird time to be asking for money from the public, so here’s what we'd like to do. If you are amped on new material, but don’t have the money to contribute, send us a PM. We’ll send you the studio versions of our first two singles for free. We are so thrilled that anyone would be anxiously anticipating our music, so it is the least we can do. We hope they bring you some joy in this time of unease.

“Courtney and I have been writing together for years,” says guitarist James Roth. “When we first started out, we didn’t really have an intended sound or something we were aiming for, I guess we just kept writing until we found our niche. Exit Route will be our first full length record. The songs have been written over the course of the last 4 years. From limited edition t-shirts to lyric prints, we have a perk that’s right for you!
Your money will be going towards album recording, mixing, mastering and art design. Any additional funds left after that will be put towards album marketing. 

 
I Can't Contribute. Are There Other Ways I Can Help?

No Problem! You can still help us by simply sharing this campaign with as many people as you can. Let them know about us and what we're up to! Every little bit counts!
We know this is an extremely weird time to be asking for money from the public, so here’s what we'd like to do. If you are amped on new material, but don’t have the money to contribute, send us a PM. We’ll send you the studio versions of our first two singles for free. We are so thrilled that anyone would be anxiously anticipating our music, so it is the least we can do. We hope they bring you some joy in this time of unease.

story:
Hello Friends!

Back in 2020, I released an album called The Sun. It's a 12 song album with frequencies of 432hz. Currently, I'm composing a new album called THE MOON.

THE MOON will incorporate healing frequencies as well! It will be unique in that it will be a purely instrumental album. The intention of this album is to help reduce anxiety and stress, to help people sleep better and feel better. With everything we've gone through during this pandemic - I hope 'THE MOON' can help press the refresh button on your soul and bring you back to Earth feeling more refreshed and peaceful. 

Let's fly to the Moon together... ! 

Love & light, 

Franki 

About my musical background: 

-Award winning singer/songwriter & classically trained pianist 

-Best music video nomination "Hollywood Film Festival"

-Billboard International Song Contest - Best Song -  Shadow 

-Performed Internationally and at Cannes Film Festival

-Mentored by Grammy award winning Phil Ramone 

-La Music Awards - best song shadow 

-Female Singer Songwriter of the Year - La music awards 

-3 full length album releases: Franki Love * Otias * The Sun

-Created the Meditation Album "Peace Within" to help reduce anxiety 

-Best song - Songwriter Universe 

-Shadow music video on Grammy ballot 

Facts about 432 Hz music:

What is so special about music tuned to 432 hz? 

Clinical studies show that 432 Hz resonates with the Heart Chakra

What is 432 hz? 

A=432 Hz, known as Verdi's 'A' is an alternative tuning that is mathematically consistent with the universe. Clinical studies show: Music based on 432Hz transmits beneficial healing energy, because it is a pure tone of math fundamental to nature.

What does 432 Hz do to the brain?

Clinical studies show that 432 Hz music is said to resonate inside the body, releasing emotional blockages and aligning you with the heartbeat of the universe. Studies say that the music is said to heighten perception, increase mental clarity and unlock intuition.

Risks & Challenges

I feel confident that I will meet the timeline of the delivery of this album to you. I've successfully completed 3 Kickstarter campaigns and 1 Indiegogo campaign. This will be my 5th album. It's important to me that you feel comfortable, so will always keep you updated on the progress and delivery time. Thank you.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if you aren't able to donate and preorder items,  you can always donate a loving thought towards this album project or share the campaign so others can donate.

namaste. love you all.

story:
Hi Friends!

I wrote an album called ‘I’m Listening’...and I need your help to bring it to life.

Doing a full length album has been a dream in my heart since I was a little girl and nudges from God and all of you guys has given me the guts to go after that dream.  Who knew albums cost so much money though, $15,000 to be exact. 

Through this season of no work for the past few months for my family and no shows or opportunities in site I need your support now more then ever to make this happen.  So many of you have asked us how you can help us through this time and this is honestly such a great way. By pre-purchasing this album it will help support the upfront production costs and allow me to move forward in actually recording it.  

Music has always been my way to communicate to God and pour my heart out to Him but it's also a tool that we have to hear from Him.  To actively declare who He is and join a heavenly sound that is so much bigger than just my world and infinitely more powerful than anything we could emotionally conjure up.  'I'M LISTENING' is going to be an album that is full of songs that reflect this concept and have allowed me to learn to posture my heart towards God and learn to sit at His feet first before I ever move.

One of the very personal reasons I am making this album is also for the legacy of my own family.  I want my kids, for the rest of their lives, to be able to hold a finished project of songs from their mothers heart that document my faith, my convictions and empower them to go after their own dreams for the sake of God's kingdom. 

Will you help me?

To make this album a reality I need your help! I've launched this IndieGoGo campaign for 30 days to see these songs become a reality with the initial goal of $15,000, a goal that can be met if even 1,000 people gave $15!

We've got lots of great perks for you - everything from an 'I'm Listening' T-Shirt, an autographed vinyl release, to an acoustic worship night in your home - so be sure to scroll around and check out the various options.

I will also be giving 10% of everything I raise to Burning Stone Ministries.  BSM is a beautiful ministry run by my good friend Karen Ward that focuses on igniting hope and healing in our Canadian Indigenous Communities, specifically the remote Northern locations. It is a ministry I have actively worked with first hand and am so excited to be partnering with. You can read more about them here: https://burningstoneministries.com  Help me bless their socks off!

 

What We Need & What You Get:

  • 15k GOAL – $1500 to Burning Stone Ministries, Mixing, Mastering, Rewards, Print CD's & Vinyl & Light PR! AWESOME!

  • 20K GOAL – All of the above + extra $1000 to Burning Stone, Spotify Promotions, Facebook Ads for the album, Radio Single and Video!

  • 40K GOAL – All of the above + extra $1000 to Burning Stone, + Recoup All Production Costs + Widespread Radio + PR + Multi Channel Launch Campaign

Help me share I'M LISTENING with you, Canada and the world! Let's do this.

Doing a full length album has been a dream in my heart since I was a little girl and nudges from God and all of you guys has given me the guts to go after that dream.  Who knew albums cost so much money though, $15,000 to be exact. 
Through this season of no work for the past few months for my family and no shows or opportunities in site I need your support now more then ever to make this happen.  So many of you have asked us how you can help us through this time and this is honestly such a great way. By pre-purchasing this album it will help support the upfront production costs and allow me to move forward in actually recording it.  
Music has always been my way to communicate to God and pour my heart out to Him but it's also a tool that we have to hear from Him.  To actively declare who He is and join a heavenly sound that is so much bigger than just my world and infinitely more powerful than anything we could emotionally conjure up.  'I'M LISTENING' is going to be an album that is full of songs that reflect this concept and have allowed me to learn to posture my heart towards God and learn to sit at His feet first before I ever move.
One of the very personal reasons I am making this album is also for the legacy of my own family.  I want my kids, for the rest of their lives, to be able to hold a finished project of songs from their mothers heart that document my faith, my convictions and empower them to go after their own dreams for the sake of God's kingdom. 
Will you help me?
To make this album a reality I need your help! I've launched this IndieGoGo campaign for 30 days to see these songs become a reality with the initial goal of $15,000, a goal that can be met if even 1,000 people gave $15!
We've got lots of great perks for you - everything from an 'I'm Listening' T-Shirt, an autographed vinyl release, to an acoustic worship night in your home - so be sure to scroll around and check out the various options.
I will also be giving 10% of everything I raise to Burning Stone Ministries.  BSM is a beautiful ministry run by my good friend Karen Ward that focuses on igniting hope and healing in our Canadian Indigenous Communities, specifically the remote Northern locations. It is a ministry I have actively worked with first hand and am so excited to be partnering with. You can read more about them here: https://burningstoneministries.com  Help me bless their socks off!
 
What We Need & What You Get:

15k GOAL – $1500 to Burning Stone Ministries, Mixing, Mastering, Rewards, Print CD's & Vinyl & Light PR! AWESOME!
20K GOAL – All of the above + extra $1000 to Burning Stone, Spotify Promotions, Facebook Ads for the album, Radio Single and Video!
40K GOAL – All of the above + extra $1000 to Burning Stone, + Recoup All Production Costs + Widespread Radio + PR + Multi Channel Launch Campaign
Help me share I'M LISTENING with you, Canada and the world! Let's do this.

story:
The rumors were true, the Targets are going back in the studio mid-April 2020 to record the follow up album to last year's Wires.

Moving Targets is an American punk/alternative rock band formed in North Shore, Massachusetts in 1982. Formed as a hardcore punk power-trio showcasing the songwriting, guitar work and emotive vocals of Kenny Chambers, the band were an important part of the Boston underground rock scene of the 80s.

Reformed in 2018 with drummer Emilien Catalano and bassist Yves Thibault for a European tour the band released a new album, "Wires" in September 2019 on Boss Tuneage records followed by another European tour.

 

Our 2020 Campaign

    Last year's campaign made the album Wires possible. Released in September 2019, it was well received and we feel that we can make an album as good this year. We want to get back in the studio in April 2020 to record the follow up to "Wires".

      The goal of this campaign is to help us go back in the studio. Your help will go towards paying the studio time, mixing and mastering. We'll be recording again with renowned producer/engineer, Tony Goddess (Papas Fritas) and Warren Babson at Bang A Song studios in Gloucester, MA.

      The record will be released on Bosstunage in late 2020.

      Picture Credit: Christian Kock,

      Video Credit: Stefan Becker.

story:
In the beginning...

I've been writing and recording music for the better part of 20 years. It's a journey that began in my parent's garage on an old Magnavox tape deck, moving into 4-track tape, and finally into the digital world. While these early projects have a special, nostalgic place in my heart, my most recent venture takes it to a completely new level. 

Over the past year, I've been learning the art of mixing and mastering music. To say the least, it's been a rewarding, all-consuming process, one that's changed my life and my outlook on music altogether. Last Summer, over lockdown, I got a membership at Noatune Studios here in East London, and took to recording some of the demos I'd tucked away from my 6-month sojourn in Ohio in 2019. 

This project brings those songs - as well as some new ones - to light, and spans the last two years of my life. It's been an interesting adventure, to say the least. I've been working closely with a mastering engineer here in London to put the final polish on these tracks, and once complete, the album is set to go to print. 

This campaign is an opportunity to contribute to the final production of the physical album. All contributions beyond the goal go towards unexpected manufacturing and shipping costs and studio fees to help me continue on this audio journey. 

 

With a little help from my friends...

It's these last stages where I'm looking for help. 

It's always been a dream of mine to have my music on vinyl, and by contributing, you help share in that dream. If records aren't your jam, I've got a multi-format release slated for all your listening needs. From cassette to CD, to digital download, I've got you covered. By contributing to the campaign, you get early access to the album before it hits streaming giants like Spotify and Apple Music, so when your friends lean over with this new fresh track from their Discover list, you're already three steps ahead of them. 

If you can't contribute monetarily, I completely understand; a like and a share goes a long way in the world of social media. By getting the word out, you get this campaign and my music to a new audience. I'm looking forward to sharing this music with you.

Thanks for coming along for the ride! I'm looking forward to sharing this music with you.

story:
ABOUT US

 

We are Fukushima Dolphin  a duo Pop/Rock/Psychedelic/electronic based in Brighton (UK), We have been playing in the current line-up for 2 years. In the two years we have played hundreds of gigs and produced our first Ep " The Furry Side EP" - Follow Link below- 

   OUR FIRST EP "THE FURRY SIDE"

 

   https://open.spotify.com/album/3JV5NHm5Ht7GwFRZ...

 

FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA

 

   Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/fukushimadolphin

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/fukushimadolphin/?hl=it

YouTube:https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3DhvyKTMaRwBaoFyrasNKw

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/6AdQ6qTDQo6wPcB...

 

WHY WE ARE CROWDFUNDING 

 

Obviously things have slowed down a lot in 2020! But we have still been playing as much as possible, producing new music and videos.

We are now really keen to make our second EP at WAX studio in Brighton, but due to the hard times don't have as much money as before, so thought we would try crowd funding for the first time!

ABOUT OUR SECOND EP

 

This EP doesn't have a title yet as we are still deciding a name for it but we are sure it will include 5 songs.

1. THE SKI SLOPE

2. ENDLESS SERIES OF ROOMS

3. REAL LIFE

4. HAPPY BIRTHDAY

5. TAKING IN THE SCENERY

We worked on  a different sound for this new EP as we really want to catch the real vibe of our performance and give an organic and alive recording.

It will be a catchy mix of medium-upbeat and a ballad song with electronic influence. But of course during the production new idea will come up.  

 

WHERE THE EP WILL BE RECORDED

 

WAX recording studio in Brighton

 

 

WHO WILL WORK ON THE EP

 

 

Japhy is the owner of the studio and he will be also our sound engineer  

Josh (Guitar/Key/Voice)

Alex (drum/Percussion)

EP EXPENSES

 

  • Recording studio          £250 to £500  
  • Sound Engineer            £250 to £500
  • Mixing                              £500
  • Mastering                       £500 
  • Artist cover                    £200 to £500
  •  CDs printing                 £270 to £500
  • Vinyl printing                £100 to £300
  • Promotion                      £500 to £1000

 

It is possible to buy perks or just donate, even just a pound would really help.

Nothings gonna stop us from making this EP! 

Thanks!

Fukushima Dolphin

story:
Thank you so much for stopping by and considering supporting my project!  

Project Summary

The purpose of this project is to invite you to help me produce 3 new original songs that I will release to the world. I plan to complete and deliver these songs to you starting in April and completing by August.  When all 3 songs are completed I will turn them into a pretty physical EP (CD) for you that I plan to have available to ship to you by September.  You can contribute just to support my music creating or you can select one of the pretty perks I have created for you (or you can do both)!  Each song will be an original song written and produced/co-produced by me, and your funding will be used to offset the many costs incurred for the production elements and other expenses involved in the release of each song and to help offset the manufacturing costs of the CD (see COSTS detailed below).   

Potential Add-on

If this campaign reaches 200% of its goal or $3,000 I will finish and self-publish a beautiful book of my original poetry and prose.  I have been working on this 150+ page book of prose and poetry for the past two years.  These extra funds will help me procure the perfect art for my book cover and hopefully also allow me to hire an illustrator so that I can have some beautiful imagery to sing alongside my words.  This book will include some of my short form poetry that you may have seen online as well as some never before seen poems and prose. 

Mission

By creating this space where we can make music together, it is my hope that this project provides a meaningful focus away from those things in life which can threaten our happiness and peace of mind.  We will be taking a group journey in delivering these sparkly new songs to the world.  I will use my many years of expertise as a songwriter, my new-found skills as a producer, and my creative spirit to make this project as unique and special as possible. 

Costs 

Here is a summary/estimate of the many costs that will be involved in creating these songs and CD:

  • Mixing/Mastering fees             $150 per song
  • Copyright Fees                            $65 per song
  • Home Studio Costs                   $75 per month
  • Co-producer Fees                       $0-$300 per song
  • Instrumentalists/Arrangers   $0-$150 each person
  • Artwork                                         $50-$300 each song
  • Post Production                          $200
  • CD Manufacturing                     $300-$500

Mixing, copyright fees and home studio fees are costs behind all my songs.  The costs of co-producers, instrumentals, arrangers, and artwork will depend on the song and the funds I am able to raise.

About me

Thank you for considering joining this project with me.  I am a multi-genre singer-songwriter, music creator and poet.  I write in the styles of adult contemporary, indie pop and jazz.  I have been singing and songwriting since I was 12 years old and have written well over a hundred songs.  My primary writing instrument is the piano.  I have released physical recordings, including an album and an EP, as well as a multitude of singles.

Risks 

As long as I stay in good health, I shouldn't have any problem delivering these songs in the timeline I've mentioned.  I have a lot of experience in the entire process of releasing music from scratch to finish.

My biggest challenge right now is being a parent of two boys during a pandemic and the demands of parenting and homeschooling coupled with losing access to my basement studio during the day. I have been accommodating this major change by doing much of my musical work before the sun comes up.  It has been challenging but not insurmountable. I also work remotely with other producers, musicians, and mix engineers to complete my pieces. 

I have a fantastic team behind me!  I have been working closely and regularly with an amazing couple for the past three years who have filled various roles in helping me complete my songs. This includes mixing, producing, co-producing, emotional support, and sharing ‘parenting-during-a-pandemic’ frustrations. I have access to a fabulous mentor who helps me in all things ‘recording’ and is there for any kind of musical emergency I might face.  (Yes, musical emergencies are a thing!)  I also have a network of incredible instrumentalists who can add lots of musical deliciousness to my creations.

I will keep you updated with my progress as we go and let you know of any delays should they happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who are able contribute to my campaign, you have my utmost gratitude.  If it is simply not possible for you to contribute but you still want to help, please share my campaign link using the tools in the upper right of the campaign.  

You can also support me by subscribing to my mailing list, streaming or purchasing my music and following/supporting me on social media.   You can access all this using the link below.  

https://ffm.bio/beccagohn

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for taking the time to read and consider my project proposal.  I am super excited to see how this little pot of artistic seeds blooms!

story:
How We Got Here

What began as a regular weekend gig, playing together at a local Methodist church in North Carolina, turned into an improvised etherial free-for-all.  Our preludes and postludes conjured many responses from the church congregation, the most common of which being: "that was interesting." 

Nonetheless, we believed in the potential of what we had discovered, and thought: "we should record some of this!"

We finally did. In 2017, Paint the Windows  was released. Since then, we've been writing more music and playing concerts. And we've also made some friends...

Our second album will be completed with help from Gabriel Kahane, Tanner Porter, and Garrett Hilliard: three extraordinary musicians who we have had the pleasure of working with and beside.

What We Need

Recording an album with collaborators in different time zones is daunting, and we need your help. Here's what we have to do:

  • Record our guitar, piano, and voice parts in New Haven, CT
  • Record the parts played and sung by our collaborators in New York, NY and Iowa City, IA.
  • Mix, Master, Manufacture CDs , (potentially press vinyl)

What You Get

Your contribution would mean the world to us, and would allow us to create our dream record! In exchange, we'd have a few things we can give you in return:

  • An exclusive pre-order of the CD
  • Signed copies of both our records
  • Your name on the record
  • An original song
  • A personal concert

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people don't have the means to contribute. We know, we're those people. But here's stuff you can do:

  • Spread the word! Send this link to everyone you've ever met, and maybe some people you haven't. Share it on Facebook. Instagram. MySpace. Email. Send out carrier pigeons. You get the picture.
  • Follow us! We'll be posting updates as the process continues, and we love keeping our fans up to date.

earlygray.com

Facebook: earlygraymusic

Twitter: @earlygray4

Instagram: @early_gray_the_band

story:
Dear Friends and Supporters,

Since 2015, we have been working on our full-length album, Malvasia, which includes original and traditional material, some of which you will have heard in our concerts, and more that is new and exciting. The full band was brought together in the studio for this project, including some of our members who are now scattered across Europe (including Stelios on the accordion and Carla on the vocals).

It is now time for us to release our music.

The material is recorded and we are now in the final stages of the production process (mixing, mastering), before moving onto manufacture followed by a PR campaign. Once the album is out (CD and Vinyl formats!), we plan to launch it with a huge party, true to our Mediterranean roots, and hope that as many of you as possible will be able to join us (post-pandemic restrictions, of course).

We are reaching out to you to help us finalise this now overdue project. We plan to have the album ready within the next 6 months. 

How will we be using this funding?
-Master the album tracks 
-Design and print the albums (digital, CD and Vinyl formats)
-Launch a PR campaign to spread the word and reach new fans  (specific PR companies do this)

We are planning to raise £3000 to cover the remaining cost of our project. 

*UPDATE* 
We have reached our target £3000 in record time thanks to all of you and our tracks have now been mixed and mastered.

We are now aiming for our 'stretch goal' of £6000. This will allow us to fully fund a successful international PR campaign (£1000) and to organise an epic album launch at a London venue, where we will invite pizzica bands from Italy and France to join us (post-Covid restrictions of course!). We hope that this will take place in Autumn 2021.

Have a look at the range of rewards in exchange for your generous contributions and musical support.

How this will help us

We are an independent band and have, so far, self-funded all our recording projects. Usually we raise funds through concerts, saving a little bit from each gig payment. But as we all know, 2020 has been unexpectedly harsh for all artists. Your contribution will help us to do the following:

  • Finalise an album that we have been slowly self-funding for the past 4 years;
  • Enable us to fund a campaign that will help us reach a wider audience and that will promote our music beyond our usual fans;
  • Give us a real energy and confidence boost in getting this album done and sent out to all of our supporters (you!)

Other ways you can help

We know first hand that not everyone is in a position to help financially. However, you can still help!

  • Help us spread the word about this campaign and tell your friends about it.
  • Share our music and have a look at our YouTube Lockdown videos.
  • Like us on Facebook if you haven't already.
  • Share the album once its out and come to one of our gigs once they are back up and running.

THANK YOU ALL FOR YOUR WONDERFUL HELP AND SUPPORT!
story_txt:
Dear Friends and Supporters,
Since 2015, we have been working on our full-length album, Malvasia, which includes original and traditional material, some of which you will have heard in our concerts, and more that is new and exciting. The full band was brought together in the studio for this project, including some of our members who are now scattered across Europe (including Stelios on the accordion and Carla on the vocals).
It is now time for us to release our music.
The material is recorded and we are now in the final stages of the production process (mixing, mastering), before moving onto manufacture followed by a PR campaign. Once the album is out (CD and Vinyl formats!), we plan to launch it with a huge party, true to our Mediterranean roots, and hope that as many of you as possible will be able to join us (post-pandemic restrictions, of course).
We are reaching out to you to help us finalise this now overdue project. We plan to have the album ready within the next 6 months. 
How will we be using this funding?-Master the album tracks -Design and print the albums (digital, CD and Vinyl formats)-Launch a PR campaign to spread the word and reach new fans  (specific PR companies do this)
We are planning to raise £3000 to cover the remaining cost of our project. 
*UPDATE* We have reached our target £3000 in record time thanks to all of you and our tracks have now been mixed and mastered.
We are now aiming for our 'stretch goal' of £6000. This will allow us to fully fund a successful international PR campaign (£1000) and to organise an epic album launch at a London venue, where we will invite pizzica bands from Italy and France to join us (post-Covid restrictions of course!). We hope that this will take place in Autumn 2021.
Have a look at the range of rewards in exchange for your generous contributions and musical support.

How this will help us
We are an independent band and have, so far, self-funded all our recording projects. Usually we raise funds through concerts, saving a little bit from each gig payment. But as we all know, 2020 has been unexpectedly harsh for all artists. Your contribution will help us to do the following:

Finalise an album that we have been slowly self-funding for the past 4 years;
Enable us to fund a campaign that will help us reach a wider audience and that will promote our music beyond our usual fans;
Give us a real energy and confidence boost in getting this album done and sent out to all of our supporters (you!)


Other ways you can help
We know first hand that not everyone is in a position to help financially. However, you can still help!

Help us spread the word about this campaign and tell your friends about it.
Share our music and have a look at our YouTube Lockdown videos.

Like us on Facebook if you haven't already.
Share the album once its out and come to one of our gigs once they are back up and running.

THANK YOU ALL FOR YOUR WONDERFUL HELP AND SUPPORT!

story:
We are Holy Death Trio...

A heavy rock power trio from Austin, TX.  Our music can be described as Heavy F'in Rock-N-Roll and some would put us in the category of Stoner Rock.  Our goal is to transcend what has already been done in these genres and pump up the production value to put our album next to a classic album and not tell the difference in age or quality.

We’re ready to release our 1st full length album: BLACK WAVE. Composed over the last year, this 10 song album is heavy, catchy, groovy, technical, tasteful and more immersive than any of our music in the past. In short, it's going to make you move.  We have already recorded half of the album with Charles Godfrey of Scary American Studios, who has worked at the legendary Sonic Ranch Studio's recording some of the best hits in the last 10 years and we are ready to get back into that studio and record the second half.

We are proud of this music and can’t wait to send it out into the universe, but we need more funds to finish the job. Making an album is expensive and since we are not affiliated with a record label, the funds can only come from ourselves and our supporters. This campaign is to bring our community together to try and make this album a reality. If you like what we do, please consider pledging for a copy of the record or one of the other perks we’re offering. Every little bit helps.

We are truly grateful for all the love you’ve shown us and can’t thank you enough for the support! 

Your friends,

Holy Death Trio

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

What We Need

Here’s a breakdown of the costs of releasing this record:

Recording: $6000

Mastering: $1500

Vinyl Pressing: $1500

Record Jackets: $600

Album Art: $500

PR: $900

Total: $11,000

Since we’ve already invested close to $3000 of our own money into the first half of the recording, we lowered our goal for this campaign to $7500. If we surpass our goal, we’ll put that money towards music videos and other advertisements to push album sales.

What You Get...

The number one thing we hope you get from this campaign?… a copy of the record! However, if you’re interested in something different we’ve got you covered at all these different levels. 

Please note: all perks $10 and above get a digital download of the album.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

$5 - Just a little something to help!

Even if you don't have a lot of cash to spend, you can make a difference in our campaign by putting your name on our list of supporters. Every donation, no matter how small, adds to our momentum and reach.

$10 - Digital Download

Get our new album, "BLACK WAVE" in lossless audio format before anyone else.

 

$25 - Purple Death Shirt

Get this limited edition shirt and a digital download of the album.

$25 - Handwritten Lyrics

You get the lyrics to the album handwritten and doodled on by the band and a digital download.

$30 - Vinyl Record

If we had one perk we recommend above all others, this is the one. Get our new album "BLACK WAVE" as it was meant to be heard: on vinyl. Please be advised that to be a little easier on the environment, we are NOT shrink-wrapping the records in plastic. A positive side effect is that we can sign the cover for you.  Includes a digital download.

$40 - Shirt + Digital Download

You get a choice of shirt in any size and a digital download of the album.

$50 - Shirt + Vinyl

You get a choice of shirt in any size, a vinyl and digital download of the album.

$60 - Disposable Camera

We will take a bunch of pictures during practice or in the studio on a disposable camera and send it to you for development so you can have some one of a kind photos that will never happen again! Also includes a Vinyl and Digital Download.

$75 - Music Lesson

Learn from HOLY DEATH TRIO! Pick any band member to give you a 1 hour individual lesson.  We can teach you a riff or technique, song writing structure, etc. If you don't live close to Austin, we can do a video chat. Includes the album on vinyl or digital.

$75 - Limited Run Lathe Cut 7" Vinyl

Only 20 Limited Release Lathe Cut 7" Vinyls will be made from two singles on this record.  With custom artwork and a digital download of the album.

$90 - Attend Our Listening Party & Jam

We'll get the band together in Austin to take a full listen and toast the new record with some drinks and food. Any person that donates $90 or above is invited to join us for this celebration! You'll be one of the first people to hear it. A jam is sure to break out, so bring your instruments. Includes a shirt and the album on vinyl or digital.

$100 - Test Pressing

Own a part of the record making process! Test pressings are the records that the manufacturing plant sends us to make sure they got everything right before they press the full run. These are super limited- only 5 will be made. This perk also includes a regular copy of the record so you don't miss out on all the album art.

$150 - Complete Merch Package

The Vinyl Record, 3 shirts, 1 Hat, 1 Candle, Digital Download and a Holy Death Trio sticker!

$250 - Private Show

Book us to play a private show for you or at the venue of your choice or house show, birthday party, bat mitzvah, whatever we'll play it . Must be within 180 mile radius of Austin, TX.  Also includes a shirt and vinyl or digital download

$300 - Request a Cover

Request any song for Holy Death Trio to cover. We'll either perform it at a live show with you there, or we'll make it into a little video. Includes a shirt and the album on vinyl or digital.

$400 - Guest List for Life!

How would you like to be guest listed to every Holy Death Trio Show? Get in to every show we play for free, for life!!!

Also includes a shirt, vinyl or digital download.

$1000 - Signed 1993 Gibson Les Paul Special

We want to fund this album so bad that John is willing to sign and give up his most prized guitar, a 1993 Gibson Les Paul Special.  This guitar plays like a dream and will be professionally set up and ready to play.  Also includes a vinyl or digital download.

$3000 - 20% Equity in Holy Death

Become an investor in the Holy Death brand and receive 20% of all profits, sync licensing, and distribution deals linked to this album.  

We are determined to get this album into the hands of the right people from music supervisors to tv executives to get this album synced into upcoming films and commercials.  

If you have any questions, DM us.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

The Impact

By funding this campaign, you will undoubtedly have a big impact on our career:

You make releasing a record possible! As an independent band, we get $0 from record labels to help us offset the costs of releasing an album. If we didn’t crowd fund our record releases, they just wouldn’t happen. By getting your copy of the album here, you’re allowing this music to be published! 

You make touring possible! We can’t stress enough how important selling vinyl is to our bottom line when on tour. Selling vinyl turns music sales directly into gas and food money on the road, without which we could not make touring work. By funding this album you’re helping us spread the word about our music!

You make earning a living as a musician possible! In order to save up enough money to pay for vinyl record manufacturing ourselves, we’d have to take a big pay cut at our shows for probably several years. Having the album funded by our fans allows us to collect our full cut from the gigs we play, which in turn helps us pay the bills as professional musicians.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Risks & Challenges

 The biggest risk to the project would be delays during the manufacturing process. We’re not exactly sure how this will effect our project, but we will be sure to keep you updated on the expected release date. Currently, we think a safe estimate for the vinyl release date is March 2021.

 The second risk is that we don't hit our funding goal and have to press an EP on vinyl instead of the full album. Either way you will receive an album.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that sometimes donating your hard earned cash is not an option. If you can’t donate but you still want to help out, please give the campaign a share on social media. The more that people visit this page, the better chance we have at reaching our goal. 

You can also follow us on Instagram, Facebook and what helps the most is following us on your streaming platforms like Spotify, Apple Music, etc. When you do this, it helps get us on better playlist and to show up in the "Release Radar".

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

story:
Why this crowdfunding campaign?

 

 

HEX is Ready to come back stronger than ever!

After a big stop due to Covid's restrictions, it's finally time to re-empower Techno Culture and revive Our Scene, bringing back Events.

This last year has been very difficult for HEX, like for all the people fully involved in the electronic music scene but...we kept strong and we survived, also thanks to your great support on our previous crowdfunding campaign.

Now, is the time to start thinking again about events. To do so we need all the support possible from you, our strong community, to re-launch the Events side of the Movement, and at the same time to release our next Various Artists HEX008, the first triple-vinyl ever.

Discover more about how to help, right below...

 

 

 

What's HEX?

Founded in 2014 by the two Italian artists Paolo Ferrara and Lorenzo Raganzini,  

HEX is an independent Techno movement formed by music, art, clothing, photography and video; a crossroad for different people who share the same interest in music and alternative expressions of art. A safe space to express and be, without boundaries.

In 2019 HEX launched its own label HEX Recordings, characterised by a wide range of Techno shades that all share a common Post-Apocalyptic & Dark mood.

Today, HEX has become a global movement, part of many people’s lives and that represents for us all an escape from social prejudices and imposed limitations. An experience established for its coherency as a free art expression.

 

 
 

 

 

The meaning of our logo

The vertical line of the cross logo represents Techno, the soul of HEX, responsible for unifying cultures (two horizontal parallel lines) under the same ceiling of a club that hosts an event where people sharing the same dance floor, ignore whatever conflict their different cultures could cause and they positively merge into one single energetic being. The power of music in its purest expression.

 

 

 

Why HEX needs your support?

Your support is vital to us in order to:

  • organise the first post-covid event in Barcelona, supporting the local Techno scene
  • press HEX008 Various Artists (triple-red-vinyl), a unique release
  • create two videoclips, supporting the videography scene
  • produce the new clothes related to HEX008 VA

For this reason, we ask for:

  • 5.000€ for the vinyl pressing, videoclips and clothing
  • 10.000€ to pay a part of the first expenses related to the event organisation

Despite to all the difficulties that our industry is currently facing, Techno cannot and will not stop. It is our responsibility to keep it alive.

 

 

First Post-Covid Event in Barcelona

On this crowdfunding, you will actively be able to support the first post-covid HEX event, which will happen in our base city Barcelona.

We can't reveal the date and lineup yet but, it will be for sure in 2021 and we're planning something quite strong for our come-back night. In exchange for your early trust and loyalty, we offer the first 50 tickets at a very special deal, and the next also at a reduced price.

No worries, your ticket is completely refundable in the case that, when we will announce the date you are not able to come on that day.

 

 
 

HEX008 VA "Angels From Hell" (triple-red-vinyl)

We're very excited to celebrate the 2nd Anniversary of "HEX Recordings" so for the occasion, we decided to create the most powerful release so far, a Triple-Vinyl Various Artists, which includes the creations of some of the artists that are closest to the Movement but never released on the label until now like Rebekah, Cleric, Remco Beekwilder, together with new members like Benjamin Damage, AEIT, Imperial Black Unit, End Train, Rommek, Maere, 6Siss and of course some of the ambassadors of the label like Under Black Helmet, VII Circle and the two HEX Founders Paolo Ferrara and Lorenzo Raganzini.

The title of the release is "Angels From Hell" and it represents the most ambitious release ever created by HEX. 3 flaming Red colour Vinyl, together with some new T-shirts + Hoodie characterised by the VA's unique design.

15 Artists will represent the unity under Techno of 7 different countries: France, England, Italy, Netherlands, Lithuania, Belgium and Israel.

Now, we need your support to finance HEX008 for two integral reasons:

  1. to have it available on a vinyl format which we desire for each release
  2. to have the budget to create the videoclips 


Whatever amount you pledge, you will become a fundamental part of this release launch and of our Movement itself.

 

 

Click here to listen to the Tracks Preview:

 

:: CLICK ON THE TITLES BELOW TO LISTEN TO THE FULL TRACKS ::

Keep watching the campaign, we'll reveal more tracks in the coming weeks...

Vinyl 1 

  • A1 - Rebekah - You Be The Leader
  • A2 - Paolo Ferrara & Lorenzo Raganzini - Sanitary Dictature
  • A3 - AEIT - 12 Gauge
  • B1 - VII Circle - Demons
  • B2 - Rommek - Mezcal Worm

 

Vinyl 2 

  • C1 - Cleric - The Puppet Master 
  • C2 - Remco Beekwilder - Air Of The 90s
  • D1 - AnD - Frantic (unrevealed)
  • D2 - Benjamin Damage - Matriachy

 

Vinyl 3

  • E1 - Under Black Helmet - The Purist
  • E2 - MAERE & 6SISS - Organisms
  • F1 - Imperial Black Unit - Broken Tools (unrevealed)
  • F2 - End Train - Ctrl+Alt+Delete The System (unrevealed)

 

Masters by Alain Paul (Germany)

 

 

The artwork

The concept of the cover artwork is the constant fight between God and Devil, good and bad, right and wrong which finally leads to nowhere, to the realisation that one side can't exist without the other and vice-versa. The duality of the human being itself.

 

 

New merchandise

For this special occasion, we created new products available to buy now, for you to represent the movement wherever you go.

We've new Oversized T-shirts and a Hoodie, in the size M/L/XL. Also the HEX T-Shirt and HEX Cap.

Fabric: 100% cotton (180 g/m²) 
Serigraphy: Handmade in Barcelona
Dimensions (cm)
Length | Chest

  • M: 78 | 60
  • L: 80 | 62,5
  • XL: 82 | 65

Fitting examples (size: Large)

  • Paolo (175cm, 70kg)
  • Mollie & Julie (170cm, 50kg)

 

 

 

Previous successful campaign 

Thanks to your help in April 2019 and May 2020, we successfully funded 2 crowdfunding campaigns which made the label release some of your favourites tracks: Raving in Paris, Arise, Use for Punishment, Human Nature, Ora, I'm The Fire, White Stones, Civil Religion and more.

 

 
 

 

 

How does this crowdfunding work?

Pledging 5€ or more, you will support the campaign.

We need you in order to face the cost behind the vinyl pressing, the creation of all the graphic material and the video clips for this important release, together with the organisation of the first post-covid event in Barcelona.

In change of your help, we offer a limited amount of HEX008 triple-vinyl and Event tickets with a great discount, together with a few extra products (also with a big discount) from our brand.

Scroll to the top, to select your pledge...

 

 

Actual situation

Right now we already have all the tracks produced and mastered.

Support us to start the pressing, we will keep you updated on this campaign so you will be able to follow it in the first person.

Support HEX, support the Techno scene!

Thank you,

HEX Team.
story_txt:
Why this crowdfunding campaign?  HEX is Ready to come back stronger than ever!After a big stop due to Covid's restrictions, it's finally time to re-empower Techno Culture and revive Our Scene, bringing back Events.This last year has been very difficult for HEX, like for all the people fully involved in the electronic music scene but...we kept strong and we survived, also thanks to your great support on our previous crowdfunding campaign.Now, is the time to start thinking again about events. To do so we need all the support possible from you, our strong community, to re-launch the Events side of the Movement, and at the same time to release our next Various Artists HEX008, the first triple-vinyl ever.Discover more about how to help, right below...   What's HEX?Founded in 2014 by the two Italian artists Paolo Ferrara and Lorenzo Raganzini,  HEX is an independent Techno movement formed by music, art, clothing, photography and video; a crossroad for different people who share the same interest in music and alternative expressions of art. A safe space to express and be, without boundaries.In 2019 HEX launched its own label HEX Recordings, characterised by a wide range of Techno shades that all share a common Post-Apocalyptic & Dark mood.Today, HEX has become a global movement, part of many people’s lives and that represents for us all an escape from social prejudices and imposed limitations. An experience established for its coherency as a free art expression.  

 

 
 
The meaning of our logoThe vertical line of the cross logo represents Techno, the soul of HEX, responsible for unifying cultures (two horizontal parallel lines) under the same ceiling of a club that hosts an event where people sharing the same dance floor, ignore whatever conflict their different cultures could cause and they positively merge into one single energetic being. The power of music in its purest expression.   Why HEX needs your support?Your support is vital to us in order to:

organise the first post-covid event in Barcelona, supporting the local Techno scene

press HEX008 Various Artists (triple-red-vinyl), a unique release
create two videoclips, supporting the videography scene
produce the new clothes related to HEX008 VA

For this reason, we ask for:
5.000€ for the vinyl pressing, videoclips and clothing
10.000€ to pay a part of the first expenses related to the event organisation
Despite to all the difficulties that our industry is currently facing, Techno cannot and will not stop. It is our responsibility to keep it alive.  First Post-Covid Event in BarcelonaOn this crowdfunding, you will actively be able to support the first post-covid HEX event, which will happen in our base city Barcelona.We can't reveal the date and lineup yet but, it will be for sure in 2021 and we're planning something quite strong for our come-back night. In exchange for your early trust and loyalty, we offer the first 50 tickets at a very special deal, and the next also at a reduced price.No worries, your ticket is completely refundable in the case that, when we will announce the date you are not able to come on that day.   HEX008 VA "Angels From Hell" (triple-red-vinyl)We're very excited to celebrate the 2nd Anniversary of "HEX Recordings" so for the occasion, we decided to create the most powerful release so far, a Triple-Vinyl Various Artists, which includes the creations of some of the artists that are closest to the Movement but never released on the label until now like Rebekah, Cleric, Remco Beekwilder, together with new members like Benjamin Damage, AEIT, Imperial Black Unit, End Train, Rommek, Maere, 6Siss and of course some of the ambassadors of the label like Under Black Helmet, VII Circle and the two HEX Founders Paolo Ferrara and Lorenzo Raganzini.The title of the release is "Angels From Hell" and it represents the most ambitious release ever created by HEX. 3 flaming Red colour Vinyl, together with some new T-shirts + Hoodie characterised by the VA's unique design.15 Artists will represent the unity under Techno of 7 different countries: France, England, Italy, Netherlands, Lithuania, Belgium and Israel.Now, we need your support to finance HEX008 for two integral reasons:
to have it available on a vinyl format which we desire for each release
to have the budget to create the videoclips 

Whatever amount you pledge, you will become a fundamental part of this release launch and of our Movement itself.  Click here to listen to the Tracks Preview: :: CLICK ON THE TITLES BELOW TO LISTEN TO THE FULL TRACKS ::Keep watching the campaign, we'll reveal more tracks in the coming weeks...Vinyl 1 
A1 - Rebekah - You Be The Leader
A2 - Paolo Ferrara & Lorenzo Raganzini - Sanitary Dictature
A3 - AEIT - 12 Gauge
B1 - VII Circle - Demons
B2 - Rommek - Mezcal Worm
 Vinyl 2 
C1 - Cleric - The Puppet Master 
C2 - Remco Beekwilder - Air Of The 90s
D1 - AnD - Frantic (unrevealed)
D2 - Benjamin Damage - Matriachy
 Vinyl 3
E1 - Under Black Helmet - The Purist
E2 - MAERE & 6SISS - Organisms
F1 - Imperial Black Unit - Broken Tools (unrevealed)
F2 - End Train - Ctrl+Alt+Delete The System (unrevealed)
 Masters by Alain Paul (Germany)  The artworkThe concept of the cover artwork is the constant fight between God and Devil, good and bad, right and wrong which finally leads to nowhere, to the realisation that one side can't exist without the other and vice-versa. The duality of the human being itself.  New merchandiseFor this special occasion, we created new products available to buy now, for you to represent the movement wherever you go.We've new Oversized T-shirts and a Hoodie, in the size M/L/XL. Also the HEX T-Shirt and HEX Cap.Fabric: 100% cotton (180 g/m²) Serigraphy: Handmade in BarcelonaDimensions (cm)Length | Chest
M: 78 | 60
L: 80 | 62,5
XL: 82 | 65
Fitting examples (size: Large)
Paolo (175cm, 70kg)
Mollie & Julie (170cm, 50kg)
   Previous successful campaign Thanks to your help in April 2019 and May 2020, we successfully funded 2 crowdfunding campaigns which made the label release some of your favourites tracks: Raving in Paris, Arise, Use for Punishment, Human Nature, Ora, I'm The Fire, White Stones, Civil Religion and more.   

 
 How does this crowdfunding work?Pledging 5€ or more, you will support the campaign.We need you in order to face the cost behind the vinyl pressing, the creation of all the graphic material and the video clips for this important release, together with the organisation of the first post-covid event in Barcelona.In change of your help, we offer a limited amount of HEX008 triple-vinyl and Event tickets with a great discount, together with a few extra products (also with a big discount) from our brand.Scroll to the top, to select your pledge...  Actual situationRight now we already have all the tracks produced and mastered.Support us to start the pressing, we will keep you updated on this campaign so you will be able to follow it in the first person.Support HEX, support the Techno scene!Thank you,HEX Team.

story:
Junkie Meets New York

Good day and Hello.  I am Tough Junkie.  

Hip Hop Producer/Emcee, Project Director, FFJBMusic Team Member, and Duval County Jacksonville Native. (West Jax) 

I have been in my city paying dues, performing community services, and helping any artist here with any resources that I have. With the years of work and assistance under my belt, I have been offered an opportunity to expand my resources and further my music career.  I am being offered the chance to record an album in New York. (The Mecca of The Culture) 

The producers that I am working with are: 

Jax Harpo and J Martinez

(TROUBLE BOYS) 

 

This is an honor for me to actually push a project that will reach more than the regional fan base. Not only will my music be shared more, but it opens avenues for the new generation of Jacksonville Artists to secure successful careers.  Your contribution will provide a means for our Street Art scene to see more of the world and the fans of our unique sound.

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for $2500 to make 2-3 weekend trips. The music is being sent via email at the moment. Drafts are in the making as I type. 

These funds will simply supply round trip tickets, transportation while there, maybe a jacket(i have no New York City Winter clothing. I may need advice as well), food, water, and minor bill coverage. I will have to upgrade the phone plan and make sure the lil man (junkie jr) is fed while I am gone. 

The Perks

Simple and Sweet 

$20 Tip a video thank you. I will say your name so nicely and purposely. 

$50 Feed- a video thank you. and A Download of the Project 

$100 Dropped - a video thank you, A Download of the Project, I would like to have Private Q&A Pizza Party if you please.

$200+  Service Plan- Private Q&A Pizza Party if you please.And I will provide some work for you. Some labor, a beat, repair something, wash some dishes, cook a meal for you... lets work it out.

--------------------------------------------------

 

Super Sweet $500  

If you can give this much, take a look at the Junkie Menu. Pick something from the Menu and it will be done.

 

The Fights

Hopefully, there will be no snow delays, blizzards, bans on Floridians going to New York, and we all stay healthy throughout the times set up to make this happen.

And... if we can't reach the goal set, I will use the funds given to secure the Perks and rework the project into shorter trips and save up moneys to make a later trip to finish the project. We only hope the window of opportunity will be open if that is the case.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

If you are local,contact me here and I will make sure your donation makes it to this plane. If you cannot donate, please help by spreading to word. Send that help here and we will make this happen. 

 

DATES: The last week of March/ First week of April.
