story:
(Scroll down for Dutch  / Nederlands hieronder) 

If you don't have a credit card you can also help via Paypal / Venmo ! 

Mocht je geen credit card hebben, kun je me ook via bank of tikkie betalen :) 

Contact : v.aerts@gmail.com

--------

Help me release my new musical project!

"Vivienne Aerts vocalist, performer & composer specializing in experience design is coming up with a new album that will consist of her original music and features over a hundred female musicians. Expect a mix of jazz, electro-pop, and improvised music. On top of that, with every CD you buy, you will receive a bar of Original Beans Femmes de Virunga, the chocolate that is truly an “all women chocolate”, and for every bar sold, a tree gets planted. So when you buy this album, you are not only getting all-women-music and a bar of chocolate, but you are also actively replanting trees and giving women in Congo a better future!"

BACKGROUND : 

Having met and worked with tons of talented female musicians as a Dutch vocalist and composer while living in Boston and New York these last few years, I wanted to make a musical project that features them all. Since it’s not possible to get together because of the pandemic, we are forced to get creative and meet in a different way. Currently, everybody is able to record in their home studio, so this inspired me to create a musical project together with more than 100 female 'up & coming new generation musicians' from over 40 countries. During a time when it looks like there is no bright future, I realize that people need hope. This has inspired me to start my own project for women, by women which will result in musical exchange and creative soundscapes building a better world. 

ORIGINAL BEANS CHOCOLATE 

Together with my husband (pastry chef Ted Steinebach, who worked at Eleven Madison Park*** - one of the best restaurants in the world) we have been organizing multi-sensory performances under the name Vervool (www.vervool.com) using jazz, haute cuisine, and modern art. When I first got in touch with the Dutch Chocolate brand Original Beans, the story behind it really resonated. Especially the Femmes de Virunga project has always held a special place in my heart. Living in an area in Congo that is torn apart by civil wars, these women are often left on their own. Because their men are taken by militia and other rebellious groups, they have to take care of themselves and their families. This Original Beans project has now 1500 women that run this sustainable cacao farm and tree nursery where chocolate is grown and sold in a regenerative way. With Original Beans giving them a fair, stable price for their cocoa (up to 90% on top of the world cocoa price), they are empowered to send their kids to school and take care of themselves and their community.

YOUR SUPPORT

Your donations are not only helping me release this EP.  Part of this goes back to Original Beans so they can actively replant trees and give women in Congo a better future.

Secondly, with your donation, you are supporting the hiring of around 100 independent female musicians and covering for Producer/Engineer costs, Mixing and Mastering, Artwork and design, Marketing, and PR. So much is involved in producing a project like this and the people who collaborate with me will put just as much time, energy, and love into this as I will.  

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET 

I am happy to announce that I have been awarded a grant from the SENA Music Production Fund and the Netherland-America Foundation to get this thing started, but the cost of the entire project (including marketing) is close to $20,000. I'm hoping to sell 1000 albums, so this means 1000 bars of chocolate, and that will mean that there will be 1000 trees planted. --> https://originalbeans.com/one-bar-one-tree/ 

I've added different perks for different levels of contribution, and YES there is a LOT of chocolate involved!

By supporting, you will also get an insight into the creation of this project as I will update you on all the different steps on the road. There will be a podcast featuring the many extraordinary women as well as private listening parties on zoom. 

ONE MINUTE VIDEO - an impression 

For starters, I've asked some of my female music friends to send me a video of themselves playing or singing one note, any note, any length. Then I used all these little clips of 40 women to create this one-minute soundscape video that was presented in celebration of International Women's Day. 

 

A SPECIAL THANKS

Thank you to everyone who has supported, and who continues to support me in my endeavors. I’ve released two full-length albums and I could not have released any of them without you. 

ABOUT 

Vivienne Aerts is a Dutch New York-based vocalist, conductor, composer with a focus on electronics and multi-sensory experience design. She studied on a Fulbright and graduated Suma Cum Laude at Berklee College of Music (Boston, USA), and has an MSc in clinical psychology from Leiden University. Together with her husband who is a pastry chef, she organizes events and performances under the name Vervool using jazz, haute cuisine, and modern art. Besides this, she works with Kenny Werner and the Effortless Mastery Institute at Berklee. 

Find out more by visiting www.vivienneaerts.com

 

Thank you all again. Without your support, none of this would truly be possible.

~Vivienne

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

I understand completely that sometimes it is just not in our power to support an artist financially. I think we all have been in times of struggle, especially this year! The good news is that there are so many ways you can support music and make an impact on an artist's career.

  • TELL YOUR FRIENDS. 
  • FOLLOW ME ON SOCIAL MEDIA instagram @vieffertje 
  • EMAIL ME! I LOVE when you reach out about an opportunity, something you hear about that I might be interested in. Be part of the team, and part of the dream! 
  • ASK I'm always more than happy to be inclusive, and if there's a show or something that you just can't be a part of because of financial reasons, shoot me an email. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DUTCH / NEDERLANDS : 

Help me mijn nieuwe muzikale project uit te brengen!
"Vivienne Aerts, zangeres, performer en componiste, gespecialiseerd in experience design komt met een nieuw album dat zal bestaan ​​uit haar originele muziek en meer dan honderd vrouwelijke muzikanten. Verwacht een mix van jazz, electro-pop en geïmproviseerde muziek en ontvang bij elke cd een reep Original Beans Femmes de Virunga, een chocolade gemaakt door  1500 vrouwen in Virunga state park. En! Voor elke verkochte reep wordt er een boom geplant. Dus als je dit album koopt, krijgt je niet alleen muziek geprocudeerd door vrouwen en een reep chocola, maar je plant ook actief bomen en geeft vrouwen in Congo een betere toekomst! "

p.s. ALS je geen creditcard hebt, kun je me ook een berichtje sturen, en via tikkie of overschrijving betalen. Info@vivienneaerts.com 

ACHTERGROND:

De afgelopen jaren heb ik zo veel getalenteerde vrouwelijke muzikanten ontmoet, wonende als Nederlandse zangeres en componiste in Boston en New York. Dus wilde ik een muzikaal project maken waarin ze allemaal kunnen meedoen. Omdat het door de pandemie niet mogelijk is om samen te komen, worden we gedwongen creatief te zijn en elkaar op een andere manier te ontmoeten. Momenteel is iedereen in staat om op te nemen in hun thuisstudio, dus dit inspireerde me om een ​​muzikaal project te creëren samen met meer dan 100 vrouwelijke muzikanten uit meer dan 40 landen. In een tijd waarin het lijkt alsof er geen mooie toekomst is, realiseer ik me dat mensen hoop nodig hebben. Dit heeft mij geïnspireerd om dit project te starten, voor vrouwen, door vrouwen, wat zal resulteren in muzikale uitwisseling en creatieve soundscapes die bouwen aan een betere wereld.

WAAROM ORIGINAL BEANS CHOCOLADE

Samen met mijn man (patissier Ted Steinebach, die werkte bij Eleven Madison Park *** - een van de beste restaurants ter wereld) organiseren we onder de naam Vervool (www.vervool.com) multi-sensorische optredens met jazz, haute cuisine en moderne kunst. Toen ik voor het eerst in contact kwam met het Nederlandse chocolademerk Original Beans, resoneerde het verhaal erachter. Vooral het Femmes de Virunga-project heeft een speciaal plekje in mijn hart. Deze vrouwen wonen in een gebied in Congo dat wordt verscheurd door burgeroorlogen. Omdat hun mannen worden meegenomen door militia en andere rebellerende groepen, moeten ze voor zichzelf en hun gezinnen zorgen. Dit Original Beans-project heeft inmiddels 1500 vrouwen die deze duurzame cacaoboerderij en boomkwekerij runnen waar op een regeneratieve manier chocolade wordt verbouwd en verkocht. Omdat Original Beans hen een eerlijke, stabiele prijs voor hun cacao geeft (tot 90% bovenop de wereldcacaoprijs), zijn ze in staat hun kinderen naar school te sturen en voor zichzelf en hun gemeenschap te zorgen.

JOUW STEUN

De donaties helpen me niet alleen om deze EP uit te brengen. Een deel hiervan gaat terug naar Original Beans, zodat ze actief bomen kunnen herplanten en vrouwen in Congo een betere toekomst kunnen geven.

Ten tweede ondersteun je met je donatie het inhuren van ongeveer 100 onafhankelijke vrouwelijke muzikanten en dekt u de kosten van Producer / Engineer, Mixing en Mastering, Artwork en design, Marketing en PR. Er komt zoveel kijken bij het produceren van een project als dit en de mensen die met mij samenwerken zullen er net zoveel tijd, energie en liefde in steken als ik.

WAT ER NODIG IS EN WAT JE KRIJGT

Super dankbaar dat ik subsidie ​​heb gekregen van het SENA Music Production Fonds en de Netherland-America Foundation voor het starten van dit project. Maar de kosten van het hele project (inclusief marketing) bedragen bijna $ 20.000. Daarom helpen alle kleine en groote bijdragen mee en heb ik verschillende 'perks' or rewards toegevoegd de voor verschillende niveaus van je bijdrage, en JA, er is VEEL chocolade!

Door te ondersteunen, krijg je ook inzicht in de totstandkoming en het verloop van dit project, aangezien ik je op de hoogte zal houden van alle verschillende stappen op de weg. En, er zal een podcast zijn met de vele buitengewone vrouwen en privé-luisterpartijen op zoom.

ONE MINUTE VIDEO - een impressie

Om te beginnen heb ik een aantal van mijn vrouwelijke collegas gevraagd me een video te sturen waarin ze één noot, hoog of laag, lang of kort, spelen of zingen. Vervolgens heb ik al deze kleine clips van 40 vrouwen gebruikt om deze soundscape-video van één minuut te maken die werd gepresenteerd ter ere van Internationale Vrouwendag. --> https://youtu.be/K6Lqm6LY_qE 


HEEL ERG BEDANKT

Dank aan iedereen die mij heeft gesteund en die mij blijft steunen bij mijn inspanningen. Ik heb twee volledige albums uitgebracht en ik had ze zonder jou niet kunnen uitbrengen.

OVER

Vivienne Aerts is een Nederlandse zangeres, dirigent en componist uit New York met een focus op elektronica en multi-sensorisch experience design. Ze studeerde met een Fulbright Suma Cum Laude af aan Berklee College of Music (Boston, VS), en heeft een MSc in klinische psychologie aan de Universiteit Leiden. Samen met haar man, patissier Ted Steinebach, organiseert ze evenementen en optredens met jazz, haute cuisine en moderne kunst onder de naam Vervool. Daarnaast werkt ze samen met Kenny Werner en het Effortless Mastery Institute in Berklee.

Ga voor meer informatie naar www.vivienneaerts.com

Nogmaals bedankt allemaal. Zonder uw steun zou dit allemaal niet echt mogelijk zijn.

~ Vivienne

TELL YOUR FRIENDS. 
FOLLOW ME ON SOCIAL MEDIA instagram @vieffertje 
EMAIL ME! I LOVE when you reach out about an opportunity, something you hear about that I might be interested in. Be part of the team, and part of the dream! 
ASK I'm always more than happy to be inclusive, and if there's a show or something that you just can't be a part of because of financial reasons, shoot me an email. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------DUTCH / NEDERLANDS : Help me mijn nieuwe muzikale project uit te brengen!"Vivienne Aerts, zangeres, performer en componiste, gespecialiseerd in experience design komt met een nieuw album dat zal bestaan ​​uit haar originele muziek en meer dan honderd vrouwelijke muzikanten. Verwacht een mix van jazz, electro-pop en geïmproviseerde muziek en ontvang bij elke cd een reep Original Beans Femmes de Virunga, een chocolade gemaakt door  1500 vrouwen in Virunga state park. En! Voor elke verkochte reep wordt er een boom geplant. Dus als je dit album koopt, krijgt je niet alleen muziek geprocudeerd door vrouwen en een reep chocola, maar je plant ook actief bomen en geeft vrouwen in Congo een betere toekomst! "p.s. ALS je geen creditcard hebt, kun je me ook een berichtje sturen, en via tikkie of overschrijving betalen. Info@vivienneaerts.com ACHTERGROND:De afgelopen jaren heb ik zo veel getalenteerde vrouwelijke muzikanten ontmoet, wonende als Nederlandse zangeres en componiste in Boston en New York. Dus wilde ik een muzikaal project maken waarin ze allemaal kunnen meedoen. Omdat het door de pandemie niet mogelijk is om samen te komen, worden we gedwongen creatief te zijn en elkaar op een andere manier te ontmoeten. Momenteel is iedereen in staat om op te nemen in hun thuisstudio, dus dit inspireerde me om een ​​muzikaal project te creëren samen met meer dan 100 vrouwelijke muzikanten uit meer dan 40 landen. In een tijd waarin het lijkt alsof er geen mooie toekomst is, realiseer ik me dat mensen hoop nodig hebben. Dit heeft mij geïnspireerd om dit project te starten, voor vrouwen, door vrouwen, wat zal resulteren in muzikale uitwisseling en creatieve soundscapes die bouwen aan een betere wereld.WAAROM ORIGINAL BEANS CHOCOLADESamen met mijn man (patissier Ted Steinebach, die werkte bij Eleven Madison Park *** - een van de beste restaurants ter wereld) organiseren we onder de naam Vervool (www.vervool.com) multi-sensorische optredens met jazz, haute cuisine en moderne kunst. Toen ik voor het eerst in contact kwam met het Nederlandse chocolademerk Original Beans, resoneerde het verhaal erachter. Vooral het Femmes de Virunga-project heeft een speciaal plekje in mijn hart. Deze vrouwen wonen in een gebied in Congo dat wordt verscheurd door burgeroorlogen. Omdat hun mannen worden meegenomen door militia en andere rebellerende groepen, moeten ze voor zichzelf en hun gezinnen zorgen. Dit Original Beans-project heeft inmiddels 1500 vrouwen die deze duurzame cacaoboerderij en boomkwekerij runnen waar op een regeneratieve manier chocolade wordt verbouwd en verkocht. Omdat Original Beans hen een eerlijke, stabiele prijs voor hun cacao geeft (tot 90% bovenop de wereldcacaoprijs), zijn ze in staat hun kinderen naar school te sturen en voor zichzelf en hun gemeenschap te zorgen.JOUW STEUNDe donaties helpen me niet alleen om deze EP uit te brengen. Een deel hiervan gaat terug naar Original Beans, zodat ze actief bomen kunnen herplanten en vrouwen in Congo een betere toekomst kunnen geven.Ten tweede ondersteun je met je donatie het inhuren van ongeveer 100 onafhankelijke vrouwelijke muzikanten en dekt u de kosten van Producer / Engineer, Mixing en Mastering, Artwork en design, Marketing en PR. Er komt zoveel kijken bij het produceren van een project als dit en de mensen die met mij samenwerken zullen er net zoveel tijd, energie en liefde in steken als ik.WAT ER NODIG IS EN WAT JE KRIJGTSuper dankbaar dat ik subsidie ​​heb gekregen van het SENA Music Production Fonds en de Netherland-America Foundation voor het starten van dit project. Maar de kosten van het hele project (inclusief marketing) bedragen bijna $ 20.000. Daarom helpen alle kleine en groote bijdragen mee en heb ik verschillende 'perks' or rewards toegevoegd de voor verschillende niveaus van je bijdrage, en JA, er is VEEL chocolade!Door te ondersteunen, krijg je ook inzicht in de totstandkoming en het verloop van dit project, aangezien ik je op de hoogte zal houden van alle verschillende stappen op de weg. En, er zal een podcast zijn met de vele buitengewone vrouwen en privé-luisterpartijen op zoom.ONE MINUTE VIDEO - een impressieOm te beginnen heb ik een aantal van mijn vrouwelijke collegas gevraagd me een video te sturen waarin ze één noot, hoog of laag, lang of kort, spelen of zingen. Vervolgens heb ik al deze kleine clips van 40 vrouwen gebruikt om deze soundscape-video van één minuut te maken die werd gepresenteerd ter ere van Internationale Vrouwendag. --> https://youtu.be/K6Lqm6LY_qE HEEL ERG BEDANKTDank aan iedereen die mij heeft gesteund en die mij blijft steunen bij mijn inspanningen. Ik heb twee volledige albums uitgebracht en ik had ze zonder jou niet kunnen uitbrengen.OVERVivienne Aerts is een Nederlandse zangeres, dirigent en componist uit New York met een focus op elektronica en multi-sensorisch experience design. Ze studeerde met een Fulbright Suma Cum Laude af aan Berklee College of Music (Boston, VS), en heeft een MSc in klinische psychologie aan de Universiteit Leiden. Samen met haar man, patissier Ted Steinebach, organiseert ze evenementen en optredens met jazz, haute cuisine en moderne kunst onder de naam Vervool. Daarnaast werkt ze samen met Kenny Werner en het Effortless Mastery Institute in Berklee.Ga voor meer informatie naar www.vivienneaerts.comNogmaals bedankt allemaal. Zonder uw steun zou dit allemaal niet echt mogelijk zijn.~ Vivienne

story:
Overview

I'm recording a new album! More than just a collection of songs, the "Whatever Is" album is a response to our current cultural environment. In the midst of fear, chaos, and broken connections between people, I want to provide songs that will help us shift our focus toward something more positive.

The Story

In 2019 I released my first EP "Abiding" and was overwhelmed by the support and encouragement I received. After many years of writing songs and only sharing them with my local church, recording them was a dream project that sparked even bigger dreams. 

This year I started meeting regularly with co-writers and working on new songs. What has emerged are heartfelt songs of faithfulness and intention. They are about fixing our eyes on Jesus, being purposeful with our thoughts, and returning to him when those thoughts stray. I wrote many of these songs of hope and trust long before the pandemic and protests, but they are so timely as we navigate the state of our world, and I’m excited to share them with you now. 

The Project

I was hoping to do a live worship night to record the album, but then the "rona" happened, and plans changed. Thankfully, I was introduced to my new friend Shane Nelson at Asaph Records.

I met Shane through one of my co-writers in Greenville. We worked on a project together, and I knew he was the perfect fit for this album. We have come up with a plan to do a “live in the studio” recording on August 29, 2020. Our band will record the album live at Asaph Records in Greenville, SC, with a small group of friends and supporters. We need two days of rehearsal to prepare for one evening of recording the album. Then Shane will mix and master the tracks for the final release. We will also have a video crew onsite to record the live session to do a video release along with the EP.

Costs & Rewards

Music is expensive to create, but I believe it is worth it to provide a soundtrack for our lives. I have already personally invested quite a bit in this project, but we need about $8,500 more to cover all of the fees and support my team who is helping to make this thing amazing. Anything we raise beyond that will go toward marketing the album to share these songs with more people.

We want to bless our supporters, too, so I’ve put together some exclusive perks (some of them will only be available during the campaign). Click the perk boxes on the right for details on what's included.

  • Digital copy of the album two weeks before it is released to the public
  • Autographed "Whatever Is" CD
  • Super comfy fair-trade "Whatever Is" t-shirt
  • Beautiful 12x12 print inspired by "Whatever Is"
  • Private meal with Sheree, prepared by her husband Chef Wes
  • VIP Access to the live studio recording on August 29th

Risks & Challenges

If we do not reach our goal by the end of the campaign, we may need to delay the recording to raise the rest of the money, which will also delay those wonderful perks. But if everything goes as planned, we will have the perks shipped out in October - just in time for my birthday!

Please Share!

Thank you for supporting the "Whatever Is" project! Click one of those sweet perks to give, and share with your friends so that we can bring these songs to life and contribute something positive to the soundtrack of 2020.

story:
Thank you for helping me create my first album!

I am a classical guitarist based in New York City and I'm so excited to share some of my favorite classical guitar pieces with you! My new album will be called A Dream in the Forest and will feature classical guitar pieces that I think sound dreamy and foresty.

The track list:

  • Introduction and Variations on a Theme of Mozart, Op. 9 by Fernando Sor
  • Romance de los Pinos (Montemayor) by Federico Moreno Torroba
  • Elegie by Johann Kaspar Mertz
  • Usher Waltz by Nikita Koshkin
  • Hommage a Bela Bartok by Jana Obravska
  • Mormorio della Foresta by Teresa de Rogatis
  • Un Sueno en la Floresta by Agustin Barrios Mangore
  • Estrellita by Manuel Ponce

I will be recording this whole album in my own home as well as editing and mixing myself. This takes a lot of time and a lot of equipment, some of which I still need. With your help I will be able to make this album a reality for digital download, streaming, and physical copies for you.

story:
(For Swedish scroll down)

 

Hello my friends, family and listeners!

Sara Idani here

I’m turning 30 this year and to commemorate that I’ve decided to record and release my debut album!

It will be called “a farewell to girlhood”, since I’m officially leaving my girl days behind, but also because it will consist of a bunch of songs I’ve written through the years, from teen years and up. They all revolves around the theme of girlhood and what it means to be a girl, from good girl complex, peer pressure, love , break ups, friends and the overall uncertainty about the future that you can feel in those years (at least I did). All to the sound of synthesizers, flutes, gated drums and every other sound from the 80s that I know and love.

In addition to the album being available on CD I will also create an art book consisting of song lyrics, stories about the process behind them and pictures I drew as a girl along with some poetry, to really expand the theme some more.

With this album I want to celebrate girlhood and upplift the music and the culture of girls since it’s stil very much looked down upon in the established music busniess. I also wanna lift the perspective of the girls who weren't popular in school, who didn’t follow the traditional way.

That is what I want with this album I hope the theme will resonate with you as well. Widen your views about girlhood and to make you stop and think back on your on childhood and teenage years a little more fondly.

 

THE MUSIC

The ablum consist of ten songs written and produced by me and the music takes root in the Max Martin-inluenced pop music I make and from that it blooms out in gated drums, lush pads, rythmic soundscapes

I’m using my trusted synths, from my swiss army Minilouge to the plastic toy-Casio that I used to play with as a kid and off course, flutes, loads of flutes!

Here's a little taste of the song "Love letter"

 

A FAREWELL TO GIRLHOOD BUDGET BREAKDOWN

This is a passion project that I’ve been wanting to do for so long.

I’m doing this on my own under my own label

the budget for this project is  10 000 SEK (1000 EURO)

And that is to cover:

 music distribution

album cover art

Physical CD and Art Book printing and distribution

PR and marketing costs

Transportation costs

Taxes and fees

Recording

 

PAYPAL AND SWISH

If you want to contribute but are unsure of how to use the platform you can also use PayPal or Swish to pre-order. Just make sure to give me your name and email and you're good to go. :-) The payments will go into my own label Windsång Music and I'll donate them to the campaign for you.

Paypal

https://www.paypal.com/donate?hosted_button_id=L93XCZFJFGSSE

Swish

123 012 30 75

Please note that Swish charges 2 SEK per payment so if you want to you're welcome to donate a little extra if you're using Swish.

UPDATE 19 AUGUST: STRETCH GOAL - MUSIC VIDEO

My original funding goal was 10 000 SEK. We passed that yesterday! Yey!in only 20 days. Because we are now funded at a basic level I have announced one stretch goal. As an extra bonus to see how far we can take the campaign before it ends.

If we reach 15 000kr before deadline I will hire a director to direct and edit a music video to one of the album songs and you, the backers of the campaign, will get to choose which song to make it for.

 

If we reach this goal it would be amazing, because music videos are amazing.

If not, I will still make the album and I will still love you <3

That will not change <3

Help me expand the theme even more by pledging now, so that we can achieve our Stretch Goal!

I REALLY CAN'T AFFORD TO PLEDGE RIGHT NOW, WHAT ELSE CAN I DO TO HELP?

Don't worry

Just by being here and supporting me on this adventure means everything to me! 

If you're unable to pledge at this time there are many ways you can help and  support my music:

*Share this campaign on your Instagram, Facebook or other social media channels! (Make sure to use the INDIEGOGO share tools!)

*Follow me on Instagram at @saraidanimusic & tag me when sharing the campaign.

*Follow me on Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/saraidanimusic & tag me when sharing the campaign.

If you have any questions, please send an email to info@saraidanimusic.com

 

This is a dream that I've had for a long time and it feels amazing that it might come true! Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and for supporting my music <3

I look forward to sharing this adventure with you 

Love

Sara

 

SVENSKA

Beskrivning

Hej kära vänner, familj och lyssnare!

Sara Idani här

Jag fyller 30 år i år och för att fira det har jag bestämt mig för att spela in och släppa mitt debutalbum!

Ablumets titel är ”a farewell to girlhood”, eftersom jag officiellt lämnar mina flickdagar bakom mig, men också för att albumet kommer innehålla en massa låtar jag har skrivit genom åren, från tonåren och uppåt. Alla handlar temat flickighet kretsar och vad det innebär att varatjej, från "duktig flicka"-syndrom till grupptryck, kärlek, uppbrott, vänner och oron kring framtiden som en kan känna under de åren (åtminstone gjorde jag det ). Allt till ett sound av syntar, flöjter, gateade trummor och alla andra ljud från 80-talet som jag älskar.

Förutom en fysisk CD kommer jag också göra en konstbok som innehåll er sångtexter och korta berättelser om processen bakom dem. Den kommer också innehålla bilder jag ritat som flicka och dikter. Allt för att kunna utveckla temat ännu mer.

Med det här albumet vill jag fira flickighet och lyfta upp musiken och flickkultur, eftersom den fortfarande är så underskattad i den etablerade musikbranschen. Jag vill också lyfta de töntiga tjejernas perspektiv, vi som inte var populära i skolan, som gick vår egen väg.

Det är vad jag vill med det här albumet. Jag hoppas att temat också talar till dig.  Att det kan hjälpa dig få ett bredare perspektiv på flickighet och få dig att stanna upp och tänka tillbaka på dina barndoms- och tonårsår lite mer kärleksfullt.

 

MUSIKEN

Ablumen består av tio låtar skrivna och producerade av mig. Musiken har sin grund i  Max Martin- poppen jag skapar och därifrån blommar den ut i gateade trummor, mjuka pads och rytmiska ljudlandskap.

Jag använder mina gamla trofasta  syntar, från min schweiziska armékniv Minilouge synth till leksaksynthensom jag brukade leka med som barn och självklart, flöjt, massor av flöjt!

Här är ett litet smakprov på låten "Love letter"

A FAREWELL TO GIRLHOOD BUDGET

Det här är ett passionprojekt som jag har velat göra så länge.

Jag gör detta på egen hand under min egen label.

budgeten för detta projekt är 10 000 kronor

Och det är för att täcka bl.a. :

Kostnader för mastring och distribution

Artwork

CD tryck

PR och marknadsföringskostnader

Transportkostander

Crowdfundingavgiften och skatter

Inspelning

 

PAYPAL OCH SWISH

Om du vill bidra men är osäker på hur du använder plattformen så går det jättebra att använda Paypal eller Swish istället. Skriv bara ditt namn och mailadress så fixar det sig.

Pengarna går då in på mitt egna skivbolag Windsång Music och så sätter jag in pengarna i kampanjen åt dig.

Paypal

https://www.paypal.com/donate?hosted_button_id=L93XCZFJFGSSE

Swish

123 012 30 75

Kom ihåg att Swish tar 2 kronor per betalning så om du vill får du gärna donera lite mer om du använder Swish.

JAG HAR INTE MÖJLIGHET ATT BIDRA MED PENGAR JUST NU, HUR KAN JAG HJÄLPA TILL?

Bara att du är här och följer mig på den här resan betyder så mycket för mig! Om du inte kan bidra just nu kan du överväga dessa andra sätt att sprida ordet eller stödja min musik:

* Dela den här kampanjen på din Instagram, Facebook eller andra sociala mediekanaler! (Se till att använda INDIEGOGO-delningsverktygen!)

* Följ mig på Instagram på @saraidanimusic och tagga mig när du delar kampanjen.

* Följ mig på Facebook här: https://www.facebook.com/saraidanimusic & tagga mig när du delar kampanjen.

Om du har några frågor, skicka ett mail till info@saraidanimusic.com

Jag vill också lyfta de töntiga tjejernas perspektiv, vi som inte var populära i skolan, som gick vår egen väg.Det är vad jag vill med det här albumet. Jag hoppas att temat också talar till dig.  Att det kan hjälpa dig få ett bredare perspektiv på flickighet och få dig att stanna upp och tänka tillbaka på dina barndoms- och tonårsår lite mer kärleksfullt. MUSIKENAblumen består av tio låtar skrivna och producerade av mig. Musiken har sin grund i  Max Martin- poppen jag skapar och därifrån blommar den ut i gateade trummor, mjuka pads och rytmiska ljudlandskap.Jag använder mina gamla trofasta  syntar, från min schweiziska armékniv Minilouge synth till leksaksynthensom jag brukade leka med som barn och självklart, flöjt, massor av flöjt!Här är ett litet smakprov på låten "Love letter"A FAREWELL TO GIRLHOOD BUDGETDet här är ett passionprojekt som jag har velat göra så länge.Jag gör detta på egen hand under min egen label.budgeten för detta projekt är 10 000 kronorOch det är för att täcka bl.a. :Kostnader för mastring och distributionArtworkCD tryckPR och marknadsföringskostnaderTransportkostanderCrowdfundingavgiften och skatterInspelning PAYPAL OCH SWISHOm du vill bidra men är osäker på hur du använder plattformen så går det jättebra att använda Paypal eller Swish istället. Skriv bara ditt namn och mailadress så fixar det sig.Pengarna går då in på mitt egna skivbolag Windsång Music och så sätter jag in pengarna i kampanjen åt dig.Paypalhttps://www.paypal.com/donate?hosted_button_id=L93XCZFJFGSSESwish123 012 30 75Kom ihåg att Swish tar 2 kronor per betalning så om du vill får du gärna donera lite mer om du använder Swish.JAG HAR INTE MÖJLIGHET ATT BIDRA MED PENGAR JUST NU, HUR KAN JAG HJÄLPA TILL?Bara att du är här och följer mig på den här resan betyder så mycket för mig! Om du inte kan bidra just nu kan du överväga dessa andra sätt att sprida ordet eller stödja min musik:* Dela den här kampanjen på din Instagram, Facebook eller andra sociala mediekanaler! (Se till att använda INDIEGOGO-delningsverktygen!)* Följ mig på Instagram på @saraidanimusic och tagga mig när du delar kampanjen.* Följ mig på Facebook här: https://www.facebook.com/saraidanimusic & tagga mig när du delar kampanjen.Om du har några frågor, skicka ett mail till info@saraidanimusic.com

story:
Overview

I'm finally recording an EP! More than just a collection of songs, the "Unashamed Project" is a call to many who have experienced hurt, guilt, and shame. I am unashamed of the Gospel of Jesus Christ and who He has called me to be! It's okay to be different, sound different, and be unique! Amid the pandemic, a lot of anxiety and depression has set in and many have lost their hope! These songs will help us sustain and develop an unashamed mindset to rely on Jesus!

The Story

In 2017, I decided to move by faith and began working on original music. After many years of privately writing songs, recording voice notes, and leaving them as ideas. I finally had the faith to launch out and release all that God has placed inside of me! In 2018, I released my debut single "Take It All" and to this day I am amazed by the support and encouragement I received.

 

In 2018, I started connecting with producers and started working on new songs. BUT, I hit a major roadblock. I started to doubt EVERYTHING I was doing which put a huge dent in the momentum I had! Through prayer, mentorship, and having the right people around me, I regained the confidence to continue! I began to realize how little I had relied on God! Almost as if I was ashamed to need help! But, through this time of isolation, I've seen how powerful it is to trust God FULLY and have a community that understands and believes in you, too! 

Make A Pledge Today

All donations come with a gift. So not only are you investing in this project but the lives of those who may need to hear this message! 

The $$$

Creating great music is VERY expensive. A single song created with producers, musicians, mixing, and mastering can cost between $1500-$3000. 

So I have two goals. Goal #1 is $10,000. This will cover the cost of having a 7 song live EP (Mix, Mastering, Recording Engineer, Musicians, BGVocalists, and Tech Rentals). 

Goal #2 is $16,000. This will cover the cost to have a video recording/live concert EP (Venue, Videographer, Editing, Lighting, Lighting Tech and two $500 Grants to deserving Students (Secondary or Post Secondary).

I’ve put together some EXCLUSIVE perks (some of them will only be available during the campaign). Click the perk boxes for details on what's included.

Risks & Challenges

As an artist, people always ask about new music and ask the question "when is your album coming out?" and I always respond "I'm working on it". That meant when I can afford to do it! The majority of folks are unaware of the costs behind making an album. I chose to be super transparent for all to see what it takes! I am determined to push through and make it work! The biggest challenge is going to be getting to the stretch goal of $16,000. The biggest help will be the money I raise through this campaign!

Ways You Can Help

  • Give to the campaign! =)
  • Share the campaign on social media with the Indiegogo share tools
  • Tell your friends

Why This Matters

God has put it on my heart to create music that is catchy, relatable, and different with a strong message of faith for youth and young adults around the world. I am moving forward in faith and will do everything I can to make this album happen. 

Thank you for your love, encouragement, and generous support!

 

Check out the perks and pledge today! 

In His Grip, 

Mike

* donations are in Canadian dollars. This means USA supporters get approximately 27% off their donation. (i.e. $100 donation will cost $73 USD / $1000 donation will cost $730 USD)

story:
Hello! My name is Chris McKhool, and I play violin in Sultans of String. We are 3x JUNO Award nominees (Canada’s Grammys) and 3x CFMA winners.  Two of our recent albums have hit the BILLBOARD World Music charts and we have been a New York Times feature pick, with many Grammy winners joining us as special guests over the years.

Up top, select the video to see our sizzle reel of our previous instalment of the Refuge Project, or click here to watch it on YouTube.

PLEASE NOTE: We have gone to print with our CD Cover so we are not able to add more text inside the album, but all other perks are still available!

We are now embarking on the most important recording of our career.  Sanctuary. And we would love your support - with your help we can make this recording a reality!This ambitious, diverse, inclusive and passionately artistic album puts our band face-to- face with a VIP roster of global ‘ambassadors', some of whom are recent immigrants and refugees to Canada, as well as important Indigenous voices.  All are masters of world music that tell the story of how to communicate with others through the global language of music. 

Why do we need your help?

​With your support, we can have the funds to record this album. It will cost around 10K to get started. This includes paying all the fabulous musicians, studio recording time, and hiring multiple JUNO Award winning engineer and co-producer John 'Beetle' Bailey.

If we raise a lot, we can use the additional funds to mix the recording, master it, get the graphics done, and to deliver our music to radio stations and media across the North America, to help amplify our message! 

This is our 8th album, so we know we can make this a great recording - especially with the incredible musicians that have hopped on board to make music with us!

Sanctuary will be out by the first week of November, so this will make your Holiday shopping easy this year :)

 

Why is Sanctuary important?

Sanctuary is the second instalment in our Refuge Project.  ​Our first, simply entitled Refuge, was heralded as "a fantastic, moving, dreamlike, epic, timely album.” – Ken Micallef (Jazz Times, Stereophile, Downbeat) and won us many awards including Producer of the Year at the Canadian Folk Music Awards. 

We are a music band but we want to help try to change the world.

The Refuge Project is centred around the positive contributions of refugees and new immigrants to Canada. We are bringing in special guests that are newcomers to this land, as well as global talents that have been ambassadors for peace.  We wish to celebrate the successes of those who make the journey here, and bring their extraordinary talents with them, in this case music.  Each one of us has a remarkable story to tell, and we are excited to share the beauty of these collaborations with you.

Sanctuary features seven new tracks as well as three stunning new versions of songs off Refuge. These include an astonishingly gorgeous orchestral version of The Power of the Land featuring Duke Redbird and Twin Flames, Turkish mega-pop star Suat Suna singing Hurricane, and Tamar Ilana singing a version of our song Asi Soy that will rip your heart out.

 

 

This recording is part of a larger project the band has undertaken to fundraise and raise awareness for the UN Refugee Agency. We are now witnessing the highest levels of displacement on record. An unprecedented 80 million people around the world have been forced from home. Among them are nearly 26.3 million refugees, half of whom are under the age of 18.  One person is forcibly displaced almost every two seconds as a result of conflict or persecution.

We hope that the kinds of conversations we can have as musicians can provide a model for peace that we hope our politicians and citizens find inspiration from.

We are creating our most exciting album yet, and we cannot wait to share the results of our collaborations! Please check out the rewards and see if there is a way you would like to be involved. If there is a Perk you are looking for but don't see to the right, don't hesitate to get in touch. And of course come see us live in concert when we are in your area!

Together we can create beautiful music — THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

 

Who is on this recording anyway?

Ahmed Moneka - IRAQ / CAN
Amchok Gompo - TIBET / CAN
Donné Roberts - MADAGASCAR / CAN
Duke Redbird - FIRST NATION INDIGENOUS
Fethi Nadjem - Algeria / CAN
Gundem Yayli Grubu - TURKEY
Juan Carlos Medrano - COLOMBIA / CAN
Leen Hamo - SYRIA / CAN
Marito Marques - PORTUGAL / CAN

Meg Contini - CAN
Mehmet Akatay - TURKEY
Padideh Ahrarnejad - IRAN / CAN
Ravi Naimpally - INDIA / CAN
Sammy Figueroa - PUERTO RICO / USA
Saskia Tomkins - ENGLAND / CAN
Selcuk Suna - TURKEY / CAN
Suat Suna - TURKEY
Tamar Ilana - CAN
Tara Moneka - IRAQ / CAN
Twin Flames - INDIGENOUS CAN
Yukiko Tsutsui - JAPAN / CAN

My own grandfather came to North America as a stow away on a ship in the early 1900s from LEBANON and my pianist mother from EGYPT.  And our percussionist Rosendo 'Chendy' Leon came to North America as a refugee from CUBA.
Also the regular band including the fabulous Kevin Laliberté and Drew Birston!

 


Bio for Sultans of String:

3x JUNO nominees and SiriusXM winners Sultans of String create “Energetic and exciting music from a band with talent to burn!” (Maverick Magazine UK). Thrilling their audiences with their genre-hopping passport of Celtic reels, flamenco, Gypsy-jazz, Arabic, Cuban, and South Asian rhythms, Sultans of String celebrate musical fusion and human creativity with warmth and virtuosity. Fiery violin dances with rumba-flamenco guitar, while bass and percussion lay down unstoppable grooves. Acoustic strings meet with electronic wizardry to create layers and depth of sound, while world rhythms excite audiences to their feet with the irresistible need to dance.

Since releasing their debut album Luna in 2007, Sultans of String have continually strived to make each chart-topping album more original and meaningful than the last. That includes working with an orchestra (2013's Symphony), teaming with Pakistani sitarist Anwar Khurshid (2015's Subcontinental Drift) and even crafting a world-music holiday album (2017's Christmas Caravan), which landed them on the Billboard charts and the New York Times. Their ambition and work ethic have garnered them multiple awards and accolades, including three JUNO nominations, first place in the International Songwriting Competition (out of 15,000 entries), three Canadian Folk Music Awards and countless other honours, plus a Queen’s Diamond Jubilee medal (for bandleader Chris McKhool). Their 2020 release Refuge is already garnering awards including 2 Independent Music Awards for Instrumental Song of the Year and World Music Producer of the Year, as well as 2021 CFMA for Producer of the Year for Chris McKhool and John Bailey.

McKhool has an Egyptian-born mother who happened to play piano, teach classical theory, and feed her young son as much Middle Eastern cuisine as she did music lessons. From there, the powerful violinist developed a taste for multi-genre string sounds and found a like-minded crew of all-world enthusiasts. When McKhool first heard founding guitarist Kevin Laliberté’s (Jesse Cook) rumba rhythm, their musical synergy created Sultans of String’s signature sound – the intimate and playful relationship between violin and guitar. From this rich foundation, the dynamic duo grew, featuring such amazing musical friends as in-the-pocket bass master Drew Birston (Chantal Kreviazuk), and the jaw-dropping beats of percussionist Chendy Leon.

Their live resume is similarly stellar. Equally at home in a concert hall, folk and jazz club or festival setting, the Sultans have gigged at JUNOfest, the legendary club Birdland in New York, Celtic Connections Festival (Glasgow) and London’s Trafalgar Square. They have sold out Koerner Hall three times (Toronto’s Carnegie Hall), and performed with the Annapolis, Toronto, Vancouver, Edmonton Symphony Orchestras. They have played live on CBC’s Canada Live, BBC Radio, BBC TV, Irish National Radio, and the syndicated World Café, Woodsongs, and SiriusXM in Washington. Sultans of String’s musicianship and versatility are also showcased in collaborations with such diverse luminaries as Paddy Moloney & The Chieftains, Sweet Honey in The Rock, Richard Bona (Paul Simon), Alex Cuba, Ruben Blades, Yasmin Levy, Benoit Bourque, Béla Fleck, Crystal Shawanda & Ken Whiteley.   

https://igg.me/at/sultansofstring

story:
I'm recording an EP!

Dear friends and family, 

I am very excited to announce that this summer I will be recording and releasing an EP! I wrote these songs over the course of ten years. In my opinion, they're the best I've ever written. I can't wait to share them with all of you!

A Little About Me...

I've been writing songs and performing since I was about five years old.

In high school, I got the chance to record my first album, Offering, which I released in 2005. Some of you will remember this artifact ;)

And just for fun, here's my very-professional CD-release announcement:

Since then, it's been SIXTEEN YEARS since I've formally recorded or released any music. I never stopped writing music or wanting to share it, but I couldn't quite figure out how it fit into my life after high school. If I wasn't going to pursue a career in songwriting, did it really make sense to spend so much time and energy on music? But perhaps the biggest reason I put songwriting on the back burner was that I got scared. The more time that passed and the older I got, the more risky it seemed to invest (financially, emotionally, time-wise, etc.) into music or call myself a songwriter. I couldn't tell if I was any good anymore, and I didn't want to embarrass myself by releasing music that wasn't "perfect."

What a sad and silly way to spend sixteen years!!!

I'm so thankful to be leaving that period behind. I'll spare you the details, but over the past two years, I've gone through quite a transformative journey. I've learned to honor my love of music and writing enough to pursue both wholeheartedly again. I've learned that it is absolutely necessary to take risks in order to live a life that feels worthwhile.

Still, I felt hesitant and nervous to start this project, and I might never have done it if my incredible new friend Stephen Brackett hadn't given me a big kick in the pants by offering to pay for my recording time with our other friend Dave Young of Widget Studios. Another thing I've learned over the past two years is that it's impossible to take the really important risks in life apart from the love and support of others. 

^Not a photo of Stephen, Dave, or Joel. Just a photo illustrating love and support with two of my favorite musical friends, Misha and Shantelle <3 

So here's is my big risk of 2021--I'm asking YOU to donate to my campaign and help bring this EP into the world!

My goal is to raise $7,300 over the next 15 days to cover the cost of production, mixing, mastering, hiring session musicians, and releasing this collection of songs. I'm very excited to be working with my dear friend, Joel Piedt of Carrousel, who will be coming to Denver next week to help me produce these songs! I've been hoping to work with him for a few years now--he is an incredible musician and producer, and it's a dream come true to finally get to collaborate with him.

Whether you can give a little or a lot, I'm so thankful to each and every one of you for joining me on this journey. Even if you can't give now, I'd love for you to follow along! I'll be posting video updates here and on my instagram from time to time, so keep checking back here to see my progress.

Alright...LET'S DO THIS!!!!!

But perhaps the biggest reason I put songwriting on the back burner was that I got scared. The more time that passed and the older I got, the more risky it seemed to invest (financially, emotionally, time-wise, etc.) into music or call myself a songwriter. I couldn't tell if I was any good anymore, and I didn't want to embarrass myself by releasing music that wasn't "perfect."What a sad and silly way to spend sixteen years!!!I'm so thankful to be leaving that period behind. I'll spare you the details, but over the past two years, I've gone through quite a transformative journey. I've learned to honor my love of music and writing enough to pursue both wholeheartedly again. I've learned that it is absolutely necessary to take risks in order to live a life that feels worthwhile.
Still, I felt hesitant and nervous to start this project, and I might never have done it if my incredible new friend Stephen Brackett hadn't given me a big kick in the pants by offering to pay for my recording time with our other friend Dave Young of Widget Studios. Another thing I've learned over the past two years is that it's impossible to take the really important risks in life apart from the love and support of others. 

^Not a photo of Stephen, Dave, or Joel. Just a photo illustrating love and support with two of my favorite musical friends, Misha and Shantelle <3 
So here's is my big risk of 2021--I'm asking YOU to donate to my campaign and help bring this EP into the world!My goal is to raise $7,300 over the next 15 days to cover the cost of production, mixing, mastering, hiring session musicians, and releasing this collection of songs. I'm very excited to be working with my dear friend, Joel Piedt of Carrousel, who will be coming to Denver next week to help me produce these songs! I've been hoping to work with him for a few years now--he is an incredible musician and producer, and it's a dream come true to finally get to collaborate with him.Whether you can give a little or a lot, I'm so thankful to each and every one of you for joining me on this journey. Even if you can't give now, I'd love for you to follow along! I'll be posting video updates here and on my instagram from time to time, so keep checking back here to see my progress.Alright...LET'S DO THIS!!!!!

story:
Of Hard Times & Harmony [Extended for pre-orders]

Windborne has spent the past 3 years bringing our unique blend of "stunningly powerful vocal harmony," coupled with a message of social justice to communities around the country. Throughout our travels, we kept hearing from people who share how this music has had a profound impact on their lives, revitalizing them in a time when they felt mired in hopelessness and helping them connect with their communities through music and action. Touched by your stories, we have developed our concert repertoire to not only entertain, but to uplift, energize, and inspire.

As our continued offering to meet that need in a time of division, we are SO excited to announce our latest project, Of Hard Times & Harmony.

Of Hard Times & Harmony is an album of critique, activism, inspiration, and introspection. With 14 tracks in four languages, it will come in a CD-sized hardcover book with lyrics, art, and essays to accompany each piece. These arrangements represent the product of years of singing together almost every day, intimately learning each others voices and discovering how to use the power of vocal harmony to form something beyond the component parts. BBC Travelling Folk calls us "A quartet the likes of which I haven't seen since... Coope, Boyes and Simpson, the Watersons, or The Voice Squad. Just absolutely phenomenal!" 

We have some great rewards for you, from signed & numbered limited-editions, free VIP release party tickets ($20 value) to Zoom lessons and concerts, t-shirts, "song sponsorships," sheet music of the arrangements, and more!

Ready to support the project now? Click on any box to the right to see everything that's included in the Perk level, then click the "Get This Perk" button to proceed to payment! If you want to make a donation of any amount with no perk, go to the top of the page and click the pink "Back It" button.

Grassroots, People-Powered Music

There are just 4 people who work for Windborne, and you hear them on every track! We don't have a big label producing our albums, and are able to stay independent for one reason: YOU!

The generous support of our community has made it possible for us to pursue this calling full time, and we are asking for your help in bringing Of Hard Times & Harmony to life! Here are some of the costs involved:

  • $5,000 Recording, editing, mixing, & mastering- We are so proud of these songs, and want the recordings to convey all the richness, vitality, and intricacy they have in performance
  • $15,000 CD/Book Manufacturing - In order to fulfill our vision of a multi-faceted presentation of a beautiful hardcover book with gorgeous art, song lyrics, and essays telling the story and history of each piece, we need to do a run of 5,000 copies to make the unit cost affordable.
  • $6500 The nitty gritty- It's not glamorous, but things like rights & royalties, graphic design as well as packaging and shipping all the rewards,
  • Fees 8-10% of what we raise will go to the Indiegogo platform fee and credit card processing fees will cost at least $5,000 likely a little bit more, 
  • $5,000 Promotion: it is becoming increasingly clear to us that a strong radio and digital promotion campaign is vital to getting these songs out into the world and reaching new audiences. And it works: We topped the Folk Charts on our last radio promotion campaign!

Keep the music alive!

We are in the midst of a crisis for the performing arts. Venues are shutting down, and many artists are forced to pause their artistic work in order to make ends meet. Your support is more impactful than ever - you aren't simply supporting this album, but your pledge is what enables us to continue pursuing our artistic goals.

You can keep us creating, connecting, and commentating on the times we are in. If music is helping you get through this time, please help us get through it too! Join in making sure that when we are able to come together again, Windborne will be out there making music, teaching song, and singing out.

Risks & Challenges

The tracks are recorded, and we have started the editing process. These are uncertain times, and both manufacturing and shipping industries have been experiencing delays, but the audio should be finished this year (and backers will be given access to early digital downloads at that time) with a physical ship date in the first half of 2021.

Lots of Exciting Perks!

Aside from Of Hard Times & Harmony itself, we wanted to highlight some of the other great perks you could get!

Sing These Songs: In a singing group or choir? This is your chance to get full sheet music arrangements (at a discounted rate) along with the book. Some pieces will not be available due to publishing rights restrictions, sorry!

Lesson: Take a private lesson with a group member, or consult about vocal arranging! You'll get one-on-one time and musical inspiration!

Producer: If you believe in Windborne's mission, music, and message, and want to support us being able to continue doing it, consider becoming a Windborne Producer! You get your name in the book, a bunch of other perks, and you'll know you are vital in supporting this work!

Sponsor a Song: Sponsor a song in the book and even write a sentence about why you are doing so! Consider dedicating a song to a loved one, organization, or cause that is important to you.

Private Zoom Concert/Workshop: A great idea for a birthday, or other celebration! Windborne sings and chats with you and your select friends. Bring music into your community!

Benefactor and Lifetime of Song! If you do have the extra means and want to make a huge difference in our lives, consider these levels (or in between!) We know that this kind of gift is rare, and we are so touched. Whether it is custom arrangements of a song, or lifetime Windborne tickets, we will find the perfect way to thank you. Your support enables us to keep creating and singing to the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have backed the project and are looking for other ways to support us (or you can't back us right now) here are some other ways to support Windborne!

  • Tell your friends! Share this project using the social tools, but more importantly share WHY you support Windborne. We are collecting short quotes as well as 30 second videos of folks sharing why they love this music and message, and would love to feature yours!
  • Join us on Patreon: Our Patreon community supports us with a monthly donation, which have been vital during this time. Works in progress, secret songs, material from our archive and our lives, this is where you get it. (Patreon.com/Windborne)

Thank you so much for your support, keep fighting the good fights, and keep singing the good songs! AND VOTE!!!


In song and solidarity,
Windborne
Jeremy Carter-Gordon, Lauren Breunig, Lynn Rowan, Will Rowan

story:
Hey everyone, Spencer Mackenzie here and welcome to my INDIEGOGO campaign!

I've built this campaign to invite you to help support my third Studio album, that I am so excited to be releasing to all of you later this year!

As we all know due to the current world circumstances, the live music industry has come to a halt. Any shows that we had booked over the past year were cancelled, and the immediate future does look uncertain.

I had started recording the new album by funding it myself right before the pandemic hit, and decided to continue the project since I had all this free time, however, I was relying on the future income from touring to continue funding the record.

This campaign is simply built to give you the opportunity to pre-purchase the album or one of my added perks, and by doing so you will be, contributing to help us raise some of the funds needed.

Meet the Team

Let me tell you about the very talented team behind the album that brings this album to a whole new level!

I’d like to start with my producer, recording and mixing engineer, Juno Nominated Ross Hayes Citrullo and the use of his amazing studio RHC Music in Toronto Ontario.

Musicians:

  • Miles Evans on Keys 
  • Steve Pelletier on Bass (Juno ward winner on Miles to Go-Colin James)
  • Stacey Shopsowitz on Bass
  • Adam Cannon on Drums
  • Chantal Williams- Background Vocals
  • Julian Nalli on Saxophone
  • Steve Dyte on Trumpet
  • Special guest, Juno award winner, Steve Strongman on Paranoia Blues
  • Richard Mackenzie, as co-writer

Preach to my Soul

Preach to my Soul is the name of my new record. In one way or another these songs all come from inspirations around me. These songs are created from the heart and my love for the Blues. The title track is my way to pay homage to the blues icons and to those that are no longer with us, and how I count on them to continue to influence me by making me a better artist, writer, and performer. No matter where they are they continue to ‘preach to my soul’.

Its apparent that the blues is all around us, the album is a mix of some strong blues-rock songs to traditional soul felt blues, to songs about love and relationships going wrong to a song about a personal loss of a loved one. It also covers social issues of ongoing struggles and one on the much needed discussion of mental illness awareness. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding raised will go towards production costs, manufacturing, marketing and live video productions that I am excited to share with you!

There are many ways to help from pre-purchasing the album and/or choosing one of the different perks including my songwriting notes, guitar lessons, virtual or live concerts, virtual on-on-one shows, and more including my favourite, a VIP ticket to a pre-release event at RHC music to be the first to hear my new album before anyone else! 

The Impact

I am proud to say that my past two albums have been greatly received, reaching the top of many radio charts and amazing reviews from around the World. None of that would have been possible without the support team behind me. I am so blessed to have worked with some incredible people from producers, engineers, graphic designers, photographers, video production teams, musicians, publicists, radio distribution/hosts and more. I had completely funded my first album 'Infected with the Blues' on my own and my second album ' was partially funded by FACTOR. 

Whether this campaign builds $10 or $14,000 I am extremely grateful to you and will be putting it all towards my final costs. My plan is to release this album the end of 2021 and am very excited to get it to you!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know many people have been faced with challenges due to the COVID and has affected many of our financial situations so if you cannot contribute you can help by sharing, tagging, emailing this to your friends, family and business connections. I appreciate your help at any level and could not have done this without your help.

Let’s all make some noise that Spencer Mackenzie is coming at you this Fall with his highly anticipated new album!

Thank you!

Spencer

www.spencermackenzie.ca

story:
Short Summary

Archie is 14 and has been passionate about singing all his life.  Hailing from Great Milton in Oxfordshire, he was a chorister at Magdalen College Oxford, under the baton of Mark Williams, reluctantly 'retiring' at the age of 12.  For the last eighteen months he has been studying with Maria Thompson, who prepared him successfully for his singing Diploma and for his entry into the BBC Young Chorister of the Year competition.  

Still a treble, he has continued to sing both as a soloist and collaboratively.  He has a particular love of the Baroque to early Classical periods and wishes to record, professionally, some of the music that means so much to him, before his voice changes, accompanied by authentic period instruments.  The music will represent a journey, or progress, through geography and time, across Baroque Europe.

Making this album means a great deal to Archie and whilst it may well be his 'swansong' as a treble, he hopes it might set his feet on the path to making more music with the voice that rises from its ashes. 

 Archie has been much inspired by many wonderful musicians and singers who tread the path ahead of him and he would very much like to be able to one day leave something of value on the path behind him.

Any residual funds, after the cost of recording and releasing this CD will be donated to charitable causes, including those aimed at supporting other young people starting down their own musical and life paths. 

These will be:

A: Mustardseed. 

Mustardseed’s mission is to provide an inspirational and practical education for young children, encouraging them to flourish and prosper in Uganda and the wider world.

Mustardseed School was conceived by two friends: Kenneth Buwule, a Ugandan school teacher, book editor and postgraduate scholar of peace and conflict resolution, and John Caird, a British writer and theatre director (and Magdalen College School alumnus) whose work has been performed all around the world. Kenneth and John share a deep sense of care for the health of the world in ecological and educational terms.

The name of the school is taken from the parable of the Mustardseed.  If you plant even the smallest of seeds in fertile ground, it can grow into a mighty tree that will provide a home for the birds of the air to make their nests and raise their young.

B: Cathedral Music Trust

Cathedral Music Trust is a voice for cathedral music, upholding this integral part of the nation’s cultural heritage by campaigning on behalf of cathedral music and musicians, supporting cathedral choirs and choristers in need, and encouraging the pursuit of excellence in choral and organ music. Harry Christophers, CBE, founder and conductor of The Sixteen, is our first President.

The formation of the Trust was made possible through the remarkable work of Friends of Cathedral Music (FCM) which, since its launch in 1956, has given generous grants to Anglican and Roman Catholic cathedrals, church and collegiate chapel choirs in the UK and overseas, including more than £2 million in the past six years alone. It has also endowed places for choristers and strived to maintain the glorious cathedral tradition of choral worship.

C: Felix Foundation

FOOD REDISTRIBUTION CHARITY IN LONDON FIGHTING FOOD WASTE AND HUNGER

1.5 million adults in London struggle to afford to eat every day, 400,000 children are at risk of missing the next meal. Meanwhile, our food industry generates almost 2 million tonnes of good, edible surplus food each year.

The Felix Project is a London-based food redistribution waste charity set up in 2016 to tackle both issues.

D: Save Me Trust

The Save Me Trust  exists to protect the welfare and dignity of wild animals

Save Me was founded by Dr. Brian May and Anne Brummer to work on the issues affecting wildlife today.

Climate change, increasing human population, destruction of habitats and pollution are the most significant factors causing the rapid decline of the creatures with whom we share our Planet. 

By working together and changing our behaviours, we can achieve sustainable change that supports wildlife, business and the environment, and offers every inhabitant of Planet Earth a better future.

E: Childhood Cancer Research Trust.

The Childhood Cancer Research Trust was set up by the parents of a friend of Archie who has an aggressive form of cancer.  Archie was already working on a duet album with a fellow chorister, Myron, to raise funds for cancer in memory of Myron's grandmother when his brother was diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of cancer.  Every year around 400,000 children under the age of 19 are diagnosed with cancer but even in high income countries, one in five will not survive 5 years. This new trust has been set up to raise desperately needed funds to support research into better treatments for the millions of children who must face this traumatic journey.

How your support will help

Your kind support will help with the costs of producing the master CD, including venue hire, instrumental accompaniment, production, engineering and editing.  We have calculated that we need £15,000 to complete the project and are setting our initial funding goal at £10,000, because this is the minimum level at which the project can proceed.  

In return, you will be sent a signed copy of the CD.  If you are able to be even more generous, you will be eligible for your name to be posted on the CD insert, have a personal dedication or even a piece chosen by and recorded for you, a loved one, or in memoriam, with a full dedication. 

If we raise more than we need to release the CD, Archie will donate it to one of five charitable causes (listed above) which mean something to him.  We will ask you to 'vote' for the charity that you would most like to support when you make your donation and will split any such money according to the 'votes'.

If the funding goal is not met, your money will be returned to you or you may wish to donate it directly to one of Archie's chosen charities.

Archie has selected repertoire for which he has a particular love and which he feels is  representative of the theme of a progress through the music of the Baroque in its geographical context. It will include pieces both well known and a little less commonly performed to reflect a journey across Baroque Europe from Italy, through Germany and France, to England.

He will be accompanied by authentic period instruments by leading professional musicians to provide musical and historical integrity.

Examples of Proposed Repertoire:

Quia Respexit from Magnificat in D (Bach)

Domine Deus from Gloria (Vivaldi)

As when the dove from Acis and Galatea (Handel)

O dio se fosse vero (Bononcini)

Vidit suum dulcem natus from Stabat Mater (Pergolesi)

Cujus animam gementum (Pergolesi)

Dido's lament from Dido and Aeneas (Purcell)

How beautiful are the feet, from Messiah, (Handel)

Bist du bei mir (Stötzel).

Music for a While (Purcell)

The Impact

Archie cannot do this without your help.

The current restrictions have meant that he has been unable to perform in public, during what may have been the most productive year for his treble voice and he would like to distil this untapped energy into something meaningful and lasting.  The musicians who will be accompanying him have also been restricted in their opportunities to perform and the chance to collaborate is, thus, all the more exciting. 

Through the sadness of imminent loss, yet with his eyes forward, Archie feels a connection both to the past and to the future and has a sense of the journey that this recording will represent via a musical progress through time and space.  

Risks and Challenges

A project like this is ambitious for such a young musician.  Archie is aware of this and takes a very responsible and professional approach to what he is doing.  He has made recordings before and is fully aware of the long days and hard work which it involves, as well as the meticulous preparation that is required.  

Some of the risk lies in the very nature of a boy's treble voice on the cusp of change. Archie knows that he must look after his voice and is prepared to make many sacrifices to keep it in good condition, including avoiding tempting foods which may not support it.  The risk of voice change underpins the imperative to proceed as early as possible ad the recording is, thus, planned for this April.

The risk of not completing the recording is dependent upon funding, in which case donations will be refunded.  There is also the risk of unavoidable last minute change in the availability of the participants or recording venue and this will most likely be resolved by some schedule shuffling. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that you may not be able to contribute financially to this project.  However, you can still be an enormous support to us, simply by sharing this campaign with others, through your networks, via the Indiegogo 'share' tools or by word of mouth.  All and any help is hugely appreciated.
