Making this album means a great deal to Archie and whilst it may well be his 'swansong' as a treble, he hopes it might set his feet on the path to making more music with the voice that rises from its ashes. 
 Archie has been much inspired by many wonderful musicians and singers who tread the path ahead of him and he would very much like to be able to one day leave something of value on the path behind him.
Any residual funds, after the cost of recording and releasing this CD will be donated to charitable causes, including those aimed at supporting other young people starting down their own musical and life paths. 
These will be:
A: Mustardseed. 
Mustardseed’s mission is to provide an inspirational and practical education for young children, encouraging them to flourish and prosper in Uganda and the wider world.
Mustardseed School was conceived by two friends: Kenneth Buwule, a Ugandan school teacher, book editor and postgraduate scholar of peace and conflict resolution, and John Caird, a British writer and theatre director (and Magdalen College School alumnus) whose work has been performed all around the world. Kenneth and John share a deep sense of care for the health of the world in ecological and educational terms.
The name of the school is taken from the parable of the Mustardseed.  If you plant even the smallest of seeds in fertile ground, it can grow into a mighty tree that will provide a home for the birds of the air to make their nests and raise their young.
B: Cathedral Music Trust
Cathedral Music Trust is a voice for cathedral music, upholding this integral part of the nation’s cultural heritage by campaigning on behalf of cathedral music and musicians, supporting cathedral choirs and choristers in need, and encouraging the pursuit of excellence in choral and organ music. Harry Christophers, CBE, founder and conductor of The Sixteen, is our first President.
The formation of the Trust was made possible through the remarkable work of Friends of Cathedral Music (FCM) which, since its launch in 1956, has given generous grants to Anglican and Roman Catholic cathedrals, church and collegiate chapel choirs in the UK and overseas, including more than £2 million in the past six years alone. It has also endowed places for choristers and strived to maintain the glorious cathedral tradition of choral worship.
C: Felix Foundation
FOOD REDISTRIBUTION CHARITY IN LONDON FIGHTING FOOD WASTE AND HUNGER
1.5 million adults in London struggle to afford to eat every day, 400,000 children are at risk of missing the next meal. Meanwhile, our food industry generates almost 2 million tonnes of good, edible surplus food each year.
The Felix Project is a London-based food redistribution waste charity set up in 2016 to tackle both issues.
D: Save Me Trust

The Save Me Trust  exists to protect the welfare and dignity of wild animals
Save Me was founded by Dr. Brian May and Anne Brummer to work on the issues affecting wildlife today.
Climate change, increasing human population, destruction of habitats and pollution are the most significant factors causing the rapid decline of the creatures with whom we share our Planet. 
By working together and changing our behaviours, we can achieve sustainable change that supports wildlife, business and the environment, and offers every inhabitant of Planet Earth a better future.
E: Childhood Cancer Research Trust. 
The Childhood Cancer Research Trust was set up by the parents of a friend of Archie who has an aggressive form of cancer.  Archie was already working on a duet album with a fellow chorister, Myron, to raise funds for cancer in memory of Myron's grandmother when his brother was diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of cancer.  Every year around 400,000 children under the age of 19 are diagnosed with cancer but even in high income countries, one in five will not survive 5 years. This new trust has been set up to raise desperately needed funds to support research into better treatments for the millions of children who must face this traumatic journey.
How your support will help
Your kind support will help with the costs of producing the master CD, including venue hire, instrumental accompaniment, production, engineering and editing.  We have calculated that we need £15,000 to complete the project and are setting our initial funding goal at £10,000, because this is the minimum level at which the project can proceed.  
In return, you will be sent a signed copy of the CD.  If you are able to be even more generous, you will be eligible for your name to be posted on the CD insert, have a personal dedication or even a piece chosen by and recorded for you, a loved one, or in memoriam, with a full dedication. 
If we raise more than we need to release the CD, Archie will donate it to one of five charitable causes (listed above) which mean something to him.  We will ask you to 'vote' for the charity that you would most like to support when you make your donation and will split any such money according to the 'votes'.
If the funding goal is not met, your money will be returned to you or you may wish to donate it directly to one of Archie's chosen charities.
Archie has selected repertoire for which he has a particular love and which he feels is  representative of the theme of a progress through the music of the Baroque in its geographical context. It will include pieces both well known and a little less commonly performed to reflect a journey across Baroque Europe from Italy, through Germany and France, to England.
He will be accompanied by authentic period instruments by leading professional musicians to provide musical and historical integrity.
Examples of Proposed Repertoire:
Quia Respexit from Magnificat in D (Bach)
Domine Deus from Gloria (Vivaldi)
As when the dove from Acis and Galatea (Handel)
O dio se fosse vero (Bononcini)
Vidit suum dulcem natus from Stabat Mater (Pergolesi)
Cujus animam gementum (Pergolesi)
Dido's lament from Dido and Aeneas (Purcell)
How beautiful are the feet, from Messiah, (Handel)
Bist du bei mir (Stötzel).
Music for a While (Purcell)

The Impact
Archie cannot do this without your help.
The current restrictions have meant that he has been unable to perform in public, during what may have been the most productive year for his treble voice and he would like to distil this untapped energy into something meaningful and lasting.  The musicians who will be accompanying him have also been restricted in their opportunities to perform and the chance to collaborate is, thus, all the more exciting. 
Through the sadness of imminent loss, yet with his eyes forward, Archie feels a connection both to the past and to the future and has a sense of the journey that this recording will represent via a musical progress through time and space.  

Risks and Challenges
A project like this is ambitious for such a young musician.  Archie is aware of this and takes a very responsible and professional approach to what he is doing.  He has made recordings before and is fully aware of the long days and hard work which it involves, as well as the meticulous preparation that is required.  
Some of the risk lies in the very nature of a boy's treble voice on the cusp of change. Archie knows that he must look after his voice and is prepared to make many sacrifices to keep it in good condition, including avoiding tempting foods which may not support it.  The risk of voice change underpins the imperative to proceed as early as possible ad the recording is, thus, planned for this April.
The risk of not completing the recording is dependent upon funding, in which case donations will be refunded.  There is also the risk of unavoidable last minute change in the availability of the participants or recording venue and this will most likely be resolved by some schedule shuffling. 

Other Ways You Can Help
We completely understand that you may not be able to contribute financially to this project.  However, you can still be an enormous support to us, simply by sharing this campaign with others, through your networks, via the Indiegogo 'share' tools or by word of mouth.  All and any help is hugely appreciated.

story:
Overview

Hey everyone! I'm Lindy, a San Diego musician and dancer, and after nearly a decade of playing swing, jazz, blues, funk, rock and ska, I'm ready to record an EP of 6 original swing tunes as Lindy and the Hops, set to be released in August 2021! Of all the projects that I've been involved with, this is the first where I've put out music that I'd written myself, and it's something that I've wanted to do for a very long time. I've finally taken the plunge, and have combined my love of jazz, dance, and songwriting into an album that's joyful, irreverent, swings hard, and still bares my soul a bit.

The music is written, the band is assembled, the studio is booked, and rehearsals are underway. It's all happening, and I'd love for you to be a part of it!

Meet The Hops

Joining me are six wonderful musicians that I've had the fortune of playing with in jam sessions, gigs, and bands. Simply put, they rock and I'm thrilled to be working with them. In addition to myself as the bandleader, composer, vocalist, and tenor sax player, the EP will feature:

  • Angelica Yume Pruitt on bass
  • David Sullivan on drums
  • Michael Till on guitar
  • Nightshade Navarro on clarinet
  • Sean Mehaffy on alto and baritone saxophone
  • Thomas Meyer on keys

What We Need and What You Get

Making an album is a lengthy process that involves considerable funding, but you can both ease the financial burden and preorder the album at the same time! It's a win-win situation, and there's some other neat perks you can claim as well. Your contributions will help offset production costs and go towards:

  • Paying the band
  • Studio time at Dirty Blvd Recording, including both tracking and mixing, with Ian Tordella
  • Mastering
  • CD and digital production and duplication via CD baby
  • Licensing fees - one tune is a jazz rendition of a classical piece!
  • Album photography and design

I'm already excited for how the end product will turn out - in fact, the music in the promo video on this page is us during the first rehearsal in my living room! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share via social media! Spreading the word is a great way to help, so tell your friends! Tell your family! Tell your colleagues! Tell your hair stylist! Tell your cat! 

Thank you all so much for checking out the campaign. I can't stress enough how stoked I am to be recording an album as a bandleader and writer for the first time, and any support is greatly appreciated.

story:
We are Prism Percussion

Hello! We are Prism Percussion and we are excited about sharing music! We are a percussion duo based in San Francisco and our mission is to champion works by Black, Indigenous, People of Color (POC), Women, and Queer composers.

We invite you to be a part of an exciting recording project!

This September we are launching a campaign to make an audio and video recording of Transit by Nicholas Pavkovic. Nick has been our mentor and collaborator since our creation in 2018 and the piece Transit has been an ongoing partnership as well. We commissioned the first installment in our first year as a duo (and played it on our very first recital!) and we just commissioned the third installment this year and are now ready to record the piece in its entirety and share it with all of you. Nick not only composed the piece, but will be joining us and playing keyboard in the recording! 

This is our first time doing a professional recording with an audio engineer and professional video as well and it's quite an investment. We are very grateful to have received grant funding from InterMusic SF to support some of the costs associated with this project, but need to raise an additional $1250 to make the project sustainable. We are asking for your help to make this project come to life and are grateful for your consideration. 

Learn more about the fundraiser

We strongly value contributions of all levels and as such, will be recognizing all donors to our crowdfunding campaign on the Thank You section of our Video recording. In the perk you select you will be able to choose how you would like to be listed, or we will reach out directly if you are choosing to fund without selecting a perk. 

 We are excited offer fun and exclusive perks like Prism stickers, a Prism T-shirt, Prism tote bag, and a signed score. Items that require shipping have some additional shipping costs. If you would like a Perk, click on the item you want, instead of "Back It".

We would love if you could help us make our campaign successful by spreading the word and sharing our campaign!

About The Artists

NICHOLAS PAVKOVIC

Nicholas Pavkovic received an A.B. from the University of Chicago in mathematics and an M.M. in composition from the San Francisco Conservatory of Music, where he studied with Elinor Armer. His 2011 composition, Angelus Novus, received the school’s James Highsmith Award for orchestral composition. 

A prolific composer for film, Pavkovic has scored more than two dozen narrative features and shorts, and was named a Sundance Composers Lab fellow in 2008. In the same year he received the grand prize in the Percussive Arts Society composition competition for Concertino for Piano and Percussion. 

He is active in the planning and administration of the San Francisco Conservatory’s annual Hot Air Music Festival, which hosted the premiere of his chamber opera, Sredni Vashtar, in 2010. In 2011, SFCM alumnus and pianist Robin Sutherland premiered Pavkovic’s Rhapsody for Viola and Piano with San Francisco Symphony violist Jonathan Vinocour. Sutherland subsequently commissioned Volante, a three-movement suite for clarinet and piano. 

Mr. Pavkovic is the Executive Director of the Ross McKee Foundation, a member of the San Francisco Conservatory Alumni Council and on the board of the Amateur Music Network.

http://www.pavkovic.com/

DIVESH KARAMCHANDANI

Divesh Karamchandani is a San Francisco-based percussionist and educator frequently engaged in chamber music and large orchestral projects throughout the Greater Bay Area. Karamchandani is the Principal Percussionist of Opera Modesto and One Found Sound, a San Francisco conductorless chamber orchestra. Other notable performances include the New Century Chamber Orchestra, Stockton Symphony, Monterey Symphony, San Francisco Contemporary Music Players, San Francisco Symphony, and Sacramento Philharmonic & Opera. He is a co-founder of Prism Percussion, a duo that explores the expressive colors of percussive sounds by underrepresented composers. 

Karamchandani serves as the Professor of Percussion at California State University, Stanislaus, and West Valley College. He is also in residence as a Teaching Artist with the San Francisco Symphony’s Music and Mentors program and the French American International School. Karamchandani’s educational impact has garnered him an endorsement as a Marimba One Educational Artist. Karamchandani holds a Bachelors of Music from California State University, Stanislaus, and a Masters of Music from San Francisco Conservatory of Music, having studied under the tutelage of Jack Van Geem, Jacob Nissly, James Lee Wyatt III, Chris Woodham, and Allen Brown.

ELIZABETH HALL

Elizabeth Hall is a San Francisco based percussionist and vocalist. She is enthusiastic about chamber music and contemporary music and has played with many groups including San Francisco Opera, Santa Cruz Symphony, One Found Sound, San Francisco Contemporary Music Players, and Adesso Ensemble. She is co-founder of Prism Percussion, a duo which explores the expressive colors of percussive sound and seeks to champion works by Black, Indigenous, People of Color (POC), Women, and Queer composers. Elizabeth regularly plays with and has recently recorded an album with Americana duo, Gutter Swan. She can also be seen playing cajon and singing with the North Beach Ramblers. She began her journey at Heidelberg University and received her Bachelor’s degree from Bowling Green State University and her Master’s degree from the San Francisco Conservatory of Music and has studied with Jack Van Geem, Trey Wyatt, Roger Schupp, Isabelle Huang, and Bill Bleyle.

 

T-shirt sizing information

story:
MEGAN BLACK DEBUT ALBUM

 

Hi everyone! For those of you who don't know me, I'm Megan Black, a singer/songwriter from Scotland. I like to think of myself as a hippy-dippy drag queen. My music usually focuses on themes of LGBTQ+ issues, female empowerment, mental health and gender expression. I love Mick Jagger, Stevie Nicks and David Byrne so I guess my music is an attempt at old rock and roll without the misogyny - but hopefully still as cool!

I have just released my 4th single Freedom Belongs to Him, which is the first single from my debut album which I need your help to finish! I have spent a lot of time throughout the past two years honing my songwriting skills and I cannot wait for you to hear what I have coming. I am so close to having everything ready but the lack of opportunities the past year and a bit has had a massive impact on my income which is why I need your help!

 

How I Will Use The Funding

I am asking for £2,000 to help me finish my debut album. This will go towards: 

- Vinyl/CD Manufacturing 

- Promotional Photographs (photographer)

- Music Video (crew)

- Album Artwork (graphic designer)

I am fortunate that I have a lot of creative friends with who I can team up with to create a lot of my content. However, they deserve to be paid fairly for their work. All other aspects are always 100% funded by myself. 


What You Will Receive

To thank you for your support I have a bunch of rewards that you can choose from. These include:

- A Signed CD (there may be a delay due to COVID) 

- A Signed Vinyl (there may be a delay due to COVID) 

- Digital Download (all tracks on the album) and Album Artwork (prior to the album release)

- Tote Bag (Freedom Belongs to Us design)

- T-shirt (M Logo or Megan Black Silhouette)

- Copy of my Lyric Book 

- Unheard Live Session 

- Cover of Your Choice (let me know you favourite song and I'll record audio and visuals just for you)

There are also bundles available for CD + Vinyl + Digital Download or Tote Bag + T-shirt or the Whole Lot.  

If the funding goal is not met then the release will be postponed until I am able to fund the rest. I have worked extremely hard on the tracks and they will be released but I would like to ensure that the rest of assets alongside are just as good. 

 

Thank You Thank You Thank You

Thank you for everyone's support over the past couple of years, I am so grateful for all your love. I’m really excited for this release and I can’t wait for you guys to hear what I’ve been working on. If you are unable to contribute to the fund but would still like to help out you can share this page with your friends and family and stream my latest single Freedom Belongs to Him! Again, I really appreciate any support you can offer. Keep an eye out for the album when it is released - I promise it will not disappoint. 

 

Listen to Freedom Belongs to Him

This is the first single on the album.

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/track/3gQcXulqyUMvaPlu...

Apple Music: https://music.apple.com/gb/album/freedom-belong...

Bandcamp: https://meganblack.bandcamp.com/track/freedom-b...

Music Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cpHGvgvP5_Q

story:
GOAL

The goal is simple: let’s record a new album and let our fans and friends help us before the recording process starts - when we could really use the money.

Recording an album is expensive, and it’s not a burden we are trying to palm off, it’s an opportunity to be a part of the album in a special way that really helps us. Everyone who becomes a part of this campaign will be mentioned in a special thanks part of the linear notes, immortalized in Meliorist history, pretty cool right?

BUDGET

So let’s break this down:

Production expenses (Production, Mixing, Mastering, Studio Gear, etc)

$35,000

Artwork, Design, Videos: $5,000

Goal: $10,000

Cost of goods - $2000, (20% of $10,000 Goal)

Campaign Fees - $700 ($10,000 goal)

CONCLUSION

At this stage we aren't trying to raise the full $40,000, we are just trying to cover the initial deposit for the production fees to get the ball rolling. Anything extra will go towards the rest of the album.

story:
Muchmusic was Canada’s beating heart of pop culture, a bold, irreverent beacon that drew Canadians of all backgrounds together in their shared love of music and entertainment. 

Until it stopped being Muchmusic and dropped all music programming.

Ed the Sock and his creator Steven Kerzner are putting the band back together, launching NewMusicNation, an online multi-platform interactive channel with the energy of classic Muchmusic, featuring new VJs from across the country and a focus on unsigned and independent Canadian musical artists.

NewMusicNation, named after the seminal Citytv/Muchmusic TV series The New Music, will be different from its predecessor in that it isn’t beholden to large record labels but will focus on emerging artists primarily from Canada. “When Much took the dirt nap, it left Canadian acts high and dry. We’ll bring emerging talents front-and-centre and treat them like stars.”

In addition to new cross-Canada VJs, ordinary Canadians can become Citizen VJs and present their chosen video music favourites. And yes, there will be a Tree Toss and Fromage show.

Why do we need funding? We intend to become advertiser-supported, but we first need to produce content to attract advertisers. That’s where you come in. Your support will allow us to gather the necessary resources - gear, camera ops, editors, writers, researchers, artist relations - to make a giant leap forward with NewMusicNation. 

Plus we want to bring in advertisers after we’ve already set the tone and style of the content, rather than having them try to shape it before it launches.

How much money we raise will determine how much content we can start out with. If we bring in enough, we can even find a NewMusicNation HQ, like the old Much environment. In fact, we’d like a few of them across the country. But that’s Big Picture stuff.

Check out the numerous perks! Zoom calls with Ed, co-host a podcast with Ed, get a customized Ed video greeting card, have your life satirized with a Fromage Bio and more!

When we pull this off together, we’re going to be restoring a very Canadian part of our media that corporate machinations took away. It’s time to restore that Muchmusic-style mayhem for us and for younger generations.

A few of us have been working toward this for a few years now, and it's finally here! Climb aboard, we’re launching!!!

story:
THE UPDATE

My first two singles 'A Saving Grace' and 'A Thousand Setting Suns' from the upcoming EP are out now, along with two music videos! 

The EP will be released on the 26th of November and I'll be sending all the crowdfunding rewards then too! 

Thank you for waiting and thank you for bringing everything to life,

Sonny x 

WE MADE IT!

All thanks to a bunch of beautiful people whom I wish I could hug right now, we went above and beyond my goal of raising 5000 euro in 35 days for my new EP. Now the dream is becoming a reality and the new EP is on it's way!

Thank you endlessly.

                                                          

 

......................................................................................................................................................................

 

The Story

 

     The Beginning        

Hello lovely person! I'm Sonny Casey. At the age of sweet sixteen I started busking on the magical streets of Galway, Ireland.

                                                        

                                                       Busking changed my life.

A whole world of freedom and expression opened up to me. It made me feel like anything was possible. I decided that as soon as I finished school I'd travel and busk my way around the world.

Since then I've busked and gigged across ten countries and countless cities around Europe. 

 

 

The Middle

I've written lots songs along the way. But I haven't recorded an album for over two and a half years. 

When people stop to hear me busk and ask, 'Where can I find that song you just sang?' it makes me feel like a piece is missing when I have to say 'Sorry. It hasn't been recorded yet.'

It's been my dream for over a year now to have my latest songs recorded professionally. I want them to sound as beautiful as possible so people can find them, hear them, feel them and maybe even love them- some place other than just live on the street!

Somewhere along my travels I fell madly in love with wild Berlin. I decided it's the perfect place to begin the next path of my musical journey, to plant some roots and record a new album!

 

 

The End

My last album 'Pocketful of Words' was just me and guitar. For this one I want to flesh out the bones of my songs, to breathe new life into them, so for the past few weeks I've been rehearsing with five incredible musicians who I'll be introducing to you soon! 

Now four new songs and one much-loved old song are ready to be recorded and released into the Universe.

At the end of November, to capture the most amount of feeling, I'll be recording five songs live in a studio, with the added magic of percussion, bass, electric guitar, strings, woodwind and keys. 

The studio is booked, the musicians are armed, the songs are waiting. Now all we need is your help!

 

➳➳➳➳➳┄┄※┄┄➳➳➳➳➳

The Very Serious Bit

 

Water These Seeds

To get these five songs out into the world, I'll need to pay for the studio, production, mixing and mastering, videos, photos, PR, CD printing, not to mention the musician's fees amongst other things! (see breakdown below!)

I've made a living from busking and gigging for the past six years and I've always had enough to get by. For this I'm deeply grateful. However, never before have I taken on a project this huge involving so many professionals. So I'm asking you to hold my hand and walk this path with me so we can water these seeds together and get this tree blooming!

 

Breakdown 

This recording business is a very costly affair. (I know, I couldn't believe it myself when I realised just how costly) From going in to the studio, to printing physical copies of the CD, to all of the magic in between, this EP is going to cost around 6,000 euro.

Here's where all your kind donations will go:

  • Studio & Sound Engineer:  500/day x 2 days =           1,000
  • Mixing & Mastering:  120/song x 5 songs =                      600
  • Musicians:  200/day x 2 days x 5 musicians =              2,000
  • CD Printing (with lyric booklet): 300 CDs =                      600
  • Postage (sending CDs and merch):                                  200
  • Photos & Video: (campaign video & live studio video)   500
  • Merchandise: (t-shirts, bags, stickers, posters)               200
  • PR (reaching people so you can find out about this!)      500
  • Indiegogo Service Fee: (5%)                                                  250  
  • Payment Processing Fee: (3%)                                             150                                                                                                                                                                _________

                                                                                                                = 6,000                                                                                                                                                    _________

 (I'll pay 1,000 with savings from busking and gigging)        - 1,000                                                                                                                                                                           _________

                                       Total:   5,000

 

 

➳➳➳➳➳┄┄※┄┄➳➳➳➳➳

Extra Bits & Bobs

 

   For You Dear  

In return for you making this dream possible, I'll be giving something back. Asides from five new songs for you to listen to before anybody else, there are lots of other groovy gifts to choose from! From stickers to full band house concerts.

I want to make this as personal and creative as possible so I'll be drawing and writing handmade Thank You cards, writing out the lyrics to songs, hand-painting bags and T-shirts and delivering them all directly to your doorstep.

I'll also be learning the songs you'd love for me to cover and recording them for you, I'll even be singing to you through your laptop screen.

Just have a nosy to the right and see which gift feels right for you!

 

...Where The Time Goes

I’ve fretted over the timing of this. I’ve worried that it could be crazy to ask for help at a time of such uncertainty. But ultimately I think people need music and art now more than ever. It was evident right from the start, when we all teared up watching videos of Italian folk singing and playing music from their lonely balconies.

The studio is booked for the 21st and 22nd of November so we're looking forward to sharing the recording process with you here and on social media!

The month of December will be for mixing, mastering, polishing everything off and the first single will hopefully be released around the end of January 2021.

The rest of the songs will be released one by one and then the whole EP will be available by Autumn 2021.

If you choose to be a part of this project you'll get to hear all the songs before they're released- way before the rest of the world!

I

Why This Means The Moon To Me: 

Music is how I connect to myself and others. It's this special place to reach and touch people that goes beyond anything we could ever say with words.

I'd love for all the people I've connected with through music to have a record of my latest songs sounding as lovely as possible. 

I'd love to be able to reach more people than just those that see me busking on the street.

And I'd love for those I do meet busking to be able to take a little piece of the moment home with them in the form of a new CD.

It’s been the most rewarding journey rehearsing with these musicians. I can’t describe in words how explosively beautiful it feels to have them add their magic to these songs. I’m so excited to share them with you! 

 

 

Thank You to the End of the Universe and Back:

Anything you can afford to give will help enormously. Be it five euro or five billion. If you're not in the position to give anything then that's okay- spreading the word also helps! Share this with your friends and family or anyone else you know!

I hope you can be a part of bringing this EP to life.

It's time to get these songs off my chest and have them sounding as lovely as possible so they can fill your ears and hearts and souls and be a warm hug of sunshine for you when winter comes!

Go raibh míle maith agaibh!

Sonny x

➳➳➳➳➳┄┄※┄┄➳➳➳➳➳

All The Links

Crowdfunding Video

Website

Spotify

Instagram

Facebook

YouTube

story:
Hello Friends and Family,

Our humble project began at Auggy Reed Studios in Tulsa, Oklahoma. Jordan Hehl, Matt Teegarden and I cut fifteen tracks, nine for this LP recording. Memphis native Joe Shickie soon added guitar on most of the tunes. Chris Combs and Conor Robb fleshed out the guitar work adding unique aural elements to the album. To complete the recordings, two of Tulsa's great percussionists and four of the area's finest horns joined ten locally renowned singers who make up The Grits choir.

I've been writing all kinds of tunes most of my life, capturing styles that moved me during different stages of personal growth. The Grits: Gravy Baby pays homage to my New Orleans roots as well as my Tulsa teen years of learning guitar and piano and to the Memphis and Delta blues which have influenced much of my writing and playing.

We recorded, mixed and mastered this record to be just that - a record pressed to vinyl. Please pre-order your copy of The Grits: Gravy Baby today!

Please pre-order your copy of The Grits: Gravy Baby today!

story:
Black Willows | Shemurah (english below)

Au vu de la situation sanitaire actuelle causée par le Covid-19, toutes nos prochaines dates ont été annulées. Le revenu de ces dates devait nous aider à financer notre nouvel album, SHEMURAH. Malgré cela, nous nous efforçons de tout mettre en œuvre afin de maintenir notre planning, et de sortir notre nouvel album, comme prévu en septembre 2020 aux Docks de Lausanne. Mais pour cela Black Willows a plus que jamais besoin de votre soutien. Nous avons donc décidé de faire un appel à l’aide à travers ce crowdfunding.

Biographie Black Willows (Heavy Shamanic Doom from Switzerland)

Black Willows est un remède musical à nos tourments existentiels. Si on y voit la glorification d’un pouvoir occulte et maléfique quelconque, alors on se trompe. Si on y voit les ténèbres, c’est parce que ce groupe les dénonce. Bref, si le son gras et puissant de Black Willows flirte avec la nuit et voyage sur des territoires ésotériques depuis déjà quelques années, c’est pour apporter la lumière.

Black Willows - Shemurah

L'album est prévu pour septembre 2020, il est déjà mixé est masterisé.
Ce crowdfunding a pour but de nous aider à trouver le financement qui est de 10'000.- CHF pour le pressage des CDs, vinyles, K7.
Il sera pressé par des entreprises suisses afin d'aider l'économie de notre pays durant ces temps difficiles. Sa durée est de 80 minutes et de ce fait il sera pressé sur un double CD et un double vinyle.

Pour visionner le visuel du projet cliquez ici

Ce nouvel opus métaphysico-transcendental s'annonce déjà comme une pièce maîtresse du groupe lausannois.

Votre aide nous est très précieuse afin de mettre en lumière Shemurah, notre nouvel Album.

D'avance, vous avez toute notre gratitude.

Black Willows
Discographie
Follow us on FaceBook
​Follow us on Instagram 

Black Willows | Shemurah

In view of the current health situation caused by the Covid-19, our upcoming shows have all been cancelled. The income from these dates was supposed to help finance our new album, SHEMURAH. Despite this, we are making every effort to maintain our schedule, and to release our new album, as planned in September 2020 at the Docks in Lausanne. But for this Black Willows needs your support more than ever. So we’ve decided to appeal for help through crowdfunding.

Biography Black Willows (Heavy Shamanic Doom from Switzerland)

Black Willows is a musical remedy to our existential torments. If we see in it the glorification of some occult and evil power of some sort, then we are mistaken. If we see the darkness there, it is because this group denounces them. In short, if the bold and powerful sound of Black Willows flirts with the night and travels on esoteric territories for a few years already, it is to bring light.

Black Willows - Shemurah

The album is scheduled for September 2020, it is already mixed and mastered.
This crowdfunding aims to help us find funding (which is 10'000.- CHF) for the pressing of CDs, vinyls, audio tapes.

It will be pressed by Swiss companies to help the economy of our country during these difficult times. Its duration is 80 minutes and therefore it will be pressed on a double CD and a double vinyl.

Artwork preview here

This new metaphysico-transcendental opus already promises to be a Black Willows masterpiece.

Your help is very precious in order to highlight Shemurah, our new Album.

In advance, you have our gratitude.

Black Willows
Discographie
Follow us on FaceBook
​Follow us on Instagram

Si on y voit la glorification d’un pouvoir occulte et maléfique quelconque, alors on se trompe. Si on y voit les ténèbres, c’est parce que ce groupe les dénonce. Bref, si le son gras et puissant de Black Willows flirte avec la nuit et voyage sur des territoires ésotériques depuis déjà quelques années, c’est pour apporter la lumière.Black Willows - ShemurahL'album est prévu pour septembre 2020, il est déjà mixé est masterisé.Ce crowdfunding a pour but de nous aider à trouver le financement qui est de 10'000.- CHF pour le pressage des CDs, vinyles, K7.Il sera pressé par des entreprises suisses afin d'aider l'économie de notre pays durant ces temps difficiles. Sa durée est de 80 minutes et de ce fait il sera pressé sur un double CD et un double vinyle.Pour visionner le visuel du projet cliquez iciCe nouvel opus métaphysico-transcendental s'annonce déjà comme une pièce maîtresse du groupe lausannois.Votre aide nous est très précieuse afin de mettre en lumière Shemurah, notre nouvel Album.D'avance, vous avez toute notre gratitude.Black WillowsDiscographieFollow us on FaceBook​Follow us on Instagram Black Willows | ShemurahIn view of the current health situation caused by the Covid-19, our upcoming shows have all been cancelled. The income from these dates was supposed to help finance our new album, SHEMURAH. Despite this, we are making every effort to maintain our schedule, and to release our new album, as planned in September 2020 at the Docks in Lausanne. But for this Black Willows needs your support more than ever. So we’ve decided to appeal for help through crowdfunding.Biography Black Willows (Heavy Shamanic Doom from Switzerland)Black Willows is a musical remedy to our existential torments. If we see in it the glorification of some occult and evil power of some sort, then we are mistaken. If we see the darkness there, it is because this group denounces them. In short, if the bold and powerful sound of Black Willows flirts with the night and travels on esoteric territories for a few years already, it is to bring light.Black Willows - ShemurahThe album is scheduled for September 2020, it is already mixed and mastered.This crowdfunding aims to help us find funding (which is 10'000.- CHF) for the pressing of CDs, vinyls, audio tapes.It will be pressed by Swiss companies to help the economy of our country during these difficult times. Its duration is 80 minutes and therefore it will be pressed on a double CD and a double vinyl.Artwork preview hereThis new metaphysico-transcendental opus already promises to be a Black Willows masterpiece.Your help is very precious in order to highlight Shemurah, our new Album.In advance, you have our gratitude.Black WillowsDiscographieFollow us on FaceBook​Follow us on Instagram

story:
UPDATE: The campaign has now ended, but if you would still like to support the project, you can pre-order through my website (https://petertijerina.com/store) or make a donation through Venmo (@jazzbonept or www.venmo.com/jazzbonept) or PayPal (paypal.me/petertijerina).

About Me

Hi everyone, my name is Peter Tijerina and I'm a trombonist, educator, arranger, and composer. I have performed with the Sidewalk Stompers, Katie Flynn Cabaret, Lansing Symphony Jazz Band, Milonga and Son Dulce latin bands, Coeur d'Alene Symphony, and Olympia Symphony Orchestra. Most recently, I taught jazz arranging and trombone at Lincoln College and my nonet currently (before pandemic) occupies a monthly residency at The Iron Post in Urbana, IL.

The Project

Just Yesterday is my debut album and is a reflection of my life up until the date we recorded it, including my experiences with love, loss, adventures with family & friends, and my journey from San Antonio, Texas to Washington state (East and West) to Michigan. I'm super excited to be sharing this music and to be playing with phenomenal musicians! In addition to a few American songbook standard tunes, there are original compositions by myself, Corey Kendrick (piano), Diego Rivera (tenor sax), and Lucas Pino (NYC-based tenor saxophonist and composer). Since producing and releasing an album are quite expensive, I am asking for your support to help cover as much of the costs as possible. Any amount of contribution is GREATLY appreciated! Don't forget to check out the perks/rewards (listed below), they are cumulative (e.g., if you select the "Name on Album Credits" option, you also get an Album Print Shirt, a signed CD, and a digital download.)! I love to give what I can to the music community, but I can't do this project without your support! 

The Album Crew

The Band

Piano, Corey Kendrick: http://coreykendrick.com/
Bass, Aneesa Strings: http://www.aneesastrings.com/
Drums, Nicholas Bracewell: https://nicholasbracewell.com/
Trombone, Peter Tijerina: http://petertijerina.com/

Featured Guest Artists (MSU Professors of Jazz)

Trombone, Michael Dease: http://www.michaeldease.com/ 
Tenor sax, Diego Rivera: https://diegoriverajazz.com/

Behind the Scenes

Audio engineer, Jim Alfredson: https://jimalfredson.com/
Album cover artwork, Nicolas Vigil: https://www.facebook.com/artstudiocrv/

Costs Breakdown

  • Mixing & mastering the music: $500
  • Album cover artwork: $500
  • Registering and licensing the music: $100
  • CD printing: $1200
  • Promotion campaign: $2500
  • Shirts: $600
  • Website (1-year): $200

Your contributions will be used solely for the album. If I exceed my goal, the extra funds will go to any unforeseen album costs or will go toward my next album project!

Perks (Rewards)

$10: Digital Download
$25: Album Hard Copy + Digital Download
$40: Autographed CD + Digital Download
$75: Album Print Shirt + Autographed CD + Digital Download
$100: Your Name On Album + Album Print Shirt + Autographed CD + Digital Download
$200: 30-minute Lesson/Hang + Your Name On Album + Album Print Shirt + Autographed CD + Digital Download
$500: 2-hour Lesson/Hang + Your Name On Album + Album Print Shirt + Autographed CD + Digital Download
$1000: New Song Dedication + 2-hour Lesson/Hang + Your Name On Album + Album Print Shirt + Autographed CD + Digital Download

You can also support me by following me on social media!

  • YouTube: www.youtube.com/c/PeterTijerina
  • Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jazzbonept/
  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/jazzbonept
  • Website: http://petertijerina.com/

story:
The Peace Stage

Neruda Art's Mobile Stage - Built for the people - by the people.

Every project needs a foundation.

This project needs your help!

We are aiming to raise $5432.00 toward the construction of a mobile stage.

With a mobile stage - Neruda Arts can bring music, theatre, and dance to the community, especially outlying communities and those with little access to the arts.

First - a bit about us. Neruda Arts, established in 2001 by Founding Artistic Director, Isabel Cisterna, is a non-profit world-music presenter dedicated to building bridges in the community through music, dance, drama, and literary and visual arts.

Each summer, Neruda Arts presents it's signature event, Kultrún World Music Festival – a free, two-day festival in Victoria Park. Live music from all over the world, as well as local and national bands, plays all weekend - a virtual smorgasbord of culture. This event also highlights arts and crafts people, workshops and interactive events, dance, theatre, food of the world, and in 2019, introduced a concert designed for the deaf and hard of hearing, Feel the Music.

Aside from Kultrún, throughout the year Neruda presents smaller festivals, concerts, establishes panels, facilitates conversation regarding social issues, youth workshops, and creates interactive events with a focus on inclusion.  Neruda Arts educates and introduces the community to a more all-embracing attitude regarding multiculturalism, issues of racism and exclusion.

During the past twenty years, Neruda Arts has been a champion to emerging, mid-career and professional artists, often mentoring and encouraging them in their pursuit of life in the arts.

We have learned a lot through the challenges of COVID-19.  We shifted our focus to support the artists in a way that is best achieved, at this time, through social media. We have just equipped an audio/visual studio called Sound on Sound (SOS), where we have the tools to further the careers of local musicians and more. Yet, we are profoundly aware there are still people left out, not included in the arts, often because of their situation, whether it be mobility, financial or the pandemic itself.

This is where the PEACE STAGE comes in.

If you help us build it, we will come.

With some very able artisans, notably Sandra Dunn of Two Smiths, we are in the midst of constructing a mobile stage. Mobile. We have visions of bringing music to smaller communities, to day care, schools, retirement homes, small outdoor venues – we have a million ideas. Luckily, we don't need a million dollars.

IMPACT

Imagine bringing music to smaller towns, that don't enjoy concerts and art happening in their own communities, or bringing music to shut-ins, youth and people who are financially challenged.

We are asking for donations, not just because we need your financial help, but because we want you, in our  community, to feel THE PEOPLE'S STAGE is YOUR STAGE.

PERKS

These times have been challenging, we know - for all of us. Please don't donate if you, yourself, are struggling. We haven't a lot of perks to offer - but we do have our love and appreciation for all of you. For anyone who donates $200 or more, you will be invited to an exclusive dinner party at the Isabel Cisterna's home (first 16 only) with LIVE MUSIC! For a donation of $50 or more, we are going to create an add-on to the stage with all your names printed on it.

Perhaps you could donated in someone's memory, and add their name to the list.

story:
Meet Noe Venable

✨     Special bonus gift  -  two unreleased songs!  These songs will not be available elsewhere, and you'll receive them in addition to your chosen perk when you contribute any time between now and the end of the campaign.  I'm excited to share these with you!

Also, to hear some of the music from this album, just click the "updates" tab, above!     ✨

 

Hello friends!  

In case you're new to my music, let me introduce myself.

My name is Noe Venable.  (Yes, that's my real name!)  

I'm an independent singer-songwriter and recording artist from San Francisco, California.  You might know me from my earlier releases, The World is Bound by Secret Knots, The Summer Storm Journals, Boots, or Cascadia.

I create ethereal progressive folk music.   Songs to awaken magic and connect to your wild soul.     

I'm here today to invite you to join me as a co-creator of my new album, Gift of Embers.  

But first, I want to tell you the story of how this project came to be.

A couple of years ago, something surprising happened to me.

I fell in love with an instrument.  The Celtic harp.

The timing was not ideal.  As a busy mother of two young children, I barely had time to wash my hair, let alone take up a new instrument. 

But passion won out.  Pretty soon, I was rearranging my life to prioritize learning to play.

As I played, the songs began to come.  

Songs that were wild.  Tender.  Majestic. 

And, like the harp itself, not quite of this world.

Of course, songwriting wasn't new to me.  I'd been a singer-songwriter for decades.  I'd toured the world, been nominated for awards, seen my music featured in film and enjoyed a fulfilling career as a fully independent artist.  

But with the harp, I discovered a well of inspiration I'd not felt in many years - not since, as a teenager, I first picked up the guitar.

With the reckless surrender of new love, I gave myself over to this interest completely.  Before I knew it,  I was deep in the recording process, on a wild, determined mission to create my first ever harp-based singer-songwriter album.

The fruit of this labor is my new record, Gift of Embers. 

As I write, the album is nearly finished.  All that remains are a few crucial steps. 

But to finish those steps, I need your help.

 

What We Need

Writing music and releasing albums is my passion.  Unfortunately, it's also a pretty expensive habit to maintain.  As a person of limited financial means, (and especially since the advent of streaming sites) there is really only one way I can continue to do what I do, and that is with the support of listeners like you.

So here's how it works.  When you contribute to this campaign, you can join the creation of this album, and help me get this album into your hands by summer of 2021.

So let's talk about the money.

My campaign goal is $20,000.   

Now, in case that number made you do a double take (as it did for me when I added it all up!) I want to break it down for you here, and show you where the money goes. 

You'll notice that the largest expenses are paying musicians and recording engineers (everyone but myself, that is!) and paying for studio time, with additional resources allocated to package design and campaign expenses.

Some of these expenses are things I've already invested in, and some are yet to be incurred.

My campaign goal of $20,000 covers a portion of what has already been spent, as well as the remaining steps of mixing, mastering, and having the album pressed. 

Stretch goal - $25,000    If we reach this amount, I will also be able to release the album on vinyl, too.  (I'd love to be able to do this!)

 

The Creators

To give you a sense of how much talent, skill and vision has gone into this album, let me introduce my collaborators.

Todd Sickafoose (co-arranger, bass, piano, keyboards, synths)  Todd is a Tony award winning bassist, multi-instrumentalist, and producer who has recorded and played bass with many genre bending folk artists including Ani DiFranco, Anais Mitchell, and Andrew Bird.  The consistency of his personal voice within wildly diverse collaborations prompted the LA Weekly to call Todd "one of the most comprehensive musical minds of the West coast". 

Mathias Kunzli  (drums, percussion)   Mathias is a wildly inventive and supremely groovy drummer, and a joy to work with.  Hailing from Switzerland, Mathias is equally at home playing frame drums and world music instruments as he is rocking out on a drum kit.   Mathias's prior collaborators have included Moby, Lauryn Hill, Yo-Yo Ma Silk Road Ensemble, John Zorn and Regina Spektor, to name a few.

Adam Levy (electric guitar)  Even if you don't know Adam by name, you've probably heard his playing on hit songs like Norah Jones' multi-platinum song “Come Away With Me”  and Tracy Chapman’s “Give Me One Reason to Stay Here.”  Also an accomplished songwriter in his own right, Adam always knows just how to serve a song.  I can't wait for you to hear what he added to this record!

Alan Lin  (violin)  Alan and I met in our early twenties and have played together ever since.   In addition to supporting songwriters like me, Alan can be found soloing in the San Francisco jazz scene, and he also composes gorgeous music for meditation.  (He's a pretty dead-on astrologer, too...  ;)

Adam Muñoz (mixing)  Adam mixed an early album of mine, and I'm so excited to work with him again!  Adam's mixing credits include The Cranberries, Johanna Newsom, Chris Isaak, Bonnie Raitt, Dave Matthews, Bill Frisell and so many more.  He's a total pro, and his touch is really going to take these songs to the next level!

Additional Collaborators:

Alan Douches (mastering)   As a mastering engineer, Alan has 25+ years experience.  During that time, He has mastered over 16,000 albums with artists in practically every genre of music.  A few notable credits include: Sufjan Stevens, Fleetwood Mac and Yes.

Jeff Hill (additional audio engineering) Jeff Hill is a  bassist, producer and recording engineer based in Brooklyn, New York.  He has worked with many notable musicians and recording artists throughout the years, both on stage and in the studio.  Some of Jeff's prior collaborators include Linda Thompson, Joan Baez, Rufus Wainwright,  Paula Cole,  and Kate and Anna McGarrigle.

Chloe Jackman (album photo shoot)   Photographer Chloe Jackman is the woman behind our last two professional photo shoots. She's awesome - an incredibly talented photographer who's also really adept at putting people at ease behind the camera.  I can't wait to work with her again!

Lindsey Marton O’Brien, A.K.A. Lumina Noctis (artist, Tree of Life image)  Lindsey is the painter, artist and graphic designer who created one of the iconic images that goes along with this music - the Tree of Life.  As a hobbyist botanical perfumer, she also creates handmade perfumes and skincare inspired by the seasons, as well as limited edition shirt designs, art prints, and more.

 

What You Get

Ok, now here's the fun part.  ;)

What do you get when you support this campaign?

 

The Music

Well, first and foremost you'll get the finished album itself, (physical CD or digital album download), long before it's released to the general public.   

In addition, higher pledge levels come with a limited edition bonus recording featuring solo demos of the songs.  

If you're new to my music, you can choose to own my prior releases, while musicians may enjoy my set of two songbooks with chords, fretboard diagrams, and some tablature.

Families with young children may also choose to treat their little ones to the children's albums which accompany my children's music class Noe's Garden, 

Special Extras

At the higher pledge levels,  you'll find all kinds of limited edition and one of a kind extras, integrating your suggestions.

Here are some highlights:

Tree of life T-shirt or Hoodie, featuring our beautiful Tree of Life image created by Lindsey Márton O'Brien of Lumina Noctis.  This image is also available on a 16 x 16 inch silk or synthetic altar or Tarot cloth in several choices of color.

 

For Seekers - Renew your sacred space with the Tree of Life altar cloth, two different crystals, and a drawstring pouch handmade by Noe to stow your spiritual supplies.

For Collectors - Framed, handwritten lyrics to the NV song of your choice.

For Writers - Beautiful nature-inspired journals, designed by Noe, and perfect to tuck in a satchel for a day of writing in the wilds.  

Soul Support -  Join me one on one for a 60 minute one on one session, and let's get to know each other.  Creative coaching?  Spiritual counseling?  Deep listening?  Uncovering your singing voice?  I have experience in all of these areas, and  I'd love to support you.  

For music lovers - A personalized online or in person solo concert for you and your friends!

For families -  I will compose an original song for your child on the topic of their choice (or yours.)  

Credit in the liner notes by name, or anonymously as you wish.

Your name, sung by the sea - For contributors at ALL LEVELS, I am planning a fun way to honor your contribution.  I will take a trip to the shore with the names of all who contributed and sing them aloud to the sea.  I'll let you know when this is happening, and I'll also photograph this ritual, and share the photograph online.  

And more special surprises to be announced as we go, so stay tuned!

 

The Impact

With your support,  I know can deliver you an album like no other.  

I love this album, and I think you're going to love it too, especially for those solitary moments when you're feeling creative, tender, inspired...  For listening to in the bath by candle light, while working at your easel, or taking a solitary walk through the woods.

So first and foremost, this is about the music.

But it's about more than that, too.

Because when you support a campaign like this, you're not just supporting a single project or artist.  You're supporting a world where independent artists can continue to make art, and where that art can reach the folks it's meant for.  Simple.  

 

Risks & Challenges

Well, let me start by telling you about my track record.  As an independent artist, I've released more than 16 albums over the course of my career.  (Some for grown ups, and some for children.)

So I've got some experience with this...  ;)

The challenges with a campaign like this really just boil down to timing.  When it comes to production and CD duplication, things can take longer than expected, so it's always possible I'll need to ask for your patience if the supply chain gets held up and I can't make my hoped for release timeline of early summer.

The other risk has to do with the campaign goal itself.  If we reach this goal, I'll be all set with the needed resources to release this album ASAP.

If we don't reach the goal, I'll still release the album and fulfill all rewards, but it could take longer, since I'd then need to find another way to raise the needed funds.

But let's not go there...  

I'm determined to make this happen!  And together, I believe we can make it be!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Pledge early.  When you pledge during the first few days you help generate the momentum necessary for success.  As an added incentive, those who pledge during the first 48 hours will get a special bonus gift.  An unreleased song that will not be available anywhere else!

Spread the word.  Next to pledging, the single most helpful thing you can do is to help spread the word.  Know anyone who might love this project?  If so, send them an email, tag them in a FB post, or find any other way to share this page with them!   Sharing really, really helps, and I'm so grateful to you for spreading the word to your loved ones and communities.

Get updates.  Want to keep up to date on how the campaign is going?  Stay in the loop by joining my email list.  Your journey will begin with five days of free music, followed by regular updates, new music videos, live appearances, special, surprise perks, and more.
story_txt:
Meet Noe Venable
✨     Special bonus gift  -  two unreleased songs!  These songs will not be available elsewhere, and you'll receive them in addition to your chosen perk when you contribute any time between now and the end of the campaign.  I'm excited to share these with you!
Also, to hear some of the music from this album, just click the "updates" tab, above!     ✨

Of course, songwriting wasn't new to me.  I'd been a singer-songwriter for decades.  I'd toured the world, been nominated for awards, seen my music featured in film and enjoyed a fulfilling career as a fully independent artist.  
But with the harp, I discovered a well of inspiration I'd not felt in many years - not since, as a teenager, I first picked up the guitar.
With the reckless surrender of new love, I gave myself over to this interest completely.  Before I knew it,  I was deep in the recording process, on a wild, determined mission to create my first ever harp-based singer-songwriter album.
The fruit of this labor is my new record, Gift of Embers. 
As I write, the album is nearly finished.  All that remains are a few crucial steps. 
But to finish those steps, I need your help.
 

What We Need
Writing music and releasing albums is my passion.  Unfortunately, it's also a pretty expensive habit to maintain.  As a person of limited financial means, (and especially since the advent of streaming sites) there is really only one way I can continue to do what I do, and that is with the support of listeners like you.
So here's how it works.  When you contribute to this campaign, you can join the creation of this album, and help me get this album into your hands by summer of 2021.
So let's talk about the money.
My campaign goal is $20,000.   
Now, in case that number made you do a double take (as it did for me when I added it all up!) I want to break it down for you here, and show you where the money goes. 

You'll notice that the largest expenses are paying musicians and recording engineers (everyone but myself, that is!) and paying for studio time, with additional resources allocated to package design and campaign expenses.
Some of these expenses are things I've already invested in, and some are yet to be incurred.
My campaign goal of $20,000 covers a portion of what has already been spent, as well as the remaining steps of mixing, mastering, and having the album pressed. 
Stretch goal - $25,000    If we reach this amount, I will also be able to release the album on vinyl, too.  (I'd love to be able to do this!)
 

The Creators
To give you a sense of how much talent, skill and vision has gone into this album, let me introduce my collaborators.

Todd Sickafoose (co-arranger, bass, piano, keyboards, synths)  Todd is a Tony award winning bassist, multi-instrumentalist, and producer who has recorded and played bass with many genre bending folk artists including Ani DiFranco, Anais Mitchell, and Andrew Bird.  The consistency of his personal voice within wildly diverse collaborations prompted the LA Weekly to call Todd "one of the most comprehensive musical minds of the West coast". 

Mathias Kunzli  (drums, percussion)   Mathias is a wildly inventive and supremely groovy drummer, and a joy to work with.  Hailing from Switzerland, Mathias is equally at home playing frame drums and world music instruments as he is rocking out on a drum kit.   Mathias's prior collaborators have included Moby, Lauryn Hill, Yo-Yo Ma Silk Road Ensemble, John Zorn and Regina Spektor, to name a few.

Adam Levy (electric guitar)  Even if you don't know Adam by name, you've probably heard his playing on hit songs like Norah Jones' multi-platinum song “Come Away With Me”  and Tracy Chapman’s “Give Me One Reason to Stay Here.”  Also an accomplished songwriter in his own right, Adam always knows just how to serve a song.  I can't wait for you to hear what he added to this record!

Alan Lin  (violin)  Alan and I met in our early twenties and have played together ever since.   In addition to supporting songwriters like me, Alan can be found soloing in the San Francisco jazz scene, and he also composes gorgeous music for meditation.  (He's a pretty dead-on astrologer, too...  ;)

Adam Muñoz (mixing)  Adam mixed an early album of mine, and I'm so excited to work with him again!  Adam's mixing credits include The Cranberries, Johanna Newsom, Chris Isaak, Bonnie Raitt, Dave Matthews, Bill Frisell and so many more.  He's a total pro, and his touch is really going to take these songs to the next level!
Additional Collaborators:
Alan Douches (mastering)   As a mastering engineer, Alan has 25+ years experience.  During that time, He has mastered over 16,000 albums with artists in practically every genre of music.  A few notable credits include: Sufjan Stevens, Fleetwood Mac and Yes.
Jeff Hill (additional audio engineering) Jeff Hill is a  bassist, producer and recording engineer based in Brooklyn, New York.  He has worked with many notable musicians and recording artists throughout the years, both on stage and in the studio.  Some of Jeff's prior collaborators include Linda Thompson, Joan Baez, Rufus Wainwright,  Paula Cole,  and Kate and Anna McGarrigle.
Chloe Jackman (album photo shoot)   Photographer Chloe Jackman is the woman behind our last two professional photo shoots. She's awesome - an incredibly talented photographer who's also really adept at putting people at ease behind the camera.  I can't wait to work with her again!
Lindsey Marton O’Brien, A.K.A. Lumina Noctis (artist, Tree of Life image)  Lindsey is the painter, artist and graphic designer who created one of the iconic images that goes along with this music - the Tree of Life.  As a hobbyist botanical perfumer, she also creates handmade perfumes and skincare inspired by the seasons, as well as limited edition shirt designs, art prints, and more.
 
What You Get
Ok, now here's the fun part.  ;)
What do you get when you support this campaign?
 
The Music
Well, first and foremost you'll get the finished album itself, (physical CD or digital album download), long before it's released to the general public.   
In addition, higher pledge levels come with a limited edition bonus recording featuring solo demos of the songs.  
If you're new to my music, you can choose to own my prior releases, while musicians may enjoy my set of two songbooks with chords, fretboard diagrams, and some tablature.
Families with young children may also choose to treat their little ones to the children's albums which accompany my children's music class Noe's Garden, 
Special Extras
At the higher pledge levels,  you'll find all kinds of limited edition and one of a kind extras, integrating your suggestions.
Here are some highlights:
Tree of life T-shirt or Hoodie, featuring our beautiful Tree of Life image created by Lindsey Márton O'Brien of Lumina Noctis.  This image is also available on a 16 x 16 inch silk or synthetic altar or Tarot cloth in several choices of color.

 
For Seekers - Renew your sacred space with the Tree of Life altar cloth, two different crystals, and a drawstring pouch handmade by Noe to stow your spiritual supplies.
For Collectors - Framed, handwritten lyrics to the NV song of your choice.
For Writers - Beautiful nature-inspired journals, designed by Noe, and perfect to tuck in a satchel for a day of writing in the wilds.  
Soul Support -  Join me one on one for a 60 minute one on one session, and let's get to know each other.  Creative coaching?  Spiritual counseling?  Deep listening?  Uncovering your singing voice?  I have experience in all of these areas, and  I'd love to support you.  
For music lovers - A personalized online or in person solo concert for you and your friends!
For families -  I will compose an original song for your child on the topic of their choice (or yours.)  
Credit in the liner notes by name, or anonymously as you wish.
Your name, sung by the sea - For contributors at ALL LEVELS, I am planning a fun way to honor your contribution.  I will take a trip to the shore with the names of all who contributed and sing them aloud to the sea.  I'll let you know when this is happening, and I'll also photograph this ritual, and share the photograph online.  
And more special surprises to be announced as we go, so stay tuned!
 
The Impact
With your support,  I know can deliver you an album like no other.  
I love this album, and I think you're going to love it too, especially for those solitary moments when you're feeling creative, tender, inspired...  For listening to in the bath by candle light, while working at your easel, or taking a solitary walk through the woods.
So first and foremost, this is about the music.
But it's about more than that, too.
Because when you support a campaign like this, you're not just supporting a single project or artist.  You're supporting a world where independent artists can continue to make art, and where that art can reach the folks it's meant for.  Simple.  
 

Risks & Challenges
Well, let me start by telling you about my track record.  As an independent artist, I've released more than 16 albums over the course of my career.  (Some for grown ups, and some for children.)
So I've got some experience with this...  ;)
The challenges with a campaign like this really just boil down to timing.  When it comes to production and CD duplication, things can take longer than expected, so it's always possible I'll need to ask for your patience if the supply chain gets held up and I can't make my hoped for release timeline of early summer.
The other risk has to do with the campaign goal itself.  If we reach this goal, I'll be all set with the needed resources to release this album ASAP.If we don't reach the goal, I'll still release the album and fulfill all rewards, but it could take longer, since I'd then need to find another way to raise the needed funds.
But let's not go there...  
I'm determined to make this happen!  And together, I believe we can make it be!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Pledge early.  When you pledge during the first few days you help generate the momentum necessary for success.  As an added incentive, those who pledge during the first 48 hours will get a special bonus gift.  An unreleased song that will not be available anywhere else!
Spread the word.  Next to pledging, the single most helpful thing you can do is to help spread the word.  Know anyone who might love this project?  If so, send them an email, tag them in a FB post, or find any other way to share this page with them!   Sharing really, really helps, and I'm so grateful to you for spreading the word to your loved ones and communities.
Get updates.  Want to keep up to date on how the campaign is going?  Stay in the loop by joining my email list.  Your journey will begin with five days of free music, followed by regular updates, new music videos, live appearances, special, surprise perks, and more.

story:
Hola all!

We're Sweet Sixx and we're starting our first crowdfunding campaign in support of the upcoming album "SOFA KING BUENO".

This album is us expressing what we’ve been feeling over the last year and half during the Pandemic. The upcoming album "SOFA KING BUENO " began because 3 musicians after being locked down for so long decided to change their lives, move in together and begin recording and releasing music. 

Sixx and Sweet Living in Ensenada Baja California, asked their friend Miguel Korsa from Mexico City to move to the Pacific coast and start recording and releasing music. With very little resources or money, we scraped together enough with the help of friends to get this project started by bringing us together. Now we’re back asking for support. Now with your help we can get on the road and share the magic of Gypsy Blues! 

https://www.sweetsixx.com

What You Get

Your support can get you all 11 tracks of our Gypsy Blues album SOFA KING BUENO, which is a fusion of blues, swing and a variety of world grooves. Also our Sweet Sixx SOFA KING BUENO t-shirt, you also have the opportunity to celebrate with us on Oct 9, 2021; SOFA KING BUENO ALBUM Release Party!

What We Need

The proceeds from this campaign will be used to pay for the digital album downloadable cards, music videos and the ALBUM RELEASE TOUR. Approx. $2000 after fees and taxes are deducted. More can always help, but if you know anything about the music industry $2000 is a pretty small sum to launch a new album into the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? No problem! You can still help. HELP spread the word about this campaign and the new SOFA KING BUENO album on your favorite social media platforms. Or if you love music like we do, tell a friend in person or send them an email or direct message. We can’t tell you how much we appreciate any support you can give to our project. Muchas gracias and thank you!

story:
Thank you for stopping by Daddy's Records...

My name is Eric Barnes and along with my business partner/best friend are starting an online and retail record store. Andre Taylor and I met in school in the 5th grade ,on share day I can remember bringing in some of my favorite vinyl lps. I looked my class and noticed one of my classmates also brought in some vinyl records . I can remember the good time my classmates and I had listening to music all those years ago. Throughout school Andre and I remained friends collecting music and always thought it would be great to own a record store of our own.

Today , Andre Taylor and I remain friends and still collecting vinyl records. and after long thought and prayer we have decided to moved forward with the launch of Daddy's Records LLC.

Daddy's Records will specialize in vinyl records in Pop, Hip Hop, Soul, Jazz and Rock. We will also carry vinyl cleaning supplies, tee shirts , and plastic sleeves for your vinyl records.

To start our store is going to take $50,000.00 to launch our retail and online location.  Every single penny we make fore this campaign will go to the following , merchandising from vendors, buy used vinyl records for resale, preparing display shelves, getting the store customer ready and lastly securing retail location in Columbus Ohio. 

Lastly anything you give will be greatly appreciated,

Eric Barnes 

 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
*Note: This campaign is now complete and we smashed through our goal, thanks to over 100 amazing donors! We are now running a post-campaign version of this page, where we are still offering a few of our merch items for sale. Thank you to everyone who donated!

 

Our Story

We are Weekend Picnic! We're an emerging rock band from Minneapolis, MN with a goal of bringing you high energy, heavy hitting, accessible music with hooks and melodies that will have you head banging and singing along at the top of your lungs! Formed in 2019, Weekend Picnic is made up of Ehren on Vocals, Drew on drums, and Patrick and Ben on guitars. We are ecstatic to finally be able to announce that our self-titled debut album is coming out on March 12th!

In an effort to create the most polished product possible, we have searched out professionals to help us.  We have been hard at work in the studio all COVID long with our producer Ian Combs at RiverRock Studios and we are finally in the home stretch to debut our hard work.  In order for us to continue bringing you a high quality product we are hoping you can help us fund our passion and get some cool stuff while you’re at it!

This project has been incubating for quite some time and any contributions towards our merch and album will go a long way in reducing the financial burden associated with producing an album like this. Extra cash flow will also enable us to complement our album with exceptional music videos, increased merch offerings, and future music.
